Meet your new signature scent. 
When you meet someone, your fragrance is the first thing to introduce you before words leave your mouth. What do you want your scent to say? Are you a burst of energy fueled by bright citrus and fruits? Or maybe you like to be mysterious with sultry tonka beans and woods tickling the noses of every passerby.
A signature scent is also deeply personal; it can evoke particular memories, elicit a sense of comfort or nostalgia, and even help tell the world about your unique personality. Plus, fragrances can smell quite different on different skin types, which makes finding the best perfumes for women a personalized experience. 
‚ÄúFragrance is about the way it makes you feel,‚Äù explains Joan Tanis, national training and events director at Maison Francis Kurkjian. ‚ÄúWearing a scent that works with your specific body chemistry can also enhance your mood and even change behaviors. Fragrance encourages the release of endorphins, which makes us feel good.‚Äù
If you‚Äôre not sure exactly where to start on your scent journey, don‚Äôt fret. We‚Äôve scoured customer reviews and tested dozens of buzzy formulas to bring you some of the most exciting perfumes. From summer-centric lavender perfumes to mature vanilla and rich gender-fluid scents, we made it easy to uncover timeless classics or intriguingly unconventional blends‚Äîno matter your preference. And the best part? You can order a few samples to compare and contrast your favorites while still deciding, or go all-in on a full-size bottle that doubles as d√©cor once you‚Äôve nailed down your signature fragrance.Also worth noting: Many of these brands offer some amazing perfume gift sets, so you can treat your loved ones to the magical experience of (hopefully) finding their new go-to scents, too.

Dr. Sajic tells ELLE.com that collagen is a protein formulated with amino acids that provide structure, elasticity, and strength to both skin and hair. ‚ÄúAltogether around fifty-six percent or more of the amino acids in collagen are foundational for skin and hair proteins, and thus has a great ratio that will contribute directly to hair health and vitality,‚Äù Dr. Sajic explains. 
However, it‚Äôs essential to understand that while collagen can certainly help to solve some of your hair problems, maintaining a healthy diet is equally important. ‚ÄúOptimal hair health also requires a more comprehensive approach, including other proteins, vitamins, minerals, and care practices,‚Äù Dr. Sajic says. 
Although collagen is widely recognized for its ability to promote healthy hair and skin, this abundant protein also plays a crucial role in other bodily functions including joint health and bone health. ‚ÄúCollagen assists in maintaining the integrity of cartilage, which is essential for healthy joints, and it helps to maintain bone density, which is crucial for preventing age-related bone issues like osteoporosis,‚Äù Dr. Sajic explains. 
If you‚Äôre looking to target these areas of your body, or simply interested in a supplement that provides a cohesive approach, it‚Äôs worth incorporating collagen supplements into your daily wellness routine. 
Also to note, some collagen supplements are infused with additional nutrients that help to nourish the body. ‚ÄúCollagen supplements may also include vitamins like vitamin C, zinc, vitamin B, and omega-3s which further support your body and health,‚Äù Augustine says. 
So, we‚Äôve heard about all the wonderful benefits of collagen but are there any side effects? Dr. Sajic shares that although collagen is generally safe for most individuals, there are a few things to note. ‚ÄúSome may experience side effects like stomach discomfort, a bad taste or possible allergic reactions,‚Äù Dr. Sajic says. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs essential to choose high-quality collagen supplements and consult with a healthcare provider before starting any new supplement regimen,‚Äù he adds.
To avoid allergic reactions, or any added ingredients that might not sit well with your body, Augustine also suggests taking the time to thoroughly read the ingredient labels.  
‚ÄúYou should always talk to your health care provider before taking any oral supplements or medications,‚Äù says Augustine. She also explains that consulting a healthcare professional is especially important if you are taking daily medications or have serious drug or food allergies.
Dr. Sajic shares that those with fish, pork, or bovine allergies should avoid collagen, as many collagen supplements are derived from these animal sources. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs also important to talk to your doctor if you have liver or kidney disease, as the excess protein may put extra stress on these organs,‚Äù he adds. 
Collagen supplements exist in many forms‚Äî including liquid, powder, and capsules‚Äî but they all have relatively equal effects. "There are not enough non-bias studies to suggest that one is better than the other,‚Äù Augustine shares. 
At the end of the day, it simply boils down to your personal preferences, lifestyle, and dietary restrictions. ‚ÄúLiquid collagen can be consumed directly or mixed into beverages, while powder can be added to smoothies, coffee, or baked goods,‚Äù Dr. Sajic says. If you would prefer not to mix collagen with your food or drink, you can always take a capsule. However, Dr. Sajic notes that depending on the capsule, it might not be absorbed as efficiently as other forms of collagen. 
‚ÄúFor most people, collagen should be taken once daily,‚Äù Dr. Sajic says. ‚ÄúDosage can range from 2.5 to 15 grams daily, depending on the individual‚Äôs age, health, and specific skin or hair concerns.‚Äù And as with anything, patience and consistency is key, so make sure that you keep track of your collagen intake. ‚ÄúIt may take several weeks, if not three to four months, for you to start noticing the benefits of collagen supplements,‚Äù Dr. Sajic adds.
Dr. Dusan Sajic is a board-certified medical and cosmetic dermatologist, the director of the Derma Skin Institute, and the creator of  Sajic Skin.
Shannon Augustine, NP is a is a board certified nurse practitioner and self-proclaimed expert injector at  SkinSpirit.

title: Spring 2024 Makeup Trends We Love from Fashion Week
text:
Fresh off the runway. 
It‚Äôs the most wonderful time of the year‚Äîno, it‚Äôs not the holidays (yet); however, it is a fashion holiday: fashion month. And while you may be eyeing the celebs sitting front row or dreaming of your next outfit, the runway is the perfect place to discover what‚Äôs next in beauty. 
This season, the crystal ball, er, runway, proved that even though we‚Äôre not masking up as frequently (rethink that: Covid cases are rising), eyes are a major focus and using color as a way of expression. Skin is in‚Äîwith fresh faces and dewy skin taking priority on the runway. In fact, this season, many skincare brands, prepped models‚Äô skin for the runway. After all, if you want great looking makeup, you must take care of its base: Your face. Brandon Maxwell leaned into a skin-focused beauty look, utilizing Noble Panacea products for a hydrated, fresh glow. 
Do you want to peek into the future to see what‚Äôs in store for 2024? Katie Jane Hughes, celebrity makeup artist and founder of KJH.brand whose clients include Hailey Bieber and Karlie Kloss as well as Kim Baker, celebrity makeup artist and founder of Glamazon Beauty divulge to ELLE.com all top Spring 2024 makeup trends, fresh off the runway!
Graphic liner, floating eyeliner‚Äîwhatever you want to call it, it‚Äôs a vibe and you will see it all Spring/Summer 2024. This graphic liner look on Paloma Elsesser at Eckhaus Latta gives a butterfly wing effect and plays up her high cheekbones. 
‚ÄúI love how a graphic eye can be an accessory to your look,‚Äù shares Katie Jane Hughes in response to the Jil Sander show at Milan Fashion Week.
Celebrity makeup artist and Lanc√¥me Global International Makeup Artist Sheika Dailey took us to the year 3000 with this futuristic cat eye. Playing with negative space and floating lines in the inner eye, ups the sex appeal of this sultry look. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs editorial yet still super wearable and sexy,‚Äù says Hughes. You can read more about the look, here.
‚ÄúI predict that the Spring/Summer ‚Äô24 makeup trends are going to be all about vibrant, bold, color eyeliners,‚Äù shares Glamazon Beauty founder and celebrity makeup artist Kim Baker. Curious as to which colors? Baker says, ‚ÄúEyeliner in bold over the top shades such as Periwinkle, royal blue, vibrant red, and shocking pink‚Äù will be all over the lids of trendsetters and beauty girlies next spring.
Hughes also agrees that color eyeliner is a big Spring/Summer ‚Äô24 trend. ‚ÄúI love how they matched the eye look to the fashion at Helmut Lang,‚Äù says Hughes. ‚ÄúIn 2024, the vibrant color lined eye will dominate the street and our makeup bag,‚Äù adds Baker.
Don‚Äôt have colored eyeliner? You can fake it with eyeshadow. ‚ÄúWe saw royal blue being used at shows such as Altier Ndigo. Makeup artist T. Cooper used the shade ‚ÄòOshun‚Äô featured in the Supreme Being Palette by Glamazon Beauty to create a killer eye look that works for runway to real-way,‚Äù says Baker.
For Spring/Summer ‚Äô24, imperfection is perfection. And while we normally see this trend with the hair, this season, it‚Äôs visible with makeup in a bold, bright way. The mismatched eyeshadow seen at Chopova Lowena was a favorite for Hughes. She shares, ‚ÄúI think this is a really cool and fresh take on how to do eyeshadow that is unusual and out of the box.‚Äù
At Phillip Lim 3.1, this neon, one shadow look plays up negative space in opposite accords.
‚ÄúThe look I kept seeing across the board was glowing skin. Everyone had dewy, glowing skin and I can‚Äôt think of a better feature to play up for Spring and Summer,‚Äù says Baker. At Retrofete, it was all about sexy, glowy, and hydrated skin. Elyse Reneau, Executive Director of Global Beauty at Too Faced states, ‚ÄúHumidity has never looked so sculpted!‚Äù 
At Altuzurra, celebrity makeup artist Diane Kendal showcased her famous ‚Äúflawless face‚Äù technique that she developed early in her career. It focuses on making skin look as radiant and perfect as possible, using minimal makeup.
Mermaidcore gets an update for Spring/Summer ‚Äô24. At Sandy Liang, rhinestones were placed haphazardly around the eyes to mimic barnacles. Into this look? You can read our full take on it, here.
Mermaidcore is more than just rhinestones and shades of blue and green. Jason Wu‚Äôs interpretation highlights healthy skin. ‚ÄúInspired by Jason‚Äôs vision of experiencing rebirth after a shipwreck, we crafted a cohesive makeup look that exuded a dewy, aquatic allure,‚Äù shares Kendal, who was the Lead Makeup Artist. Wu‚Äôs Kindness For Your Lips Lip Oil was applied on the high cheekbones for a luminous glow.
If a sensual siren decided to attend a rave, this look is how I envision their makeup. The amalgamation of blue, green, and yellow mimics underwater coral reefs and is a festival of color for the eyes. Somewhere, somehow, I think Ariel would approve.

title: The 25 Best ‚ÄòSex and the City‚Äô Guest Stars
text:
I couldn't help but wonder, who hasn't been on SATC?
For six seasons, Sex and the City was a revolving door for actors and actresses who were either fans of the show, friends of the show, or up-and-comers who just wanted to be part of the action. Some played versions of themselves (Matthew McConaughey, Lucy Liu), while others were barely recognizable (a young Kat Dennings, Andy Cohen). Here, a look back at some of the famous faces who crossed paths with Carrie, Samantha, Miranda, and Charlotte over the years.
All episodes are available to stream on Max
Jack (Bradley Cooper) was bad news from the beginning. As Carrie says in the episode, "They Shoot Single People, Don't They?" Jack was everything she needed at 2 a.m. on a Tuesday at a gay bar: single, straight, smoker. It could've been the greasy hair, the tempting smoking habit (she was trying really hard to quit), or the fact that Jack later discovered Carrie's "Single & Fabulous?" New York Magazine cover story ‚Äî the two never did anything more than make out in a crowded bar and briefly, in his convertible. 
In ‚ÄúThe Perfect Present,‚Äù Carrie, Samantha, Charlotte, and Miranda head to a purse party thrown by the recently dumped Vanessa, played by the queen of the bend-and-snap. ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt life funny? Because of that fucker, I‚Äôve discovered, I‚Äôm Fendi!‚Äù she says in the episode, moments before walking into Samantha and Smith (in his pre-Gus Van Sant days) boning against several glass racks. 
Geri Halliwell played Phoebe, someone Samantha runs into on one of the hottest days of the summer. While fanning herself, Samantha learns (via Phoebe) that the pool at Soho House is the place to be, that is, if you can get past the waiting list. Enter: Annabelle Bronstein, whose membership card Samantha finds in the bathroom and uses a few times before her jig is up.
Between the end of The X-Files (the OG run) and the beginning of Californication, David Duchovny guest starred on several TV shows including Sex and the City. He played Jeremy, Carrie‚Äôs high school boyfriend (sorry, "sweetheart") who completely sweeps her off her feet before revealing he‚Äôs starting treatment at a mental institution in Connecticut. Here he is welcoming Carrie to the Juneau Spears Center, a place harder to get into (and out) of than the Soho House.
Justin Theroux had the distinct honor of guest starring on SATC twice. On the season one episode, ‚ÄúThe Monogamists,‚Äù Justin played Jared, a writer friend of Stanford‚Äôs who had a thing for giving the thumbs-up and was named one of  New York Magazine‚Äôs ‚Äú30 Coolest People Under 30.‚Äù His character didn‚Äôt venture too far in the occupation department the second time around; on the season two episode ‚ÄúShortcomings,‚Äù Justin played Vaughn, a fiction writer who orgasms too fast (hence, the episode‚Äôs title). 
In the same episode where Samantha famously said, ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt believe in the Republican party or the Democratic party; I believe in parties,‚Äù Elizabeth Banks checked off one of her very first TV roles. In ‚ÄúPolitically Erect,‚Äù Elizabeth played Catherine, the pearl-wearing fianc√©e of a politician Charlotte had set her eyes on at a fundraiser. According to Catherine, she met Bob, the fianc√©e, at a party where women brought guys they didn't want to date, leading a martini-filled Charlotte to mumble something about one women's trash becoming another's treasure.
John Slattery played politician Bill Kelley, who was running for city treasurer and famously told Carrie, "I love making love with you," before asking her to pee on him in the shower. When Carrie offered to "dribble warm tea" on him instead, Bill dumped her, citing that his campaign advisors didn't like her sex column. This of course, led Carrie to write a bit called, "To Pee or Not To Pee?" without using his real name. "It was much more political not to," she said on the episode.
Reason #2409 why you should never date someone you meet at your therapist‚Äôs office: Seth, played by Jon Bon Jovi in ‚ÄúGames People Play.‚Äù In the episode, Seth takes Carrie out to dinner, plays a sexy game of Twister, and tells her he‚Äôs in therapy because he‚Äôs ‚Äúreally fucked up about women‚Ä¶ after I sleep with them I lose interest‚Äù ‚Äî after sleeping with Carrie.
Remember when Samantha used Lucy Liu‚Äôs name for a Birkin bag that had a 5-year waiting list? On ‚ÄúCoulda, Woulda, Shoulda,‚Äù Samantha committed this very crime ‚Äì a travesty in the PR world ‚Äì and got caught by Lucy, who played herself on the episode.
In the L.A.-set episode, appropriately titled "Escape From New York," SMG played Debbie, the "most ambitious and feared creature," according to Carrie. Debbie was a junior development executive who really, really wanted to make a movie out of Carrie's columns. She also predicted that the movie would be "chick flick big" before declaring that the man who came up with that term "should have his balls cut off."
In the same L.A. episode as SMG, Matthew McConaughey played a hyper version of himself who was interested in Carrie's movie and her columns. In a cringe-worthy business meeting, the SATC version of Matthew declared that he wanted to play Mr. Big and sleep with Carrie, all while biting on a toothpick. "We are animals, men, women, walking the earth," he said in this scene. "We are made of head, heart, and loins. We're talking about using them, am I right?" Nah. Carrie was good, which is why she GTFO of there.
Before she was Bailey on Grey‚Äôs Anatomy, Chandra Wilson played a cop who confronted Samantha about her Richard ‚ÄúCHEATER‚Äù posters in the episode titled "Anchors Away." When Samantha explained, ‚ÄúThis man said he loved me, and I caught him eating another woman‚Äôs pussy,‚Äù the extremely understanding cop backed off in full support of this public shaming.
Carrie‚Äôs columns never did turn into a movie, but they did turn into a book thanks to the brains of Lily Martin, book agent, played by Molly Shannon. Together with Courtney Masterson (Amy Sedaris; see next slide), Lily transformed Carrie's words  into something with a spine. At their first meeting, Lily got right to the point: ‚ÄúIs it hopeful? What's the message? What‚Äôs your point of view, after all the break ups and disappointments and train wrecks? You still believe he‚Äôs out there, right?‚Äù That gasp you heard? Millions of people asking why after all these years, Lily still knows what they‚Äôre thinking. 
When she was not finishing Lily‚Äôs sentences, Courtney (Amy Sedaris) was busy introducing future lovers to each other. Case in point: Carrie and Berger, who met while Carrie was in a book meeting with Courtney at her office. Hard to believe this relationship eventually ended with a Post-it note by way of The Hamptons, motorcycle rides, and a white noise machine that only took Carrie to the rainforest.
Before he was Tag on Friends, Eddie Cahill played Sean, Carrie‚Äôs bisexual ‚Äúgeneration-something else‚Äù fling that she met at a party celebrating his ‚Äúinternet magazine‚Ä¶ that I still couldn‚Äôt find on my computer.‚Äù Carrie Bradshaw and her internet talk! Despite the fact that they had a great time on her ice skating date (she smoked and drank on the ice like a rebellious young!) Carrie was not prepared for where he took her to next: a party attended by the next SATC guest star on this list...
... Alanis! On "Boy, Girl, Boy Girl.." the Canadian singer played Dawn, who kisses Carrie in a game of spin the bottle. Following the experience, which "wasn't bad, kind of like chicken," Carrie went home and confirmed that she was indeed  "too old to play this game." Other than Carrie's giant flower brooch (which of course got an update in one of the movies), this kiss was a shining moment for the episode.
To give back, Charlotte volunteered to be a guide for the blind on season six. Part of her training required walking in public with a mask and a guide to experience what the blind experience. Enter: Carrie, who fails miserably as Charlotte's guide. I guess this is why you shouldn't perform these training exercises at a Barneys, especially with stellar shoe salesmen like this one, played by SJP's real-life BFF Andy Cohen, around.
There was no one better than Kat Dennings for the role of Jenny Brier, a bratty, lip-gloss wearing 13-year-old who asks Samantha to plan her Bat Mitzvah on season three. When Samantha hesitates, Jenny name drops Carson Daly and "The Clintons" (who "of course can't make it") before casually revealing her bank account: "We'd be lucky if we can swing this for under a mil." To which Samantha responds, "We'll never get *NSYNC."
On an episode titled "Easy Come, Easy Go," Samantha has a fling with Adam, a director who has well, funky spunk. When he says she's just trying to avoid blowjobs and that they're "easy," Samantha, arguably the best sex-ed teacher (and life coach) on TV, launches into one of the most memorable SATC speeches: "I love giving head. Easy? You men have no idea what we're dealing with down there. Teeth placement, jaw stress, suction, gag reflex, all the while bobbing up and down trying to breathe through our noses. Easy? Honey, they don't call it a job for nothing." Mic. Drop.
On season four, Margaret Cho played Lynne, a fashion show producer who recruits Carrie to walk in a show that features New Yorkers and models alike. ‚ÄúNo one is more New York or has more style than you,‚Äù she says on the episode, ‚ÄúThe Real Me.‚Äù When Carrie hesitates, Lynne delivers another convincing command: ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre fucking doing my show. If I have to hunt you down, skin you alive, and have one of the models fucking wear you.‚Äù The only problem with this character was that there was not enough of her. Imagine her having a showdown with Samantha?
Peggy is Cosmopolitan.com‚Äôs entertainment writer, specializing in Leonardo DiCaprio, This Is Us, and the royals. She‚Äôs also a proud Canadian and pug lover. When Peggy‚Äôs not obsessing over Leo‚Äôs latest lover or gut size, she can be found watching old episodes of Friends or Gilmore Girls. Her dream is to one day live on a pug farm and write children‚Äôs books, with illustrations by her very talented husband Greg.

title: What Princess Diana's 1989 Tour of New York City Looked Like in Real Life

While the events of The Crown mostly take place in the U.K., the show does occasionally go State-side. There was Princess Margaret's trip to Washington, D.C. in Season 3, and now, we have Princess Diana's three-day tour of New York in Season 4. The Netflix series recreates the royal's visit to the Big Apple in 1989, where she attended a gala, visited settlement housing complex, and spent time with children with AIDS, solidifying her title as "the People's Princess."
Unlike her tour of Australia years prior with Prince Charles and Prince William, Diana traveled solo for the engagements abroad. But even by herself, she won the hearts of New Yorkers. Ahead, take a look at what Diana did during her time in NYC.

The princess wears a red Catherine Walker skirt suit while visiting the AIDS unit at Harlem Hospital. She met several children suffering from the illness before ending her trip to New York.

title: 65 Vintage Photos of Old Hollywood Stars on Their Honeymoon
text:
Including Eddie Fisher and Debbie Reynolds's nautical getaway. 
Marrying the love of your life shouldn't be followed by any old vacation‚Äîespecially when you're a celebrity who is used to the glitz and glamour that comes with stardom. And while some of these famous marriages eventually ended in heartache‚Äîand often dramatic, messy divorces‚Äîthat doesn't mean we shouldn't look back at the happy times. Here, rare photos offer a peek inside the most lavish Old Hollywood honeymoons, from Elizabeth Taylor and Eddie Fisher's Italian escape to Marilyn Monroe and Joe DiMaggio's Japanese getaway.
Two of the most talked-about stars of the '20s, Pickford and Fairbanks, travel by ship on their European honeymoon. Here, they are docked in London.
Lord Mountbatten‚Äîa.k.a. Prince Philip's uncle‚Äîand his bride Edwina head to New York for their honeymoon aboard an ocean liner called Majestic.
Queen Elizabeth's parents, Prince Albert and Elizabeth Bowes-Lyon (later King George VI and Queen Elizabeth the Queen Mother, respectively) were married in 1923. They honeymooned in Polesden Lacy, an estate in Great Bookham, England.
Suitcase in hand, the American screen star and his actress wife arrive in Rome for their honeymoon. They got married on February 9 in London.
The movie stars relax on a Santa Monica beach just a few months after their October 1933 nuptials. 
Four decades before he was President, Reagan was an actor and married future Academy Award-winner Jane Wyman. Here, they play ping pong at the El Mirador Hotel in Palm Springs.
The actress and artist spent their honeymoon in the White Mountains in New Hampshire, after making a stop in Mexico City for a little R&R first. 
A few years before she took the throne, then-Princess Elizabeth married the Duke of Edinburgh. Here, they walk through the leaves outside the Broadlands Estate, an English country house where they spent their honeymoon.
The automobile heir and tire heiress enjoy the waves at Cambridge Beaches in Bermuda.
After her fourth wedding, the actress and her socialite husband touch down in England for their honeymoon.
After saying "I do" in the Santa Francesca Romana church in Rome, the actor and actress hit the Italian Alps in Cervinia.
An 18-year-old Taylor celebrates her wedding to the hotel heir‚Äîwhich was hailed as the Hollywood social event of the year‚Äîby honeymooning in London.
The actress and businessman taste a celebratory cake aboard the S.S. United States  on their way to Europe for their honeymoon.
While in Capri, Italy, the star looks glamorous in a tunic and sandals in the sun.
You can probably guess by the actor and model's tropical shirts and leis where they honeymooned following their wedding on a ranch near Solvang, California: beautiful Hawaii, of course.
The happy couple sits by the water.
Following their nuptials, actors Barrymore and Wilcox traveled to the sunny shores of Miami Beach, where they stayed at the Sherry-Frontenac Hotel.
A private moment between the singer and actress was caught on camera, while they stroll along a Miami beach hand in hand.  
Jamie Lee Curtis's mom and dad honeymooned in the Big Apple, arriving at their hotel suite at the famous Waldorf Astoria. 
The football player and actress smile for a photo before heading to Mexico City for their romantic getaway.

title: Gemini Monthly Horoscope
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
(May 21 - June 20)
Ready to add some spice to your fall escapades, Gemini? After a challenging three months‚Äîwith love planet Venus AND your ruler, Mercury, both in signal-scrambling retrograde‚Äîyou should finally start to feel back on your game. Your jokes will earn cackles instead of cancellations, and your fans will stop being impervious to your charms. Now that‚Äôs more like it!
Enjoy this lift while the Sun is in Libra and your fifth house of passion, fame and magnetism through October 23, amplified by energizer Mars, which is in Libra until October 12. It may be cuffing season, but you probably won‚Äôt want to be tied to any one person when there are so many enticing choices.
In the second half of October, eclipse season gets underway. The year‚Äôs last two game-changing lunar events arrive on October 14 and 28. The first one, a Libra solar eclipse, happens at the October 14 new moon. This could bring a romantic connection or a creative opportunity, perhaps even some fame, when you least expect it.
Your spiritual life is in the spotlight at the October 28 lunar eclipse in Taurus and your twelfth house of surrender and serendipity. It‚Äôs time to let go of something you‚Äôve been trying to control or desperately hold onto. This is the grand finale of a two-year Taurus/Scorpio eclipse series that‚Äôs rippled across your health, wellness and soul sectors since November 2021.
With so much to process, you may actually feel relieved that all five of the slow-moving outer planets‚ÄîJupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune and Pluto‚Äîare retrograde this whole month. The only exception is Pluto, which will turn direct (forward) in Capricorn and your deep-diving eighth house on October 10. Use this modulated pace to process all the changes from this year and get yourself centered. Eclipse season is bound to deliver its share of surprises.
Scorpio season will also lend a helping hand. As the Sun spends a month in your orderly and clear-thinking sixth house starting October 23, you can break things down into bite-sized manageable steps. That long list seems a lot less daunting when you tackle it a piece at a time.
On the shiny-happy side of things, the Sun is making its annual visit to Libra and your pleasure-seeking, playful fifth house until October 23. A touch of ‚Äúfall fever‚Äù could overtake you as el Sol gives the frisky side of your Gemini nature cosmic permission to roam free.¬†
The leaves won‚Äôt be the only things putting their fiery colors on display! Sizzling Mars is also in Libra until October 12, adding a dash of drama and sending your charisma off the charts. During these glamorous and giddy three weeks, you‚Äôll be the life of every party as you hold court and build your fanbase. It‚Äôs is also a richly creative time, with the Sun warming up this expressive zone of your chart. Share your talents and nurture your artistic abilities. When the Sun is in this be-here-now zone, your best bet is to immerse yourself fully in the moment‚Ä¶your most direct path to joy.
Watch for challenging fireworks on October 8, when Mars locks into a heated square with power-tripping Pluto, which is in your eighth house of intimacy and control. A fast-moving attraction could be stalled by your unwillingness (or theirs) to get truly vulnerable. Surrender is required at a certain point‚Äîbut how soon is too soon? Some old trust issues could flare up.¬†
Before you just react to those raw emotions, which you‚Äôll be tempted to do under this powder-keg transit, look inward at what‚Äôs really driving up your fears or resistance. Don‚Äôt slam the drawbridge on a budding connection before you do! On the flip side, if you‚Äôre obsessing over someone, the Mars-Pluto square could spin you into tunnel vision if you‚Äôre not careful. Much as you‚Äôd like to control this situation, Gemini, people resent being micromanaged. YOU certainly do!
And if that weren‚Äôt enough, there‚Äôs a whole lot more activation energy afoot as Pluto, the planet all things hidden, makes its presence again after a five-month retrograde. Since May 1, Pluto‚Äôs been back-spinning through Aquarius and your visionary ninth house (until June 11), then Capricorn and your zone of merging, intimacy and shared possessions.¬†
Over the summer and early fall, you may have done some deep soul-searching and released turbulent emotions, like shame, resentment and codependence. Pluto‚Äôs retrograde might also have revealed fissures in your closest relationships. An ex could have resurfaced, driving up jealousy or suppressed desires. Button-pushing people may have acted as ‚Äúmirrors‚Äù who reflected something you needed to examine within yourself. Anyone that you‚Äôre in a financial, emotional or sexual entanglement with could have been the source of a power struggle.
If you happen to have buried any feelings (retrogrades can cause us to suppress and avoid certain emotions), Pluto‚Äôs pivot back to forward motion could drive them up once again. Have you been unsure whether to trust someone or get financially entwined? Clarity could arrive over the next couple weeks. Aim to be more aboveboard with the people in your life.¬†
On October 14, the year‚Äôs only Libra new moon arrives, awakening your fifth house of passion, pleasure and expression. Even better? This one is a potent solar eclipse, the very first one to make landfall in Libra since 2016.¬†
The eclipse could also bring love out of the blue! It will set off a six-month cycle that draws you out of your head (the Gemini ‚Äúsafety zone‚Äù) and helps you drop into your heart a little more. See what happens if you allow your emotions to roam free instead of trying to manage them. Your life could start to feel richer and more alive! Think: less control, more ‚Äúcarpe diem.‚Äù
Eclipses can bring surprises and sudden plot twists. In your fertile fifth house, this could bring unexpected baby news to Geminis of the childbearing set. Others might birth an amazing creative idea. This eclipse will prod you onto center stage, whether that means getting glam new headshots, booking a performance or just sharing more openly without caring about what anyone thinks.
Don‚Äôt worry, you don‚Äôt have to make this change all at once. Between now and March 2025, eclipses will travel over the Aries/Libra axis, pushing you to be a bigger star AND a great team player. Today is a spotlight moment for you, Gemini. Step into that beam and let your personality rip. Don‚Äôt overthink it!
And‚Ä¶cut! Fall friskiness and flamboyance give way to cleaner, greener days as the Sun moves into Scorpio and activates your sixth house of efficiency and wellness for a month. Get ready to turn over a new leaf amid the turning leaves. Before the holiday hedonism kicks into gear, use these coming four weeks to start some healthy habits and regular routines around eating, sleeping and exercise. With energizer Mars also in Scorpio from October 12 to November 24, you‚Äôve got an added dose of motivation. Start wherever you are‚Äîthe key is to get going and let the momentum build.
Let‚Äôs face it: You are far more productive when you get a full night‚Äôs sleep, incorporate regular exercise in your lifestyle and eat your dark leafy greens. Sure, you can sneak in a little Halloween candy, but you‚Äôll feel so much better if you also harvest recipes for healthy, anti-inflammatory and plant-based treats. Aim for moderation now, instead of extremes.¬†
The sixth house rules helpful people, service and systems. Scorpio season is a great time to corral any chaos at work or home with a deep clean and decluttering, especially with Mars putting the wind in your sails. Take inventory of Team Gemini and make sure everyone‚Äôs feeling clear and connected. Tweak plans for the rest of the year and set a couple of ambitious ‚Äústretch goals‚Äù for between now and Black Friday.¬†
Get ready‚Ä¶the last eclipse of 2023 will arrive just a few days shy of Halloween. It‚Äôs also the grand finale of an eclipse series that‚Äôs rippled across the Taurus/Scorpio axis since November 2021, reshaping your approach to health, healing, work and wellbeing.¬†
On October 28, the annual Taurus full moon, a partial lunar eclipse, floods your twelfth house of healing and closure with its ‚Äúlet it go‚Äù prompts. Is it time to release someone or something, Gemini? If you‚Äôre hanging on to a person, situation or behavior that just isn‚Äôt giving you life anymore, it‚Äôs time to radically redirect those tides.¬†
You might literally walk away, sure, but leaving isn‚Äôt always the answer. As the saying goes, ‚ÄúWherever you go, there you are.‚Äù Maybe a better focus would be to try to transform the situation by NOT trying to control, micromanage or save it. This full moon could be a powerful portal for a spiritual message‚Äîdon‚Äôt dismiss any strong intuitive flashes or inner guidance! An escape, preferably near water, could reset you and help you download some divine inspiration.¬†
Look back to the May 19 Taurus new moon for clues of what could come to fruition now. Where do you need support, including spiritual and emotional? This lunar eclipse is about receiving. Lean on your tried-and-true champions or seek new ones, such as a therapist or healer.
In sync with the lunar eclipse, lucky Jupiter in Taurus will oppose combative Mars in Scorpio. As you grow and expand in new directions, you may feel increasing stress from the people in your life. Their demands and needs could be at odds with your own need for greater independence. At this eclipse, you‚Äôre encouraged to fully use your voice and self-advocate, Bull. If you don‚Äôt have the capacity to take care of others now, simply let them now instead of getting angry or rebellious. Remember: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù is a complete sentence!
The first week of the month is a social one, as Venus rounds out a four-month visit to Leo and your chatty, interactive third house. The other love planet, spicy Mars, is in Libra and your passionate fifth house until October 12. A fall fling or some epic date nights could start the month of right. On October 14, the Libra solar eclipse could bring a brand-new chapter to your love story, with someone new or the person you‚Äôre with.
On October 8, Venus ends a long visit to Leo that began on June 5 and included a challenging retrograde from July 22 to September 3. Now, the love planet moves on to Virgo, activating your fourth house of home, family and emotional foundations until November 8.¬†
With tender Venus ensconced in Virgo, you‚Äôll feel the magnetic pull of Chez Virgo and a desire to spend more time around your closest people. If you‚Äôre in a relationship, you might want to zip yourselves into your couple bubble and not emerge till after Thanksgiving! While you‚Äôre in there, share a few vulnerable confessions and be receptive to theirs. ¬†
If you live with your S.O., you might be inspired to refeather your shared nest, whether it‚Äôs with a major home-improvement project or just some decorating changes. Single Geminis might need to pry yourselves out of the house and into some good mingling settings. Grab a chatty wingperson to keep you from bailing or sneaking off early.
Meanwhile, over in your passionate fifth house, lusty Mars is stoking your libido as it makes its biennial blaze through Libra and your pleasure sector until October 12. Whether you‚Äôre single or attached, the first half of the month grants you head-turning magnetism and major mojo‚Äîplus, plenty of options to choose from, especially at the October 14 Libra solar eclipse.¬†
Make the most of this glamorous cycle by dressing up and enjoying all the attention you effortlessly attract. For some Twins, a casual flirtation could heat up to full consummation. (Note: This could come with a side of drama since Mars can drive up jealousy and competitiveness.) Longtime couples will enjoy these sizzling vibes, which, P.S., also shed ideal babymaking mood lighting if you‚Äôre of that mindset!
Once lusty Mars zips into Scorpio on October 12, you‚Äôre lit with motivational energy until November 24. Surprise: You‚Äôll be as pumped about spreadsheets as you are about Spin class. Before you shoot for the moon, though, make sure your tanks are filled with rocket fuel (read: clean, vitamin-rich food and enough cash to pull off the plan). Single Geminis could meet someone while engaged in healthy pursuits. Paired-up Twins can get closer by tackling a shared project or fitness goal. The magic is in the mundane!
Turn your passion into profits! With activator Mars in Libra and your creative, spotlight-grabbing fifth house until October 12, one of your talents could take hold of public attention. You‚Äôre one of the most creative and naturally entertaining signs, so it won‚Äôt be surprising when you capture the attention of a fascinated (and fascinating) fanbase. The October 14 Libra solar (new moon) eclipse is an especially fortunate date to put your bolder ideas into the public sphere.
When Mars moves into Scorpio from October 12 to November 24, you‚Äôre ready to bring the sharp edges back to your life. Scorpio rules your sixth house of systems, order and helpful people. You may need to corral Team Gemini into shape‚Äîor, if you‚Äôre a party of one, start delegating and outsourcing tasks that have become procrastination points for you. Instead of DIY-ing, find a capable specialist who can knock it out in a few hours. It will be well worth the investment, even if it doesn‚Äôt seem like it at first.¬†
Mars in Scorpio is a motivating time to organize and declutter before the holidays begin. Tackle one task (or micro-task) each day and you‚Äôll have plenty to be thankful for by the time turkey is served and the Christmas lights start twinkling.

title: Taurus Monthly Horoscope
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
(April 20 - May 20)
Did back-to-school season get off to a slow start, Taurus? Fear not! You‚Äôre actually right in sync with the stars. For the first three weeks of the month, the Sun is in Libra and your systematic, sensible sixth house. Energizer Mars is also riding through Libra in tandem until October 12, fueling your resolve to get healthy and organized.
It also happens to be eclipse season as the two final lunar events arrive on October 14 and 28. The first one, a Libra solar eclipse, comes at the October 14 new moon to really boost up your work and wellness efforts. Then, the grand finale of a two-year Taurus/Scorpio eclipse series finishes off the month. Brace yourself, Bull: The October 28 lunar eclipse is in YOUR sign and will bring all of the personal growth work you‚Äôve done since November 2021 together with a flourish.
This ‚Äúuncorking‚Äù will be a welcome change after a sluggish summer. Although all five of the slow-moving outer planets will be retrograde (backward) this month, that trend starts to reach an end.
On October 10, alchemical Pluto will end a five-month retrograde that began on May 1, splitting its time in Aquarius (until June 11) and Capricorn. Pluto‚Äôs reversal made you deeply rethink your career and what inspires you. As Pluto emerges from this season of soul-searching, you‚Äôll have a chance to explore how to add some soul to your goals.
Partnerships take center stage starting October 23, when the Sun dives into Scorpio and your relationship sector for a month. Explore those ties that have dynamic-duo potential, but wait until that big Taurus eclipse on October 28 to make any binding decisions.
Eclipses are famous for bringing curveballs and surprises, or at least for revealing hidden information. Whether it‚Äôs a trick or a treat, it could take until Halloween before you can really see the whole picture. Give the energy a few days to settle‚Äîsome new information could be revealed. As a steady Taurus, you understand the power of waiting and collecting ALL of your options before making a decision. Follow those natural instincts now!
Ready to bring those crisp edges back, Taurus? The stars are lined up to support your efforts this month, whether you‚Äôre doing a deep clean and declutter, mapping out a project plan or starting healthy habits. With the Sun in Libra and your sixth house of well-being and organization until October 23, it‚Äôs time to prioritize the practical.¬†
Virgo season, which ended on September 23, is typically an indulgent time for you. If you tipped too far into hedonism, the Libra Sun helps you return to balanced living. Think: consistent mealtimes, movement and sleeping hours. To power up your efficiency efforts, energizer Mars is making its biennial visit to Libra until October 12. You‚Äôre ready to tackle whatever ‚Äúproblem spot‚Äù you set your sights on‚Äîand to be as proactive and solution-oriented as possible.¬†
Mars in Libra can also rev you up to get a fall fitness plan underway. But be sure to stretch your muscles and warm up before workouts. The hasty red planet can make you accident-prone and susceptible to strains or injury. Monitor your stress levels to keep your health in check now too.¬†
One day that could find you racked with indecision‚Äîand stressed about it‚Äîis October 8, when anxious Mars locks into a high-pressure square with power-tripping Pluto.¬†
Mars is in Libra and your analytical sixth house, which could drive up anxiety and make you feel overwhelmed by all the details. Pluto in your expansive ninth house can serve up big schemes and dreams. But putting an actual plan in place, which is usually a Taurus specialty, might fall apart. Your inner control freak will want to micromanage the process‚Äîor your mind will spin through all the reasons ‚Äúthis can‚Äôt work.‚Äù¬†
Is this a fear of success‚Ä¶or of failure? Maybe both. Either way, don‚Äôt let the intensity get the best of you. Examine the concerns that arise and conduct due diligence. But don‚Äôt empower the intense fear or emotion behind those factors.
As Pluto powers forward in Capricorn and your ninth house of higher education until January, you might consider returning to school. Don‚Äôt rush into any major degree programs, Bull. More likely, this transit could draw you into a course or workshop on a specific topic, perhaps even something related to personal growth and transformation.¬†
Sometimes you have to dive deep to excavate your purpose‚Äîand bottomless Pluto will happily pull you into those recesses. With expansive Jupiter and changemaker Uranus both in Taurus (but retrograde) for a long stretch, self-realization work could unearth a treasure! It won‚Äôt be an overnight process, but it‚Äôs one well worth exploring. Follow your curiosity!
The Libra new moon on October 14 is a solar eclipse, making it particularly auspicious for starting a new habit, work project or wellness practice. With holiday hedonism on the horizon, regular exercise and clean eating will help balance out the impending temptations that will be way too good to resist. Want to get more in tune with the rhythms of your spending patterns, health and time management? There‚Äôs an app for that; install a few!¬†
The sixth house rules service, so look for volunteer opportunities or initiate a giving drive at work. Bonus points if you round up a few friends and turn your do-gooding into a social occasion. Since pets also fall under this new moon‚Äôs domain, pay attention to the unconditionally loving critters in your life. If you‚Äôre thinking of adopting, start your search.¬†
This new moon will sit opposite wounded warrior Chiron in Aries and your twelfth house of closure. Are you still holding onto past pain or feeling like life is somehow stacked against you? Even if it‚Äôs an unconscious pattern (and it probably is), this eclipse‚Äîand the ensuing eclipses on the Aries/Libra axis touching down until March 2025‚Äîare taking you through an important healing cycle. Get support when it feels like you‚Äôre falling apart instead of pretending you‚Äôve got it all together. There are no awards being handed out for perfectionists and martyrs, especially not now!
If the eclipse‚Äôs messaging wasn‚Äôt loud enough, the universe sends out another call for you to lean on the people in your life. On October 23, the Sun enters Scorpio and your zone of dynamic duos for a month. Forget about using that old ‚ÄúI‚Äôll just do it all myself!‚Äù strategy. The stars will insist that you encircle yourself with a few true-blue souls who have your back through it all.¬†
Motivator Mars is also in Scorpio from October 12 to November 24, making your Scorpio season duos extra dynamic. You could attract some powerful and charismatic people now. This sizzling Sun-Mars combo could add an extra dash of spice to your love life, but it could also multiply the stress.¬†
If you feel pressured to give someone an answer, whether in love or business, tap the brakes. We‚Äôre not saying you should downshift to an overly cautious pace. Just buy yourself enough time to think any important moves through clearly. If you‚Äôre the one rushing someone into a decision, calm down so you don‚Äôt scare them away.¬†
The lunar loudspeaker is blaring your name on October 28 as the year‚Äôs only Taurus full moon arrives to turn your birthday wishes into reality. This one is extra-special because it‚Äôs also a lunar eclipse, which will cast its brightest beams on your first house of self and independence. Not only that, it‚Äôs the grand finale of a two-year eclipse series that‚Äôs thundered across the Taurus/Scorpio axis, revolutionizing your personal identity and your relationships.¬†
You‚Äôre not the same person as you were in November 2021, when these change-making eclipses began to work their magic. And that‚Äôs the point! Hopefully you‚Äôve shed some inauthentic layers and become more of yourself. If you did, you undoubtedly found people who aligned with that. Some of your relationships may have dramatically changed, a few ending or transforming. Not only is that natural, it was the point of these eclipses.¬†
Your meteoric growth is far from ending, though. Expansive Jupiter will continue its journey through Taurus all the way through late May 2024. Today, you might get a boldfaced look at how much you‚Äôre grown as Jupiter opposes Mars in Scorpio and your interpersonal house. A close relationship could reach a tipping point‚Äîor a breaking point. You can‚Äôt tamp down your truth to keep the peace anymore, Bull. At the same time, make sure you‚Äôre not being confrontational or pushy in an effort to get others on board with your vision. This eclipse, along with the Mars-Jupiter opposition, gives you one last big chance to refine both your messaging and your delivery.
Back on track for cuffing season! Your ruling planet Venus has been a tricky one for the past few months. Venus took an extended trip through Leo and your heartfelt, homey fourth house from June 5, one that will end on October 8. That would be lovely, except Venus also spent six of those weeks (from July 22 until September 3) in low-power retrograde, disrupting the harmony of your closest bonds.
Well, it‚Äôs time for a do-over, Taurus! On October 8, amorous Venus sashays through Virgo and your flirtatious, flamboyant fifth house. Between now and November 8, love is in the air as much as the scent of pumpkin-scented everything. Whether you‚Äôre single or attached, you‚Äôll be in the mood to dress up, turn heads and pack your calendar with events. Unattached Lions may not want anything too serious during this cycle, especially since you could have lots of admiring options. Be upfront about your intentions (or lack thereof)‚Äîbut prepare to have your heart captured just the same!
Unfortunately, it won‚Äôt be all tangled bedsheets and intense tete-a-tetes. Over in your detail-minded, hypercritical sixth house, passionate Mars in Libra could be stirring up anxiety and self-doubt until October 12.
But once that cycle ends, this angst-y energy lifts. Fierce Mars will move on to Scorpio from October 12 until November 24, heating up your seventh house of commitments. Once the red planet relocates to your relationship zone, your energy will get channeled into adding spicy adventures to your twosome time. The last couple weeks of the month could be seriously sexy‚Äîwith things moving to official status or a more committed level fast. And with a lunar eclipse in Taurus on October 28, it‚Äôs anyone‚Äôs guess what could happen!
Two heads are definitely better than one during this seven-week phase, but keeping those heads cool is a whole other story. Beyond the passion and lust, Mars can fire you up in relationships‚Äîand this could spell ‚Äútrouble in paradise.‚Äù Be patiently assertive with your partners in all areas of life. But remember: Just because you say ‚ÄúJump!‚Äù doesn‚Äôt mean they‚Äôll auto-respond with a swift ‚ÄúHow high?‚Äù
It‚Äôs all in the details, Taurus! With energizer Mars in Libra and your organized, administrative sixth house until October 12, you‚Äôre revved up to get everything put in place. The Libra new moon on October 14‚Äîa galvanizing solar eclipse‚Äîis a great day to declutter, map out an org chart or look into hiring someone who can make your life fun more efficiently. Implementing new processes and systems can also be helpful.¬†
Partner up with the movers and shakers starting October 12, when Mars moves into Scorpio and your dynamic duos sector until November 24. You don‚Äôt have to do it all by yourself, Bull! But do get ready for your solo moment on October 28, when the Taurus full moon lights the fall skies as a lunar eclipse in your first house of personal passions.¬†
Advocate for yourself and your ideas‚Äîand don‚Äôt be surprised if others rally to champion you, if not hop fully aboard in support. But just because they‚Äôre excited doesn‚Äôt mean they‚Äôre the right partners for you. If you‚Äôve learned anything these past couple of years, it‚Äôs how to better screen people and make sure your relationships are a two-way street. This is the very last Taurus eclipse in a series that began back in November 2021. Acknowledge the lessons you‚Äôve learned and step into your rightful role, as the leader of your own life!

title: Leo Monthly Horoscope
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
(July 23 - August 22)
At last‚Äîsome momentum returns! From social sync-ups to buzzy brainstorms to exciting business ideas, October is ripe for making connections. And let‚Äôs be honest, you‚Äôre catching up on lost time, thanks to a challenging summer.¬†
It wasn‚Äôt easy being a Leo, although a little character-building patience isn‚Äôt the WORST thing. But still‚Ä¶Venus spent what felt like an endless six-week retrograde in Leo from July 22 until September 3. Then Mercury retrograde jumped in and dragged out the delays until September 15. Argh! If you felt stuck in a constant holding pattern or misunderstood at every turn, fasten your seat belt. Life‚Äôs about to move at a much swifter pace.
Even better? You don‚Äôt have to do it alone. Until October 23, the Sun is in Libra and your third house of communication, ideas and kindred spirits. Finally you have an eager audience for your novel ideas! Life is so much easier when people are receptive, rather than resistant, to your ideas.
Energizer Mars is also in Libra until October 12, rekindling your fan base and sparking up your creativity. The first couple weeks of the month should be filled with exciting opportunities to share your message and get back on the same page as your crew.
Eclipse season picks up the action even more in the second half of the month. October will feature TWO eclipses‚Äîa Libra solar eclipse at the October 14 new moon and the final Taurus lunar (full moon) eclipse in a two-year series on October 28. These game-changing lunar lifts will sweep through your communication and career corners respectively, shaking up the stagnant parts. Out with the old! From unsatisfying friendships to professional plateaus, you are so done with it all.¬†
Midmonth, connect to as many innovative thinkers as you can. Explore synergies and test your chemistry with a small collab. Then get ready to bid adieu to a chapter of your career or a going-nowhere goal you‚Äôve outgrown. Things are about to get a LOT more interesting, Leo‚Äîand way more ‚Äúon brand‚Äù with the person you‚Äôve become.
Caveat: We‚Äôre not entirely done with retrogrades, but the planets that remain in this powered-down speed this October are the slow-moving outer planets: Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune and (until October 10) Pluto. Luckily these giants don‚Äôt really affect our day-to-day lives as much, and their retrogrades can actually be helpful times of integration and reflection.
Two of them, Jupiter and Uranus, are retrograde in Taurus and your career house. You‚Äôll probably be more than ready for any changes that blow in with the October 28 eclipse. Perhaps your Halloween costume should simply be ‚ÄúLeo 2.0‚Äù‚Äîbecause by the time the month ends, you‚Äôll feel like a whole new person.
Take a little time to let that sink in. On October 23, Scorpio season begins, and the Sun takes a pre-holiday respite in your domestic fourth house. Catch up on things at Chateau Leo and make all those plans with family. A month from now, the spotlight will be shining directly on you, and you‚Äôll want to have everything in place so you can finish the year with a star turn‚Äîthe way the stars intend for you, Leo!
Lightness at last? October is one of the liveliest and most social months for you as the Sun makes its annual trip through Libra and your communicative third house until October 23. There‚Äôs nothing you love more than swapping stories with a kindred spirit as you share a decadent treat at that buzzy new cafe or window-shop for hours.¬†
If you‚Äôre not talking about everything from your latest bingeable series and ‚Äúoh my god you have to try it‚Äù organic skincare line to that session you just had with a psychic medium, you‚Äôll be devouring books, podcasts and blogs that feed your need for fresh intel. Hello, hungry lion!
And like a true cub, you need to romp and play. That impulse is even stronger this year since energetic Mars is in Libra until October 12, making you restless and shortening your attention span. Let your inner event planner have a field day during Libra season, hosting little parties or rallying the troops for excursions. Hit the fall festivals and gather your friends (and their friends) to check out new hotspots in your ‚Äòhood. Gather recommendations for books, podcasts and restaurants to try. Your curiosity knows no bounds!
Do your best to stay cool on October 8, when an explosive Mars-Pluto square provokes your critical side. With assertive Mars in your communication zone locked into a heated 90-degree square to intense Pluto in your controlling sixth house, you might feel attacked by someone‚Äôs harsh words. Your own micromanaging could put someone else on the defensive, making them feel like you‚Äôre doubting their judgment. Ask questions before you fling any accusations.
Is the devil in the details? You may find out as soon as October 10, when transformational Pluto ends a five-month retrograde that began on May 1. The retrograde‚Äôs first leg was in Aquarius and your relationship sector. But on June 11, Pluto slipped back into Capricorn and your sixth house of health, organization and analytical thinking.¬†
Power struggles could have erupted, especially with employees or co-workers. If you‚Äôve been dealing with anxiety or a health issue, it may have been hard to discern the cause with shadowy Pluto back-spinning like this. Chronic might have disrupted your sleep patterns or caused you to lapse into self-soothing habits like emotional eating.
Now with Pluto resuming forward motion, you can corral the chaos and get to the root of what ails ya. Take a deep breath: You‚Äôll be better able to manage people‚Äîand their dynamics‚Äîonce Pluto straightens out.¬†
Have you been afraid to step into your power because you‚Äôre worried about pleasing others and being liked? No more! The dwarf planet‚Äôs course correction will help you get a better grip on mind-body-spirit balance. A nagging psychological or emotional issue may have been affecting your physical health. The link could soon become clear, putting you back on the path to wellness and vitality.
Share your brilliance, Leo! The October 14 Libra new moon solar eclipse is an especially prime day to spark up a new friendship or have an important conversation. If you‚Äôre pitching a creative concept or meeting a would-be client, these moonbeams will give you the gift of gab, so schedule your appointments accordingly.
This is the first eclipse in Libra since 2016, and the second in a two-year series on the Aries/Libra axis that will recalibrate your communication sector between March 2023 and March 2025. Get ready for new ways to craft your message, share your ideas and join forces with kindred spirits.¬†
But first: Do you still have any baggage around doing that? With la luna opposite wounded healer Chiron today, you may need to release some old fears about speaking up and being ostracized for your beliefs. It‚Äôs risky to wear your heart on your sleeve (even for a self-expressed Leo). At the end of the day, you want to be loved and praised for your ideas.¬†
Well, this Libra new moon might be an invitation to care a little less about what other people think and to start taking some risks! You don‚Äôt have to put everything out there all at once, either. Share a little taste of your ideas with the public. Take a class or a workshop to build your skills. Test your chemistry with a collaborator on a small project. Start treating life like a grand experiment instead of a performance or a juried competition. You‚Äôll be much freer‚Äîand you‚Äôll have a lot more fun!¬†
Had a little TOO much fun, Leo? Nesting time has arrived. On October 23, the Sun moves into Scorpio and your foundational fourth house. Home, family and emotional restoration are the themes for the next four weeks. Lean in to those so you can have a full tank for when Sagittarius and holiday season arrive in a month, your most festive time of year!¬†
What do you need to feel like you‚Äôre anchored and secure? This is a worthy exploration. You‚Äôre incredibly self-sufficient, but just because you CAN do it all yourself doesn‚Äôt mean you should. During Scorpio season, it‚Äôs okay to pare down your packed schedule and leave some white space in your calendar. Rest, contemplation and self-care will give your inner voice a chance to get a word in edgewise!
Finding peace and quiet at home could be a little challenging, however. With super-active Mars in Scorpio from October 12 until November 24, your household could be a heat zone. There may be visits from family, roommate friction or the extra stress of early holiday preparation.¬†
Don‚Äôt make it more dramatic than it needs to be, Leo. View any flare-ups as a sign. You might need to reconfigure your home‚Äôs layout for better space-sharing, especially if you‚Äôve got introverts and extroverts overlapping in common areas. Maybe it‚Äôs time for some Fengclass="body-el-link standard-body-el-link"  Shui or space clearing. (Check out our Home Reset course to usher in new energy.) With the eclipses stirring up so much, you might want to start these kinds of projects in November, after the dust settles!
Take a break from all the personal-life stuff on October 28, when the year‚Äôs only full moon in Taurus, a partial lunar eclipse, beams into your tenth house of career, leadership and success. You could reach a professional pinnacle where you‚Äôre recognized for your talents and hard work. If you‚Äôve been pondering whether to cut ties and move elsewhere, this full moon will light the way.
Today‚Äôs full moon is a big deal because it‚Äôs the grand finale of an eclipse series that‚Äôs rippled across the Taurus/Scorpio axis since November 2021, radically refashioning the balance between career and home. Your personal and professional paths may look nothing like they did a couple years ago.
With expansive Jupiter in Taurus opposing dynamic Mars in Scorpio, you‚Äôll feel this world-life dichotomy acutely today. In fact, you might be even quicker to hit a breaking point if you feel your two ‚Äúselves‚Äù being split. Demands at home could really start to take a toll on your ambitions in ways that push you to the breaking point.¬†
Reminder, Leo: You CAN and should redesign your life any way you like. But it‚Äôs up to you to ask the people around you to pull their weight or to make the necessary changes that support your dreams. You‚Äôve got this‚Äîand today‚Äôs eclipse is here to drive that message home!
Well‚Ä¶THAT was interesting. For the past four months (since June 5), you‚Äôve been hosting love planet Venus in your sign‚Äîan extended trip since Venus typically only hangs out for about a month. Sounds dreamy? Alas, not so much. From July 22 to September 3, Venus was retrograde (backward), disrupting harmony and complicating matters for many Leos in love, friendship and all around ease.¬†
Venus has been doing her best to make it up to you for the past month since returning to direct (forward) motion in Leo. But it might have been too little, too late. So‚Ä¶let‚Äôs try this again next year, Venus?¬†
On October 8, Venus move on to Virgo. As the love goddess decamps to your stable second house until November 8, she‚Äôll whet your appetite for luxury and stability. Now you‚Äôll settle into a more grounded romantic groove.¬†
With Venus heating up your earthy second house, you‚Äôll be attracted to reliable people who might have seemed ‚Äúboring‚Äù at another time. For single Leos, sparks could fly with a coworker or someone you meet at an industry event. This realm rules your finances, so couples may need to smooth over any tension around money (luckily, peacemaker Venus is here to help). Whether your ‚Äúsecurity issues‚Äù are fiscal or emotional, talk them through and remember, you‚Äôre on the same team here.¬†
Meanwhile, Mars is charging through Libra until October 12, energizing your third house of communication and kindred spirits. You won‚Äôt be at a loss for meeting people now! You could meet someone who sweeps you off your suede booties when you least expect it. Pay attention to friends who insist they know the ‚Äúperfect‚Äù person for you. For once, they might be right!¬†
Couples will appreciate having a chance to step out of any stressful circular conversations and just enjoy each other‚Äôs company. Organize some casual gatherings with mutual friends, like concerts or comedy shows. Variety can‚Äôt help but bring some sizzle to your shared life!
Home is where the HEAT is once restless Mars grooves into Scorpio and your domestic sector from October 12 until November 24. No need to wait until the official holiday season to feather your nest or turn your place into a love den. If you‚Äôre a Leo who loves to entertain like La Martha herself, Mars will create a lively‚Äîand sexy‚Äîvibe for any get-togethers you might throw.¬†
Caution: demanding roomates and relatives could add friction (and not the good kind) to your household with intensifier Mars in Scorpio. Perhaps it‚Äôs time to reconfigure your layouts, creating more privacy for yourself. Is WFH life making it hard to unwind into a sensual groove after hours. Follow Virginia Woolf‚Äôs directive and find ‚Äúa room of one‚Äôs own‚Äù‚Äîor a charming cafe‚Äîto do work outside your house.
Put your money where your mouth is, Leo, and start spreading the news! With go-getter Mars in Libra and your communicative third house until October 12, your ideas are your currency. You may get a chance to pitch your ideas to a well-connected person at the October 14 Libra solar eclipse. Be ready‚Äîthe opportunity could arrive in the last minute!
A peak professional moment arrives at the October 28 Taurus lunar (full moon) eclipse, which floods your tenth house of career and success with its manifesting beams. Ready to throw in the towel on an unfulfilling job and try a new path? Poised for a promotion or to pitch a profitable prospective client? This is your moment to go for it. Bring on the deals!¬†
If you‚Äôve been on the fence about a job or role, it‚Äôs a great day to talk to the key players or decision makers and hash out a new, more fulfilling position for yourself. This is the final Taurus eclipse in a two-year series that‚Äôs been revolutionizing your career path. Don‚Äôt be surprised if an offer comes out of the blue, or a sudden change of the guard happens with your company or clientele. If someone is ‚Äúeclipsed‚Äù away, trust that a much better fit is en route to you, Leo.

title: Cancer Monthly Horoscope
text:
(June 21 - July 22)
It‚Äôs the (second) most Cancerian time of the year! With the Sun visiting Libra and your cozy, domestic fourth house‚Äîthe zodiac zone ruled by Cancer‚ÄîOctober puts you in your nurturing, nesting element. Motivator Mars is also in Libra until October 12, energizing your efforts. Whether you‚Äôre hosting loved ones, changing up your seasonal decor or getting an early start on holiday prep, your inner ‚Äúhouseholder‚Äù is running at warp speed. (Just please don‚Äôt hang up any Christomas lights before Halloween, okay?)
Your ruling planet, the moon, is as busy as you are this month! Two eclipses will activate the skies in the second half of October, moving any stuck energy forward around your living situation, family and friendships. Eclipses are turbocharger transits, pushing us past plateaus whether we‚Äôre ready or not. Stay ready for action this month, Cancer, because things could move fast.
Relationships also regain steam after October 10, when alchemical Pluto ends a five-month retrograde and pivots forward in Capricorn, adding potency to your partnership realm. The other four slow-moving outer planets (Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune) are still retrograde all month long. But with the eclipses sparking up so much action, you might be grateful to have a few parts of your life on temporary hold.
One part that will be far from dormant after October 23: your love life! That day, the Sun sidles into Scorpio for a month, heating up your fifth house of passion, pleasure and play. With spicy Mars here from October 12 until November 24, you‚Äôve got an extended cuffing season. Not that you‚Äôll necessarily want to be ‚Äúcuffed.‚Äù With the Sun and Mars in this frisky zone, you might enjoy basking in the attention of many admirers rather than rushing into an exclusive. If you‚Äôre already partnered, enjoy the romantic boost. Halloween costumes could be even more fun to take off than they are to put on. Oh behave! Wait‚Ä¶no, don‚Äôt!
All the feelings! The emotion ocean is reaching high tide this October, with a few extra currents pulling you this way and that. For starters, the Sun is in Libra and your sensitive and sentimental fourth house until October 23, which always puts you in a nostalgic state.
As the natural ruler of the zodiac‚Äôs fourth house, you‚Äôre usually ‚Äúin the zone‚Äù during Libra season as el Sol travels through the foundation of your solar chart and draws out your nurturing and domestic side. Your attention is focused on your family or domicile as the Sun illuminates this most personal part of your life. Ambitious plans and worldly duties can wait. You‚Äôve got root vegetables roasting in the oven and a ‚Äúvintage botanicals‚Äù Pinterest board underway. (Priorities, people!)
This Libra session is extra lit with energizer Mars in Libra on October 12 and a Libra new moon that‚Äôs also a solar eclipse on October 14. Change won‚Äôt come to your personal life with much subtlety. Get ready for some possible pivots, from a change of address to unexpected visits from relatives to a sudden urge to change up your entire home decor scheme. Easy does it, Crab! You could quickly get in over your head, underestimating the amount of work required to pull off an ambitious domestic or hosting plan.
Watch those volatile emotions this October 8, when combative Mars locks horns in a tense square with vengeful Pluto. Touchy Mars is in Libra and your emotional fourth house until October 12, making you thin-skinned. As the red planet clashes with Pluto in your relationship zone, strong emotions may get the better of you. If you find yourself at wits‚Äô end, pause for self-care instead of forcing a conversation or staging a stormy confrontation.¬†
Things in a key relationship could blow up‚Äîand perhaps this will be a good thing in the long run. Sometimes things just have to come into the open before they can get better. But if there‚Äôs any way to have this showdown another day, you‚Äôll have less damage control to do. Unless someone‚Äôs behavior or actions need to be addressed immediately, take a timeout to assess the right course of action.
Transforming your relationships is an important item of business starting October 10, when karmic Pluto ends a five-month retrograde in Capricorn and your partnership zone. Have you been embroiled in a power struggle with a key person? Maybe you‚Äôve been hashing out deal points but keep stopping shy of signing on the dotted line for a professional venture.¬†
Energetically, something‚Äôs been holding you back or getting in the way of making things official‚Ä¶but perhaps it‚Äôs a blessing in disguise? Now that Pluto returns to forward motion, you can see these dynamics more clearly and work to balance them. With cuffing season underway, it‚Äôs a great time to apply your new insights to an existing relationship or with new long-term prospects!
Change arrives at your doorstep‚Äîliterally‚Äîon October 14. The year‚Äôs only Libra new moon is a solar eclipse, setting off a fresh six-month cycle for matters of home and heart. Eclipses are harbingers of unpredictable change. These moonbeams will propel you to turn to a fresh page with loved ones. Maybe you‚Äôll suddenly scout for a new address or living situation if you‚Äôre in the market for that. (You could find out unexpectedly that you are!)¬†
This is the first eclipse in Libra since 2016, and the second in a two-year series on the Aries/Libra axis that will revolutionize your personal and professional life between March 2023 and March 2025. For the past six months, many Crabs started craving a better distribution of time spent between work and home. Perhaps your career became more demanding, forcing you to delegate some of the household work or vice versa. Maybe you picked up the slack with some family caretaking and needed someone else to hold down the work fort.
If you‚Äôre burnt out on your responsibilities, this inaugural Libra eclipse is here to help you add more self-care, art and creativity to your life. Libra, after all, is the sign of balance. The most important thing you can do now is find some of that for yourself. With the eclipse opposing wounded healer Chiron in Aries, you may find that some of your inner journeying informs your next career moves.
Ready to bring a few fall colors back into your life? Some well-deserved fun arrives on October 23, when the Sun moves into fellow water sign Scorpio and your fifth house of pleasure, passion and play. Creativity spikes with your mojo; a fall romance could heat up before the holiday season begins. If you‚Äôre in a relationship, get some date nights and fun outings on the calendar, along with a few occasions to pull out your glam gear, even if it‚Äôs for a small event you host. (You look adorable in athleisure, Crab, but you clean up nicely too!) Scorpio season ignites your fifth house of creativity, a time to get free-range with an artistic project or put your talents on display.
Lusty Mars will join the Sun in Scorpio, visiting this libidinous lair from October 12 to November 24. Get ready for the passionate energy to dial up another ten notches! Suddenly you‚Äôre turning heads and attracting attention with little effort. Enjoy basking in that admiration and let the spotlight reveal your multifaceted talents already.¬†
You could draw fame quickly with Mars here, but warning: Drama is just as likely to find you. Your emotions are heightened, and the filters are off with combative Mars in this expressive zone. Watch those knee-jerk reactions, which will be even more amplified by the intensity of eclipse season. Channel your diva and dramatic inclinations into a sexy Halloween costume and even sultrier celebration.
If things get a little TOO intense, you can take a huge step back at the October 28 Taurus full moon, which is a partial lunar eclipse. La luna lands in your eleventh house of objective thinking, helping you pull back from the heat zone and cool down. Instead of getting swept up in emotions, you can be the diplomat in the room, helping everyone feel seen and heard.
Today‚Äôs full moon is a big deal because it‚Äôs the grand finale of an eclipse series that‚Äôs rippled across the Taurus/Scorpio axis since November 2021. For the past two years, you‚Äôve been learning to navigate the line between drama and detachment. When is the right time to step into the spotlight and when should you be a team player? The Taurus/Scorpio eclipses gave you equal opportunities to steal the show and be an awesome ‚Äúbackup dancer.‚Äù
Have you been way too much of a solo act? The lunar eclipse could bring an exciting opportunity to collaborate, perhaps with someone you meet online or through a cutting-edge community project with a social justice twist. You could connect with a like-minded group of people or discover firsthand how much power there is in numbers. Since full moons can bring endings or transitions, you may part ways with a friend or clique and start hanging out with people who are more on your wavelength. Since eclipses can move at a much more radical pace, you might abruptly part ways with a friendship or a group and move on to another affiliation.
Expansive Jupiter in Taurus will oppose Mars in Scorpio today, underscoring your need to be around people who support your ascent rather than diminish it. Let the jealous haters go elsewhere. You need to be around people who celebrate your full, authentic expression.
Matters of security are on your mind during the first half of the month, as the love planets move through more stabilizing zones of your chart. Mars is in Libra and your fourth house of home, family and emotional security until October 12. Meanwhile, Venus is rounding out an extended four-month trip to Leo and your rooted second house that‚Äôs spanned from June 5 to October 8.
While it might sound romantic to host the love planet in this passionate sign for four whole months, there was a plot twist. Venus was in a tricky retrograde cycle from July 22 until September 3, disrupting any hopes of a memorable summer love.
Fear not, Cancer: Your do-over has arrived! The month moves into a flirty and confident phase on October 8 when Venus moves into Virgo and your social, lighthearted third house until November 8. Now, rather than worry about where things are going, you‚Äôre feeling independent. If you‚Äôre unattached, you may be more interested in cantering around the pasture than in tying up to any one hitching post in particular. You could meet someone through mutual friends or while out on the town.
This frisky energy builds to a crescendo starting October 12, when white-hot Mars zips into Scorpio and your fifth house of fame, passion and romance until November 24. When it comes to love, you tend to favor exclusive relationships, but this could be the moment where you finally discover the joy of casual dating. Dress up as often as you can, if only to make yourself happy (and definitely for Halloween). Baby fever could strike some Crabs now, and if at first you don‚Äôt succeed, Mars gives you the momentum (and libido) to try, try again.¬†
Home, profitable home? With energizer Mars in Libra until October 12 along with the Sun (through October 23), your domestic fourth house is a hot spot. If you work remotely, this is a prime month to get your home office set up for maximum productivity or start a cottage-industry side hustle.¬†
Even if you report to an offsite location, you‚Äôll still want to bring the crisp edges back to your home, doing a deep clean and purging your file cabinets, for example, or investing in some decor upgrades. Got a room or space you can put on Airbnb or VRBO? Consider supplementing your income with some extra rental cash, especially near the October 14 Libra solar eclipse.¬†
All together now! The Taurus full moon, a powerful lunar eclipse, could bring your shared efforts to a peak moment this October 28. If you have a team project to complete or a tech venture to launch, this eclipse will add momentum. Eclipses bring surprises, and this one could impact the people in your org chart. A colleague or group member could make a sudden departure, perhaps getting recruited to a new job or department.¬†
Is it time to make your own digital debut? With Mars in Scorpio and your fame-worthy fifth house from October 12 to November 24, this eclipse could put you on center stage with a viral post or a meaningful message.
