title: Gigi Hadid Struts the Miu Miu Runway With Hangover Hair
text:
Relatable. 
Do you remember your hair at the end of finals week in high school? Or the hair that your favorite bodega person sees on a weekly basis? Or perhaps it was just last week when you ventured outside to grab a bagel during NYC‚Äôs hurricane? 
Somewhere, somehow, Miu Miu saw your hair, put it on the inspiration board and added it to the runway for their Spring Summer 2024 show.
After a full Fashion Month of very glamorous hair including the big hair bouffants at Schiaparelli, the sleek French twists at Dior, and pretty beach waves at Chanel, Miu Miu gave us greasy, oily, hangover hair and honestly, it was nice to feel seen. ‚ÄúIt was greasy, stringy hair, I loved it,‚Äù a friend texted me after the show. From runway photos, the hair looked oily (not shiny), matted (not artfully tousled), clumpy (not as cute as Taylor Swift‚Äôs wet hair during the Eras tour), like the hairstylists played a game of ‚Äúhide the dry shampoo‚Äù backstage.
The amount of dishevelment varied. From the neck up, Gigi Hadid looked like she was walking home after cramming for an all nighter at the library, paired with sequin board shorts and thick glasses. Model Rianne Van Rompaey‚Äôs hair was so lank and ropey, drawn into a low pony, that it reminded me of my hair at the end of any hike where I‚Äôve ever gotten lost. It‚Äôs a slight departure from the staticky cloud hair of last season, in which the models looked like their heads were rubbed with helium balloons (and it turns out they were, to get the effect.) I probably don‚Äôt need to know how to get the Miu Miu hair look, but I‚Äôd love to know about the inspiration.

title: Laphonza Butler Will Become the First Black Lesbian to Serve in Congress
text:
Gov. Gavin Newsom tapped the EMILY‚Äôs List president to fill Dianne Feinstein‚Äôs Senate seat.
Laphonza Butler, president of the political action committee EMILY‚Äôs List, will be Congress‚Äôs first-ever Black lesbian senator.
California Gov. Gavin Newsom tapped Butler to fill the Senate seat that was left empty after the death of Dianne Feinstein,  Politico reported. Her appointment marks a historic first for Congress, with Butler becoming the sole Black woman currently serving and the third-ever Black woman to ever serve in the Senate. She will also be the first openly LGBTQ+ Black woman to work in Congress.
‚ÄúI‚Äôm honored to accept Gov. @GavinNewsom‚Äôs nomination to be U.S. Senator for a state I have made my home and honored by his trust in me to serve the people of California and this great nation,‚Äù Butler said in a statement posted on X, formerly known as Twitter. ‚ÄúNo one will ever measure up to the legacy of Sen. Dianne Feinstein, but I will do my best to honor her legacy and leadership by committing to work for women and girls, workers and unions, struggling parents, and all of California. I am ready to serve.‚Äù
Butler has served as president of EMILY‚Äôs List, an organization that works to elect pro-choice Democratic women, since 2021.
She previously worked as the director of public policy and campaigns in North America for Airbnb, a strategist and partner at political consulting firm SCRB Strategies, and a senior advisor for Vice President Kamala Harris‚Äôs 2020 presidential campaign. She also has a long and involved history with the labor movement, having served as the president of home-care workers union SEIU Local 2015 for more than a decade. 
Other high-profile California Democrats are currently running for Feinstein‚Äôs seat‚Äîshe was the longest-serving female senator in U.S. history prior to her passing at 90 years old‚Äîwhich will be up for grabs in the 2024 midterms. These include Reps. Adam Schiff, Katie Porter, and Barbara Lee.
CNN reports that Newsom had previously promised to appoint a Black woman if Feinstein, who announced earlier this year that she would not run for reelection, were to resign from her seat earlier than planned. Many had hoped the governor would select Lee, the former chair of the Congressional Black Caucus, as Feinstein‚Äôs replacement. However, Newsom opted to not choose any of the candidates participating in the 2024 Senate election, so as not to give any particular candidate an advantage over others ahead of time. Though Butler herself may choose to run for office next year, too.
‚ÄúAs we mourn the enormous loss of Sen. Feinstein, the very freedoms she fought for‚Äîreproductive freedom, equal protection, and safety from gun violence‚Äîhave never been under greater assault,‚Äù Newsom said in a statement on X. ‚ÄúLaphonza has spent her entire career fighting for women and girls and has been a fierce advocate for working people.‚Äù
He concluded, ‚ÄúI have no doubt she will carry the baton left by Senator Feinstein, continue to break glass ceilings, and fight for all Californians in Washington.‚Äù
As an associate editor at HarpersBAZAAR.com, Chelsey keeps a finger on the pulse on all things celeb news. She also writes on social movements, connecting with activists leading the fight on workers' rights, climate justice, and more. Offline, she‚Äôs probably spending too much time on TikTok, rewatching Emma (the 2020 version, of course), or buying yet another corset.¬†

title: V.E. Schwab Is Rewriting the Rules of Fantasy (And Maybe Life Itself)
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
The author‚Äôs forays into alternate realities aren‚Äôt about escapism. They‚Äôre about power. 
‚ÄúI am somebody who wants the world to be stranger than it is,‚Äù says Victoria ‚ÄúV.E.‚Äù Schwab, her voice dipping toward melancholy as she caps off the sentence. It‚Äôs a curious thought she presents‚Äîconsidering the world is, in fact, consistently and maddeningly bizarre‚Äîand yet one approaching the truth uniting the author‚Äôs works of fantasy, including the bestselling sensation The Invisible Life of Addie LaRue and her latest, the first entry in a new series: The Fragile Threads of Power. 
These stories, which have built Schwab a sizable audience of not only Instagram followers (365K and climbing), but active, engaged readers across platforms and continents, are grounded in what Schwab calls a ‚Äúpoint of departure‚Äù from reality. They are each set in a version of the world we know, but with an asterisk. So: In Addie, there is New York City, and there is Paris, but there is also a god made of shadow who grants wishes that double as curses. In Threads, there is London, but it is carved into multiversal quadrants, versions in various stages of grandeur and ruin: Red London, White London, Grey London, and Black London. There is magic in Schwab‚Äôs work, but it exists along familiar contours, never claiming faraway lands from which to flourish. 
Schwab‚Äôs been, as she puts it, ‚Äúin this game‚Äù since 2009, pumping out books from the age of 19, work that she marks by three essential characteristics: 1) ‚Äúdeeply fleshed-out‚Äù characters; 2) a ‚Äúslow‚Äù initial hundred pages, ‚Äúbecause I‚Äôm laying the board for a game I‚Äôm asking you to play‚Äù; and 3) writing with a ‚Äúvery specific lyrical style.‚Äù She adds, with something of a shrug and a smile, ‚ÄúIf you don‚Äôt like these three things, then my books probably aren‚Äôt for you.‚Äù 
She‚Äôs right, at least in part. Her characters are beloved, if not exactly naturalistic. Her beginnings can grow turgid, though rewarding for the devoted. And her prose is that of a young poet, fond of frequent line breaks and overwrought descriptions but with a slippery, hypnotic cadence. Still, none of these factors are what ultimately make Schwab‚Äôs work so enticing. The appeal is not in the ‚Äústranger‚Äù world that she and her readers desire, but a landscape in which the real world‚Äôs power might become comprehensible‚Äîand therefore, finally, manageable. 
Schwab knew something of bifurcated realities as a child: She grew up between San Jose, California, and Nashville, Tennessee, moving back and forth repeatedly throughout her first 18 years. An only child, she considered herself self-sufficient well before she hit adulthood, and acquired friends as a natural ‚Äúsocial mimic‚Äù who was ‚Äúvery, very intense in everything I did,‚Äù she says. She attended an all-girls preparatory school in Nashville, and she claims she ‚Äúnever‚Äù wanted to be a novelist; she wanted to be a World Cup soccer player. 
But Schwab also enjoyed the expansive isolation of her own mind, where her imagination could nurture a sense of being ‚Äúalone without feeling lonely.‚Äù When she first enrolled in a university, she attended for astrophysics before ‚Äúleapfrogging around different departments‚Äù and signing her first book deal, which might as well have included her signature on the bottom line of life itself: A traditional career path would never be her lot. She‚Äôd been rooting around for this path for years, arguably ever since she picked up reading. 
‚ÄúThe first time I felt transported by a book, my reaction was of two minds,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúIt wasn‚Äôt even just to be transported. There was a part of my brain at the time that was like, This is power.‚Äù She continues, ‚ÄúI was intoxicated by the idea of the manipulation of words and [what] that could do to somebody else‚Äôs mind far before I ever wrote a novel.‚Äù 
Even as a teenager, Schwab was furious to have these powers of hers taken seriously. I ask if, in the years since she‚Äôs become a traditional publishing success story, she‚Äôs perhaps aged out of that insecurity. She replies, ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think you can age out of it when you start in young-adult, and when you‚Äôre a woman who writes in fantasy.‚Äù 
As a genre, the young-adult label fit her work like a girdle, squeezing it into a specific shape but smoothing the interesting bits along the way. Her first book, 2011‚Äôs The Near Witch, was a fairytale with a teenage protagonist, and ‚Äúat the time, that automatically made it YA,‚Äù Schwab says, adding, ‚ÄúYA can be a beautiful section of the market. But it does feel like it has a lot of rules.‚Äù She was told that her books were unlikely to sell well‚Äîlargely because she didn‚Äôt write within the strict parameters of the romance subgenre‚Äîand that each consecutive YA work would have approximately ‚Äútwo to six months to succeed‚Äù before bookshelves would be cleared for new entries, and hers lost to the ether of unlikely discovery. She continues, ‚ÄúThe most traumatized authors I know are authors who are either in or have come through YA.‚Äù 
When Schwab made the leap to adult fiction with 2013‚Äôs Vicious, she expected a similar timeline for supposed ‚Äúsuccess.‚Äù After two months, she emailed her editor, assuming the deadline had arrived: They‚Äôd now decide if she‚Äôd sold enough copies to cinch herself another book deal. Her editor recommended, instead, that they circle back after two years. ‚ÄúThat was this realization that books got to live longer lives in adult, and find readers at a slower rate,‚Äù Schwab says. ‚ÄúI needed that advantage because Vicious was never a bestseller, but it sold the same number of copies every year for seven or eight years.‚Äù
The publication of Vicious also announced the arrival of her twin literary identities: Victoria Schwab, with which she‚Äôd continue to release books like the Monsters of Verity and Cassidy Blake series, and V.E. Schwab, under which she‚Äôd pen her popular fantasies such as the Shades of Magic trilogy, the Villains books, the newly launched Threads of Power series, and her stand-alone novels including 2020‚Äôs Addie LaRue and 2022‚Äôs Gallant. (Some books would be released under Victoria and later under V.E.) The pseudonym was both a marketing tool and a self-protective measure: Such a gender-neutral name allowed her‚Äîin theory, anyway‚Äîto reach new audiences, as well as to create ‚Äúa version of me that lives rent-free in people‚Äôs heads,‚Äù she explains. To her friends and family, she‚Äôs Victoria. But online, and to her many followers, she‚Äôs V.E., maker of tangential realities, not ‚Äúthe human who wakes up at 7 a.m. and walks my dog on the beach.‚Äù In other words, V.E. could have power, while Victoria could live. 
During the height of the pandemic, Addie LaRue took off‚Äîa miracle Schwab attributes, not entirely in jest, to its ‚Äúvery sexy villain.‚Äù But she recognizes the book was also ‚Äúinextricable from the time in which it was published.‚Äù After its initial release in October 2020, Addie hit the New York Times bestseller list, but it was only after popular book-centric creators on TikTok (a.k.a. BookTok) championed the novel that it became a true phenomenon. Addie‚Äîabout a twenty-something girl cursed to be forgotten by everyone she meets throughout multiple centuries, but who falls in love nevertheless‚Äîwas the kind of book readers wanted, and perhaps needed, during COVID: ‚Äúdefiantly hopeful,‚Äù as Schwab puts it, and a tale of endurance across borders and eras and unbeatable odds. 
Unprompted, Schwab suggests that this, actually, is the real unifying theme across her books: the so-called ‚Äúmastery‚Äù of death. She explains that, as a child, she fretted over her father, a type-one diabetic whose blood sugar levels she helped to monitor, and whose tenuous health created an environment where constant observation was paramount to survival. She concludes, ‚ÄúI just became convinced, if I pay enough attention to everything happening around me, I can control everything. And if you think about what writing novels is, it‚Äôs exercising control.‚Äù
She admits, but does not apologize for, how this rationale might come across. It‚Äôs ‚Äúmanipulation,‚Äù she says, and ‚Äúwanting to have some power over a reader‚Äôs mind,‚Äù even if ‚Äúit sounds narcissistic to put it that way.‚Äù Of course, creating fictional realities is an act of narcissism, perhaps one of the few narcissistic acts that might also serve a benevolent purpose. But this doesn‚Äôt upset Schwab. On the contrary, it thrills her. She talks of feeling powerless as a child, and how she searched rock faces in California hoping to find key holes, anything that might confirm her doubts that reality wasn‚Äôt‚Äîor shouldn‚Äôt be‚Äîwhat it seemed. When she came out as gay in her late twenties, it was further confirmation to herself that reality had always been different than what she‚Äôd initially perceived. Doors were opening. Light was coming through. As she chronicled in a coming-out essay for Oprah Daily in 2020, she exited a metaphorical ‚Äúhouse,‚Äù and the world around her became suddenly stranger, and all the more beautiful. 
But Schwab‚Äîand the world itself‚Äîdid not actually become stranger; it was the perception of Schwab herself that expanded. 
‚ÄúGood fantasy is only escapism for people who already have everything that they need and want in reality,‚Äù Schwab says. In other words: What the author, and her audience, really yearn for is the power‚Äîthe tools of ‚Äúmanipulation,‚Äù as it were‚Äîto rewrite the stubborn, heartbreaking rules that govern our real world. It‚Äôs not that reality isn‚Äôt sufficiently strange; it‚Äôs that it‚Äôs so very hard to control.
Schwab is currently on book tour for The Fragile Threads of Power, a nearly six-week trip spanning multiple cities across the U.S., Ireland, and the U.K. It‚Äôs a grueling schedule, especially as she‚Äôs much more accustomed to a regular writing routine from her favorite coffee shop in Edinburgh, Scotland, where she lives when she‚Äôs not traveling. ‚ÄúI like living in old places, in places that haven‚Äôt felt the need to choose between the realistic and the supernatural,‚Äù she says, citing her neighbors‚Äô affection for ghost stories. ‚ÄúI feel like growing up in the States, by virtue of how young a country it is‚Ä¶it feels so resistant to the supernatural. You either have to be a believer or a non-believer.‚Äù 
This split down the middle is a familiar source of both the author‚Äôs ire and inspiration. There‚Äôs always a separation‚ÄîVictoria and V.E., reality and imagination, the strange and mundane‚Äîthat Schwab wants to smother, or otherwise pull taut between her fingers like twine. And it extends to her publishing career, where she‚Äôs often felt shoved into disparate categories, whether on account of her success (or lack thereof); her gender; her sexuality; or her genre of choice. She wants the freedom just to be, to play, to write and be accepted for it without caveat, much in the manner of her literary icons: Imagine, if you will, Neil Gaiman or Stephen King ever needing introduce themselves as ‚Äúbest-selling male fantasy authors.‚Äù
‚ÄúIt feels like I‚Äôm stuck with this choice,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúI either downplay pieces of my identity: I take a gender-neutral pseudonym as I did. I try to be mainstream. I try to be palatable, and I still get disqualified. So then I try to be proud, and I try to be loud, and I try to be aggressively femme and gay, and I still get disqualified, where I still get put in a subcategory. And I just want to be like, How big do you have to get as a fantasy author before you don‚Äôt have to be caveated as something smaller?‚Äù
In the midst of this specific struggle, Schwab also has to contend with the demands of a shifting industry: Readers have come to expect a relationship with her over social media, whether in the form of her Instagram or her newsletter, featuring the cheeky title ‚ÄúThe Visible Life of V.E. Schwab.‚Äù And she recognizes that even these engaged followers don‚Äôt necessarily belong to the same category. Some are Addie fans; others come for Shades of Magic; still others clamor for the third and final entry in her Villains series. Because she hops between books and series and settings, her audience is not a ‚Äúhomogenous‚Äù one. ‚ÄúSometimes I get very panicky,‚Äù she admits, ‚Äúbecause I think I can‚Äôt appease them all because I only write one book at a time.‚Äù
And she feels, yes, ‚Äúan immense pressure to perform author-hood,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúI always am like, the person I‚Äôm most jealous of in this entire world is Donna Tartt. Talk about a person who‚Äôs just, ‚ÄòTake the myth of me and run! You‚Äôll never see me.‚Äô I‚Äôll say to my friends, like, ‚ÄòWhat a dream. What a dream to just be a mythological figure.‚Äô‚Äù
Of course, she seems to amend this notion the next time we speak: ‚ÄúThe insanity-inducing thing is that I insist on being online. If I could not engage‚Äîbut, to me, engagement is part of what I love.‚Äù It‚Äôs also part of the Sisyphean task of building a readership in an era where attention is a fickle currency. ‚ÄúThe conversation I have with [my publicist] every week is like, Am I going to be relevant?‚Äù 
Schwab yearns to have an end goal in sight, both in the context of her life and in her fiction. She outlines every book with a specific ending in mind; she never begins a project without having already decided on its finale. But getting to that ending‚Äîthat‚Äôs where she gets to experiment. For these periods, she can play in the ‚Äòwhat if‚Äô she recalls from a memory ironed in her teenage brain, when she went walking along a wooden fence and stumbled upon a door just beyond it. I‚Äôll let the author tell it:
‚ÄúThere was a door standing upright in this empty yard, as if the rest of the house had been razed around it, but this door has not been razed. And I remember reaching the end of this fence and standing there and staring at this door. My mind was like, What if I open that door, and it‚Äôs not the yard on the other side? But that same ‚Äòwhat if‚Äô is what prevented me from opening the door. Because as long as I didn‚Äôt open the door, as long as I only lived in the ‚Äòwhat if,‚Äô there was a potential that I would open the door and see somewhere else. The moment I opened the door and didn‚Äôt see somewhere else, it would suck. It would be a return to the norm. ‚Äù Ending this anecdote, she summarizes, ‚ÄúAnd reading is living in the potential of what could be, and not in the confirmation of what is.‚Äù
This statement, like Schwab‚Äôs desire for a ‚Äústranger‚Äù world, is not an entirely accurate one. Reading‚Äîeven, or perhaps especially, in the fantasy genre‚Äîconfirms exactly ‚Äúwhat is‚Äù: that the world is strange; that it is inhabited by dark and terrible forces; that behind every door there is the opportunity for change. But sometimes the best way of navigating such an utterly confounding reality is not by approaching it unarmed. As Addie, and Vicious, and Threads all prove, sometimes it takes magic to see the monsters clearly‚Äîand to finally beat them back.

title: Only Murders in the Building‚Äôs Season 3 Finale Solves One Mystery and Introduces Another
text:
Ben‚Äôs killer is revealed, and so is the next victim. 
Spoilers below. 
Who killed Ben Glenroy? That‚Äôs the question the third season of Hulu‚Äôs Only Murders in the Building has revolved around, and the finale ‚ÄúOpening Night‚Äù gives us not one but two answers. 
Mabel cracks the case almost immediately at the beginning of the episode, spurred by both Oliver‚Äôs sweet-talking reunion with his beloved dips (he‚Äôd been warned to stay off the stuff after suffering a heart attack a few episodes ago) and Howard finally piecing together the shredded message. By Mabel‚Äôs calculations, Ben‚Äîwho had been fasting before the show‚Äîwas tempted by a Shmackery‚Äôs cookie left in his dressing room by none other than Donna, Death Rattle‚Äôs producer, after she found out that Maxine‚Äôs review of the show (and specifically, Ben) was unfavorable. Donna sprinkled a tiny bit of rat poison on top of the cookie and sent him off to his dressing room with the suggestion to ‚Äúbe nice to Ben,‚Äù knowing he would take the bait, all in the name of saving the show.
The footage that Mabel and Tobert recovered earlier in the season of Ben talking to someone in his dressing room, and the lipstick message saying ‚Äúfucking pig‚Äù on the mirror weren‚Äôt targeted attacks, but rather the unraveling of Ben‚Äôs psyche prior to him taking the stage. But Donna still holds the poisoned cookie. To add fuel to the fire, newly-free Loretta also hands over the bloody handkerchief found on Ben‚Äôs body, which has Donna‚Äôs exact shade of lipstick pressed perfectly into it. It seems like a hook, line, and sinker, and the gang hatches a plan to confront Donna and bring her down by luring her in with a new review of the revamped musical Death Rattle Dazzle. 
On opening night, Mabel brings a bouquet of flowers to Donna with a note summoning her to the backstage offices. Before she goes, she offers her son Cliff two disturbing kisses (‚Äúone on the lips and one on the heart‚Äù) and tucks her own handkerchief in his pocket. Oliver, Mabel, Charles, and Tobert (with the boom mic) await her backstage to accuse her of the crime, and she confesses almost immediately. Her motive was to save the show by any means necessary, especially because it‚Äôs Cliff‚Äôs first production. While she didn‚Äôt mean to kill Ben (she only wanted to buy time for the show), when he reappeared later that night, she says she couldn‚Äôt risk him going on stage the next night. 
Tobert records her confession for the podcast but she asks for one thing in return: Call the cops after the show. She wants to be there for opening night and deems herself ‚Äúnot a flight risk‚Äù due to her stage four lung cancer. They agree, but as Mabel watches Donna and Cliff from the wings, she realizes that Donna didn‚Äôt act alone. 
Mabel follows Cliff up to a lookout in the rafters of the theater where she confronts him about pushing Ben down the elevator shaft. ‚ÄúOne on the heart,‚Äù Mabel realizes, means that Donna‚Äôs lipstick-stained handkerchief wound up in Cliff‚Äôs suit jacket pocket, placing Cliff at the scene of the crime. Cliff doesn‚Äôt deny it, telling Mabel that Ben found out about Donna‚Äôs rat poison from toxicology reports. Ben remembers that Donna offered him the cookie and then offends Cliff by insinuating that he doesn‚Äôt have a brain of his own, and Cliff fights back saying that he never wanted to cast Ben in the first place‚Äîthat he thinks he‚Äôs a superhero hack who can‚Äôt act. The two get in a scuffle that ends with Cliff, somewhat accidentally, pushing Ben to his death at the bottom of the elevator shaft.
The confession almost breaks Cliff, who refuses to let his mom take the fall for him, and he threatens to jump out of the rafter to his own death in the middle of the musical. But the warmth of his mom‚Äôs hand pulls him gently to safety. He apologizes and she forgives him before the two are carted out by the police; sadly, they don‚Äôt get to see that the musical received a good review after all. 
The season‚Äôs fixation on the love between a mother and her son isn‚Äôt only resigned to Donna and Cliff‚Äôs odd dynamic; Loretta finally tells Dickie that she‚Äôs his biological mother. He says he knew it all along and quickly goes back to work as her agent, fielding offers far and wide in Hollywood. Oliver, reunited with the love of his life, finally lets go of control and encourages her to go and pursue her dream with Dickie by her side. As for their relationship, he says he‚Äôs just fine being with Loretta in short bursts. L.A. is also calling Tobert‚Äôs name for an indie film gig and Mabel turns down his offer to join him and find herself out west, saying that she needs to make herself ‚Äúunstuck‚Äù in New York. 
Every mystery story has red herrings, and that was especially true of this season of Only Murders in the Building. Many of the characters introduced as potential players had increasingly minor roles as the season went on‚Äîespecially Ashley Park‚Äôs Kimber, who at one point was positioned as a major suspect. Jonathan, played by Jason Veasey, also got minimal screen time after he takes a drug cocktail in the finale that rendered him unable to go on for opening night, forcing Oliver (and not Howard, who desperately wanted the role) to take his place. Even Jesse Williams‚Äô Tobert, who will be carrying on a bicoastal romance with Mabel for the foreseeable future, didn‚Äôt have much to do late in the season aside from a few funny one-liners. 
Only Murders in the Building ends its third season similar to seasons past: by setting up yet another investigation for the true crime junkies‚Äô true crime podcast. As the trio celebrates solving Ben‚Äôs murder, Sazz ( Charles‚Äô former body double, played by Jane Lynch) crashes the party. Charles announces that he‚Äôs going to go get an Argentinian malbec wine from his apartment to keep the party going, and Sazz says that she needs to tell him something sensitive but puts off the conversation for the moment. 
Upstairs in Charles‚Äô apartment, a single bullet pierces the window and the person inside topples over with blood gushing from their body. At first it looks like Charles was the victim, but when we see him re-emerge at the party downstairs, it turns out Sazz is the one who was shot. We can already see the wheels turning for the show‚Äôs fourth season: Who killed Sazz, and equally important, who wanted to kill Charles? 
Radhika Menon is a freelance entertainment writer, with a focus on TV and film. Her writing can be found on Vulture, Teen Vogue, Bustle, and more.

title: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce‚Äôs Complete Relationship Timeline
text:
It‚Äôs a love story that could actually be a Hollywood rom-com: The top American pop singer and the top American football player meet up, sparks fly, and they end up dating with the world watching. Taylor Swift and Kansas City Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce have dominated headlines since their romance was first rumored to be a thing, with Swift‚Äôs first appearance at Kelce‚Äôs game in Kansas City becoming one of the year‚Äôs most buzzed-about moments. 
While the two may not be official just yet, things are escalating quickly, and anything is possible in the future, sources have made clear.
Here, the full history of their relationship that is known so far.
Kelce plays ‚ÄúKiss, Marry, Kill‚Äù in an interview, with the choices being Ariana Grande, Katy Perry, and Taylor Swift. ‚ÄúDamn, that‚Äôs messed up. I don‚Äôt want to kill any of them,‚Äù he prefaced. He then answered, ‚ÄúAriana is kill, unfortunately. I love you, but you‚Äôre gone. And then Taylor Swift would be the kiss, and then Katy Perry would be the‚Äîwhat‚Äôs the last one? Katy Perry would be the marry.‚Äù The interview resurfaced in 2023 as the dating rumors with Swift began to gain traction.
Kelce discusses shooting his shot and missing while attending Swift‚Äôs Eras Tour show in Kansas City, Missouri on his New Heights podcast with his brother Jason, an NFL player for the Philadelphia Eagles. Kelce‚Äôs remarks get media pickup.
‚ÄúI was disappointed that she doesn‚Äôt talk before or after her shows because she has to save her voice for the 44 songs that she sings. So I was a little butthurt I didn‚Äôt get to hand her one of the bracelets I made for her,‚Äù Kelce said. ‚ÄúIf you‚Äôre up on Taylor Swift concerts, there are a friendship bracelets and I received a bunch of them being there, but I wanted to give Taylor Swift one with my number on it. All right now.‚Äù
Jason asked if his brother meant his jersey number or phone number. 
‚ÄúYou know which one,‚Äù Kelce answered. ‚ÄúShe doesn‚Äôt meet anybody and at least she didn‚Äôt want to meet me so I, um, I took that personal. But it was an unbelievable show and I‚Äôve only seen Arrowhead filled like that for Chiefs games with that much excitement, and yeah, everybody was dressed in pink and purple going crazy. It was a wild show.‚Äù
Swift and Kelce‚Äôs romance takes off this month. Here‚Äôs the play-by-play (pun very much intended).
Swift goes out in New York City, wearing Foundrae‚Äôs Forever & Always a Pair Pendant, which has an opal teardrop stone on it. Fans note later that opal is Kelce‚Äôs birth stone (he is a Libra), and the necklace may have been an easter egg.
The Messenger reports that Swift and Kelce have been spending time together. ‚ÄúTaylor and Travis have been quietly hanging out,‚Äù a source told the outlet. ‚ÄúShe saw him when she was in NYC a few weeks ago.‚Äù
That same day, another source told Entertainment Tonight that Kelce isn‚Äôt Swift‚Äôs secret new boyfriend: They are ‚Äúnot officially dating.‚Äù Sources will continue to stress this in the coming weeks.
Kelce‚Äôs brother Jason adds fuel to dating rumors during his appearance on the TNF Nightcap‚Äôs post-game interview.
‚ÄúI‚Äôve seen these rumors‚Ä¶I cannot comment,‚Äù he said, noting that ‚Äúever since Catching Kelce [Kelce‚Äôs 2016 E! dating series], everyone‚Äôs been infatuated with Travis‚Äô love life, so, I don‚Äôt really know what‚Äôs going on there. I know Trav is having fun, we‚Äôll see what happens with whoever he ends up with.‚Äù
Tony asked Jason about the Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift dating rumors üòÇ@TonyGonzalez88 | #TNFonPrime pic.twitter.com/iHHqDvWC9B
That same day, Kelce dodges questions about Swift during an interview with Andrew Siciliano. 
‚ÄúI‚Äôm not gonna talk about my personal life,‚Äù Kelce said. ‚ÄúI know what you writers wanna hear, and you wanna hear more about that, and I‚Äôm not gonna give you anything.‚Äù
Jason jokingly confirms the Taylor-Travis dating rumors on Audacy‚Äôs SportsRadio 94 WIP. When asked about the gossip surrounding his brother and Swift, Jason said that ‚Äúit‚Äôs hard to answer because I don‚Äôt really know a lot about Travis‚Äô love life. I try to keep his business kind of his business, stay out of that world. But having said that, I think he‚Äôs doing great, and I think it‚Äôs all 100 percent true, and I hope this thing goes a mile.‚Äù Then he made it clear he was just kidding: ‚ÄúNo, I‚Äôm joking, I don‚Äôt know what's happening.‚Äù
The Messenger also gets more intel on the relationship from Swift‚Äôs side that day.
‚ÄúShe and Travis have hung out twice, and it‚Äôs nothing serious,‚Äù the source said. ‚ÄúShe thinks he is very charming, and they have been texting this last week. He is a little embarrassed at how much attention they are getting, but he has told her he would love to continue seeing her.‚Äù
‚ÄúThey are seeing where things go,‚Äù the source added, noting that Swift‚Äôs ‚Äúfriends are always playfully suggesting people to set her up with. [She‚Äôs] in her fun girl era and strictly having fun right now.‚Äù
Kelce says he invited Swift to his game during an interview with The Pat McAfee Show. She later does attend it.
 ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs hilarious how much traction this has actually gotten, right now it‚Äôs like a game of telephone,‚Äù Kelce said of the dating rumors. ‚ÄúNo one actually knows what‚Äôs going on, especially when you got [my brother] Jason Kelce on live television telling people both sides‚Äîhe doesn‚Äôt know, it‚Äôs true, this and that.‚Äù 
Regarding his status with Swift, Travis gave a frank answer: ‚ÄúI threw it out there, I threw the ball in her court. I told her, you know, I‚Äôve seen you rock the stage in Arrowhead [Stadium], you might have to come see me rock the stage in Arrowhead and see which one‚Äôs a little more lit. So, we‚Äôll see what happens in the near future.‚Äù
A source close to the situation tells E! that Swift and Kelce have no plans to see each other imminently, downplaying their closeness. 
‚Äú[They] met up once in New York,‚Äù the source said. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôve been texting and talking here and there but [have] no set plans to see each other again. It‚Äôs been very low-key as he‚Äôs been in season.‚Äù Obviously, that changes two days later.
Swift takes up Kelce‚Äôs invitation and attends his game in Kansas City. She is photographed in the stands with his mom. Sources reveal later that it was her first time meeting his family, and it went well.
Swift and Kelce are filmed leaving the game, marking the first video of them together.
Daily Mail later reveals that Swift met Kelce‚Äôs friends and family at his home before going to the game. The outlet wrote that she spent an hour with them before boarding a party bus with them to the stadium. 
A source told Daily Mail, ‚ÄúTravis wasn‚Äôt at his house, but it was filled with his friends and family. He has a personal chef and several friends from high school and college who use his place as a crash pad whenever they are in town.‚Äù
A source told People that day that, once again, Swift and Travis aren‚Äôt serious, but she was happy to see him play. 
‚ÄúTaylor is very focused on work right now and hanging out with her girlfriends. Travis invited her to the game, and of course she said ‚Äòyes,‚Äô‚Äù the source said. ‚ÄúShe just thought it was a fantastic way to spend Sunday.‚Äù
A source later added to People that ‚Äúthey‚Äôre having fun. This was Taylor‚Äôs first time meeting his mom and dad, and everyone was enjoying themselves. She was super chill and low-key hanging out with his friends and family.‚Äù
Kelce and Swift end their day celebrating with his teammates and family at Prime Social Rooftop. They get affectionate there.
Outlets get more information on the post-game date. 
Initial reports claim that Swift and Kelce paid to rent out Prime Social Rooftop. In reality, they had a reservation.
An eyewitness told Entertainment Tonight, ‚ÄúTravis bought out the restaurant for his family and team. Taylor arrived, wearing a denim dress, and was seen snacking, having some cocktails and dancing alongside Travis. The two were very affectionate with one another but kept things fun and lighthearted. Travis‚Äô teammates also showed up to the after-party, as well as his mom, Donna Kelce. The party lasted until 2 A.M.‚Äù
TMZ was also told that Swift and Kelce were affectionate at the game‚Äôs after-party. ‚ÄúSources say they were holding hands at the restaurant he rented out for his family, friends, and teammates after the game. At one point Taylor was sitting on Travis‚Äô lap,‚Äù TMZ wrote.
In addition, multiple sources discuss Swift and Kelce‚Äôs current relationship status.
TMZ was told by sources that Swift and Kelce‚Äôs relationship is not a publicity stunt, first of all. The sources shared that Swift and Kelce have seen each other ‚Äúseveral times‚Äù over the last few months, but are not officially dating yet. Previous in-person meetings have been in a ‚Äúvery private setting,‚Äù per the sources.
Entertainment Tonight‚Äôs insiders said that things between Swift and Kelce remain casual, but he has potential to be a good match for her. Swift specifically liked that he pursued her.
‚ÄúTravis has never shied away from his desire to give dating with Taylor a try, which he even said during a press conference a few months ago after seeing Swift in concert,‚Äù one source said. ‚ÄúTravis and Taylor are taking things slowly and not rushing into anything serious. Both are very career-focused, so the focus is on that for now, but that‚Äôs not going to stop them from enjoying life when it‚Äôs the right moment.‚Äù
A second source added that ‚ÄúTravis and Taylor have a lot in common and they are having a great time getting to know each other. They have similar values. She likes that he pursued her and it has been easy and exciting for both of them.‚Äù
‚ÄúTaylor is enjoying some time off from touring and it‚Äôs been fun hanging out with Travis during this break,‚Äù the source continued. ‚ÄúTaylor wants a guy that‚Äôs into his career, does his own thing, but is also supportive and understands her, and Travis fits those qualities.‚Äù 
Last of all, a source told People that Swift and Kelce‚Äôs romance is in the ‚Äúsuper, super early days.‚Äù That source added of their future, ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre just hanging out, and there‚Äôs no pressure.‚Äù
Swift is seen arriving at the airport in Kansas City around 10:30 A.M. to fly back home. Daily Mail reported that security vehicles were seen parked on Kelce‚Äôs street on Sunday and Monday nights in a clear sign that the two stars spent some private time together post-game.
Multiple sources speak to Us Weekly that day about Swift and Kelce‚Äôs relationship. Once again, they say it‚Äôs not serious.
One Us Weekly source said that Swift met Kelce through a mutual friend: ‚ÄúThey have been on a few dates, and Taylor is smitten with him. It is not serious, and Taylor is having fun right now.‚Äù
‚Äú[She‚Äôs] working hard right now and not looking for anything serious,‚Äù the source continued, citing her tour schedule and his NFL schedule as reasons why a more committed romance would be more difficult. ‚ÄúBut anything is possible. They‚Äôre getting closer and closer every day.‚Äù
Kelce speaks on his podcast New Heights for the first and maybe last time about his relationship with Swift.
‚ÄúI know I brought all this attention to me, right?‚Äù Kelce started. ‚ÄúI did the whole friendship bracelet thing and told everyone how butt-hurt I was that I didn‚Äôt get to meet Taylor.‚Äù
At the same time, he has no any regrets. ‚ÄúYou miss 100 percent of [the shots] you don‚Äôt take, baby, so yeah,‚Äù he said, then adding, ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs real is it is my personal life, and I want to respect both of our lives. She‚Äôs not in the media as much as I am doing this show every single week and you know, having fun during the NFL season and on other guys‚Äô shows like the McAfee Show, and any other show that I go on from here on out.‚Äù
‚ÄúI‚Äôm enjoying life, and I sure as hell enjoyed this weekend so everything moving forward, I think me talking about sports‚Ä¶will kind of have to be where I keep it,‚Äù he said.
‚ÄúI‚Äôm on the roller coaster, the roller coaster of life,‚Äù Kelce added of the experience dating Swift. ‚ÄúYeah, I notice a few things [are different], like paparazzi outside my house.‚Äù
Kelce gave Swift two shout-outs on the program: ‚ÄúShout-out to Taylor for pulling up [to the Chiefs game],‚Äù he said first. ‚ÄúThat was pretty ballsy, that was pretty ballsy, yeah. I just thought it was awesome how everyone in the suite had nothing but great things about her, you know the friends and family. She looked amazing. Everybody was talking about her in a great light, and on top of that, the day went perfect for Chiefs fans, of course. We script it all, ladies and gentlemen. It was just impressive.‚Äù
Of the game generally, he said, ‚ÄúIt was definitely a game I‚Äôll remember. That‚Äôs for damn sure. And then we just slid off in the getaway car at the end.‚Äù
His second shout-out to Swift was simple: ‚ÄúShout-out to Taylor for coming through and seeing me rock the stage.‚Äù 
Later that day, TMZ runs the first photo of Swift and Kelce showing PDA from the post-game party.
After rumors emerge that Swift could be attending Kelce‚Äôs Kansas City Chiefs game against the New York Jets at New Jersey‚Äôs MetLife Stadium, a source confirms it to Entertainment Tonight. ‚ÄúTaylor Swift is planning on attending the Jets game this Sunday,‚Äù the source said.
A second source added, ‚ÄúThe Jets haven‚Äôt been notified specifically about Taylor coming to Sunday‚Äôs game, but are prepared to welcome her if she decides to come. Patrick Mahomes booked a suite for his family and friends and Taylor could be joining that suite.‚Äù
In a separate report, a different source told Entertainment Tonight that Swift wasn‚Äôt initially expecting much from her and Kelce‚Äôs time together, but things are changing. ‚ÄúWhen Taylor and Travis first connected, Taylor was looking to have fun while enjoying some downtime,‚Äù the source said. ‚ÄúSo far, it‚Äôs been a nice change of pace for her. Now, as things progress between Taylor and Travis, they‚Äôre both looking to keep it more private. They‚Äôre both excited about where things are headed.‚Äù 
The Daily Mail reports that the couple has allegedly discussed doing a Halloween costume together and potentially attending Heidi Klum‚Äôs famous Halloween party, a celeb-packed event. The ‚Äúinsider‚Äù said they joked about dressing as Barbie and Ken. 
That source gave more detail on their dynamic, claiming that ‚Äúthe whirlwind that this relationship has started is something that Taylor is familiar with, and Travis is okay with. He wants to get in as much time as possible with her before she embarks on her international tour.‚Äù
As rumored, Swift attends Kelce‚Äôs Sunday night game against the New York Jets at MetLife Stadium. She brings a pack of celeb friends including Blake Lively, Ryan Reynolds, Sophie Turner, Hugh Jackman, and Sabrina Carpenter.
Swift and Kelce aren‚Äôt photographed or filmed together during the game, truly keeping things more private. They left the stadium separately after the game. Page Six reported that Kelce was photographed leaving Swift‚Äôs apartment earlier in the day, although not because he spent the night Saturday. 
A source told Page Six that the two had a Sunday morning hangout, as Kelce adhered to his team‚Äôs 11 P.M. curfew on Saturday. He left Swift‚Äôs apartment around 11 A.M.
After the game, Swift went to Zero Bond with her brother Austin Swift and his girlfriend Sydney Ness. Kelce was not photographed there with her.
Multiple sources tell People that Swift and Kelce‚Äôs relationship is undefined.
‚Äú[They‚Äôre] still just getting to know each other,‚Äù the first source said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs nothing too serious.‚Äù
A second source added that their relationship is casual and unlabeled: ‚ÄúHe is a charming guy. It‚Äôs more of a hanging out situation than dating,‚Äù that source said. They added that while Kelce is spending time with Swift, ‚Äúhe‚Äôs focusing on football like he always has. During the NFL season, his priority is the Chiefs, and it‚Äôs all about the team.‚Äù

title: All About Brad Pitt‚Äôs Girlfriend Ines de Ramon, Who He‚Äôs Been Dating for a Year
text:
Just weeks after Brad Pitt was rumored to be seeing Emily Ratajkowski (who went on to reportedly date Pete Davidson for a couple weeks), the 59-year-old actor seems to have a different new woman in his life. The Daily Mail ran photos of Pitt at a Bono concert on Nov. 13 with Ines de Ramon, a 32-year-old Swiss jewelry professional. The Daily Mail claimed it was informed by sources that de Ramon was part of Pitt‚Äôs team. People, meanwhile, reported that de Ramon works for the jewelry brand Anita Ko. Her LinkedIn lists her position as vice president of the company.
In photos, Pitt appeared putting his arms on de Ramon, and introduced her to his friends there, including Cindy Crawford. De Ramon is recently single herself, having separated from her husband, Vampire Diaries actor Paul Wesley, in September 2022. 
Reports on her relationship status with Pitt were initially a little conflicting, with People reporting them as dating and E! reporting they‚Äôre just friends. People described de Ramon as Pitt‚Äôs ‚Äúgirlfriend‚Äù in a report published on December 16, and the two were then seen together getting out of a car in Hollywood on Pitt‚Äôs 59th birthday on December 18, 2022.
New Year's Eve made it clear though: Pitt and de Ramon are dating and rung in the New Year on vacation in Cabo. On January 3, 2023, Page Six ran paparazzi photos of the two topless on their trip. The couple went on to celebrate their one-year anniversary in September 2023.
So, who is de Ramon? Here, the essentials and all the details on her connection to Pitt.
While neither de Ramon nor Pitt have commented on reports that they‚Äôre dating, The Daily Mail ran photos of them at a Bono concert together on November 13. The outlet reported they arrived together in Pitt‚Äôs Tesla at 8 P.M. They left separately, de Ramon in Pitt‚Äôs bodyguard‚Äôs SUV and Pitt in his Tesla. 
Interestingly, the source was indicated as close to de Ramon rather than Pitt. The source said, ‚Äú[they] have been dating for a few months,‚Äù and that ‚ÄúBrad is really into‚Äù de Ramon. ‚ÄúThey met through a mutual friend. She is very nice.‚Äù
A second source, this one close to Pitt, confirmed they were dating, but casually. ‚Äú[They] recently started dating. [But] it‚Äôs not an exclusive relationship. Ines is cute, fun and energetic. She has a great personality. Brad enjoys spending time with her,‚Äù the source said.
A source told E! that same day, meanwhile, that Ines is ‚Äúa friend of his.‚Äù Of the dating rumors, the source added, ‚ÄúThis has been assumed in the past and has been wrong.‚Äù Hmm...
People reported on December 16 that de Ramon and Pitt were acting particularly coupley at the after party for the Los Angeles premiere of his film Babylon the night before. The two were seen ‚Äúmingling with guests, occasionally with their arms around each other,‚Äù the outlet wrote. It marks the two's first big public sighting together since dating reports broke in November.
De Ramon and Pitt ended 2022 together‚Äîand gave the public definitive proof they're a couple in vacation photos of them lounging pool-side, topless together. De Ramon's back was turned to the camera while Pitt sat next to her, both sitting, talking, and reading by the water. No one else appeared around them in shots taken. Page Six ran the pictures here.
People also reported that the two spent New Year's Eve together in Cabo days before Page Six published photos. A source told People on January 2, ‚ÄúThey are dating and having fun. They have a good thing going on. There is no stress. Brad is enjoying it.‚Äù
‚Äú[He] is not seeing anyone else right now,‚Äù the source added, suggesting that things may be becoming a little more serious. ‚ÄúHe is spending more time with Ines. He is very happy.‚Äù
A few days after their vacation, a source told ET that the new couple are ‚Äúexcited about where things are headed.‚Äù 
They continued, ‚ÄúInes took a bunch of time off from work during the holidays to celebrate with Brad and spend New Year's Eve with him. They had a great time in Cabo just relaxing and having fun together.‚Äù 
‚ÄúThey're a great match and have a good thing going,‚Äù they added. ‚ÄúThey have a lot in common and Brad likes how chill and low-key Ines is. They're excited about where things are headed.‚Äù
Pitt isn‚Äôt the only actor that de Ramon has been with. De Ramon and The Vampire Diaries‚Äô Paul Wesley announced their separation after three years of marriage in September 2022. Wesley and de Ramon were first romantically linked in July 2018.
A rep for the couple told People in September that ‚Äúthey have separated‚Äù and have been living apart for several months. ‚ÄúThe decision to separate is mutual and occurred five months ago. They request privacy at this time,‚Äù the rep added.
On Friday, February 17, Wesley filed for divorce in Los Angeles listing the reason for their split as ‚Äúirreconcilable differences,‚Äù according to People. The divorce petition says that the former couple's assets split will be decided at ‚Äútrial or by stipulation.‚Äù
Following news that Pitt sent de Ramon flowers from afar for Valentine's Day, a source, identified as a ‚Äúclose friend‚Äù of Pitt, spoke to Daily Mail in late February about the two's connection. They have supported each other through their divorces. ‚ÄúInes does the same for Brad who is unfortunately still dealing with his messy divorce from Angie,‚Äù the source said. ‚ÄúThey actually bonded over their divorces and are quite serious. She has met most of his kids.‚Äù
The source claimed that Pitt's romance with de Ramon has been very different from his previous. ‚ÄúShe is zero drama and very low-key,‚Äù the source said. That source also said that he doesn't care about how Jolie or de Ramon's ex Paul Wesley see their romance. ‚ÄúHe especially doesn't give a damn what Angie thinks,‚Äù the source said. ‚ÄúIn fact he wants her to know that he is happy with someone else. Brad does not care what Paul thinks of him, nor what Paul thinks of him dating Ines. Even though Paul is out of the picture, Brad and Ines are going to continue keeping it on the DL.‚Äù
Pitt and de Ramon celebrated their one-year anniversary in September 2023, with a source speaking about their relationship in detail to Us Weekly. ‚Äú[Their] relationship is stronger than ever,‚Äù the source said. ‚Äú[They] spend almost all their free time together.‚Äù That source noted de Ramon is close to Pitt‚Äôs friends, too.
‚ÄúBrad still hasn‚Äôt introduced his kids to Ines,‚Äù the source said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not that he doesn‚Äôt love Ines, it‚Äôs just that he wants to ensure this relationship is going the distance before he takes that major step.‚Äù
‚ÄúHe‚Äôs dated a few women over the years but hasn‚Äôt introduced any of his children to them,‚Äù the source added. Pitt is ‚Äúhappy‚Äù with his and de Ramon‚Äôs current status. ‚Äú[He] isn‚Äôt in a rush to push things unless it unfolds organically.‚Äù
De Ramon is a graduate of the University of Geneva, earning her bachelor‚Äôs in business administration. Her LinkedIn indicates that she speaks five languages, with French, English, and Spanish indicated at a bilingual or native proficiency, and German and Italian listed at a professional working proficiency. Prior to working at Anita Ko in Los Angeles, de Ramon spent four years working in the retail department of jewelry company de GRISOGONO.
Following news that she and Pitt may be dating, de Ramon appeared to set her Instagram to private. De Ramon has appeared before on Wesley‚Äôs Vampire Diaries co-star Nina Dobrev‚Äôs Instagram when she and Wesley were still together.
One photo of her remains on her ex-husband‚Äôs Instagram too:
De Ramon has managed to keep public information about herself very limited, despite her marriage to Wesley and current rumored ties to one of Hollywood‚Äôs biggest stars. Pitt is likely to guard details of their relationship too, should it continue or become more serious, as the actor has not spoken much about any particular woman he has dated following his 2016 divorce from Angelina Jolie.
Tuesday, February 14, was of course Valentine's Day, and de Ramon, was spotted in Los Angeles carrying an oversized bouquet of pink peonies, according to the Daily Mail. A source told People that the flowers were from Pitt, a romantic gesture for the holiday.
Pitt was in New York City for Valentine's Day, filming his latest movie Wolves.
On Friday, February 24, Pitt and de Ramon were seen together in Paris at Fouquet‚Äôs on the Champs-√âlys√©es, seated next to each other amongst a larger group. The short clip was shared by the publication Paris Match on Twitter. In the clip, de Ramon is wearing a shimmering spaghetti strap silver dress and Pitt was in a black tuxedo.

The actor was in Paris for the 48th C√©sar Film Awards, where he was tasked with presenting Fight Club director David Fincher with an honorary award. A source told People the couple did not travel to France together, but arrived separately a day apart. 
A source told People on Thursday, July 27, that things are ‚Äúgoing very strong‚Äù for the couple and ‚Äúthey are doing great.‚Äù
The actor has been in Europe filming a movie, but production was put on hold following the SAG-AFTRA strike. She has managed to see him throughout the season and filming.
‚ÄúThe two have been spending a lot of time together this summer as they truly enjoy each other‚Äôs company and are very into each other,‚Äù the insider said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs apparent to anyone who sees them together.‚Äù
De Ramon has also been visiting the Ch√¢teau Miraval which Pitt and his ex-wife Angelina Jolie have been contesting one another over in court.
‚ÄúHe still keeps a residence at Ch√¢teau Miraval and has been spending a lot of time there and elsewhere in Europe,‚Äù the source explained.  ‚ÄúAnd Ines has been flying in to see him several times.‚Äù
On Wednesday, August 23, de Ramon was photographed wearing a ‚ÄúB‚Äù pendant necklace which some are connecting to her rumored beau. The jewelry designer was drinking a green smoothie and walking her dog in black athletic wear. The pair are coming up on a year of dating, but a source told ET a few days after the necklace sighting that they are ‚Äúhappy being low-key.‚Äù
‚ÄúBrad and Ines are still seeing each other and having fun,‚Äù the insider said. ‚ÄúThey enjoy each other‚Äôs company and have similar interests. They‚Äôre both creative, like to travel, and are happy being low-key. Things are good between them, but Brad isn't rushing anything.‚Äù
They added, ‚ÄúBrad is very careful and intentional about who he dates. He likes to ease into things and let things grow naturally.‚Äù

title: A Complete Timeline of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's Relationship
text:
Meghan Markle and Prince Harry's big Netflix docuseries has arrived. Titled Harry & Meghan, the six-episode series focuses on the life and love story of the Duke and Duchess of Sussex and promises an unprecedented, intimate look into the couple's relationship. It also promises a lot of inside intel on the royal family in general. Volume I of the six-episode series is now streaming, with the second volume arriving on Dec. 15. 
In one trailer for the project, Harry admits, ‚ÄúIt's really hard to look back on it now and go, ‚ÄòWhat on earth happened?‚Äô‚Äù
Harry & Meghan. A Netflix Global Event.Volume I: December 8Volume II: December 15 pic.twitter.com/WpFzVEC7Yx
To help make sense of it all, here's a short primer on the couple's relationship so far.
All the couple would say at first was that they were introduced by friends in the summer of 2016, but two years later E! News revealed it was Harry's childhood friend Violet von Westenholz who introduced him to Meghan.  
Von Westenholz had met Meghan while working in PR with Ralph Lauren. The Suits actress had been in London for a while and making friend with ‚Äúthe high society set really easily,‚Äù the source explained. After Harry confided his dating issues in his friend, Meghan came to her mind. The Prince had actually never watched Suits, and was very pleasantly surprised when he met his future wife for the first time. There was an instant attraction.
In Harry & Meghan, the couple clarified that they first interacted on Instagram before going on their first date. 
‚ÄúMeghan and I met over Instagram,‚Äù Harry said. ‚ÄúI was scrolling through my feed and someone who was a friend had this video of the two of them, it was like a Snapchat, and it‚Äôs ‚Ä¶ with doggy ears and ... that was the first thing, it was like who is that?‚Äù
He added, ‚ÄúAnd then we got each other‚Äôs numbers and we were just constantly in touch, and I went, ‚ÄòLet‚Äôs meet.‚Äô‚Äù They ultimately met at 76 Dean Street in London. Meghan recalls that her now-husband was half an hour late, but he was ‚Äúso sweet‚Äù and ‚Äúgenuinely so embarrassed‚Äù for his tardiness. ‚ÄúHe was just so fun,‚Äù Meghan added. ‚ÄúJust so refreshingly fun. And that was the thing, we were like childlike together.‚Äù 
In an interview just after their engagement, Harry shared the story of their first few dates. 
‚ÄúWe met once and twice back-to-back, two dates in London, last July,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúBeginning of July. Then, it was three maybe four weeks later that I managed to persuade her to join me in Botswana, and we camped out with each other under the stars.‚Äù
Meghan added, ‚ÄúIt was definitely a set up, it was a blind date.‚Äù
She added that the fact that Harry was a member of the British royal family wasn't the most important thing to her ‚Äî she just wanted to date a nice guy.
‚ÄúBecause I'm from the States, you don't grow up with the same understanding of the royal family,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúAnd so, while I now understand very clearly there's a global interest there, I didn't know much about him, so the only thing I asked her when she said she wanted to set us up‚ÄîI had one question‚ÄîI said, ‚ÄòWell, is he nice?‚Äô Because if he wasn't kind, it didn't seem like it would make sense. And so we went, and had met for a drink, and then I think very quickly into that said, ‚ÄòWell, what are we doing tomorrow? We should meet again.‚Äô‚Äù
The tabloids caught wind of their relationship pretty quickly, essentially forcing an official confession from Kensington Palace a few months later. Harry's public statement about the fact that he and Meghan were dating was really a condemnation of the media's ‚Äúabuse and harassment‚Äù and racism targeting her. 
‚ÄúIt is not right that a few months into a relationship with him that Ms. Markle should be subjected to such a storm,‚Äù the statement reads. ‚ÄúHe knows commentators will say this is ‚Äòthe price she has to pay‚Äô and that ‚Äòthis is all part of the game‚Äô. He strongly disagrees. This is not a game - it is her life and his.‚Äù
Unfortunately, this was just the beginning of difficult conflicts the couple would face with the British public and their own family.
The couple made their first public appearance together with Meghan supporting Harry as he played in a charity polo match. The Duchess is often seen over the years supporting her husband from the sidelines as he plays his favorite sport.
After being introduced to his immediate family, Meghan was Harry's plus one at the wedding of Pippa Middleton, Kate Middeton's sister. Pippa married James Matthews in Bucklebury, England. Evidently, Meghan was not at the wedding ceremony, but Harry drove 100 miles to pick her up at Kensington Palace, London, then back to the Berkshire village of Englefield for the rest of the festivities. 
At the time, ELLE UK reported that it is ‚Äúagainst royal protocol for members of the royal family to upstage proceedings,‚Äù and the public's interest in Meghan would have definitely stolen some attention from the bride on her big day.
The couple traveled to Botswana, Africa, for the former actress's 36th birthday and to introduce her to some of his friends in the area. 
‚ÄúHe was thrilled to bits that he could introduce her to them,‚Äù a source told US at the time. ‚ÄúThe celebration began almost the minute they touched down. ‚Ä¶ Meghan was speechless and so touched.‚Äù
Rumors of an imminent engagement were running wild at the time.
Meghan made an appearance on the cover of Vanity Fair, revealing the depth of her romance in the interview.
‚ÄúWe‚Äôre a couple. We‚Äôre in love,‚Äù she told the magazine. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sure there will be a time when we have to come forward and present ourselves, and have stories to tell, but I hope what people will understand is that this is our time. This is for us. It‚Äôs part of what makes it so special, that it‚Äôs just ours. But we‚Äôre happy. Personally, I love a great love story.‚Äù
Later that same month, she was seen with Harry at the Invictus Games, the charity he founded for war veterans of outstanding athletic achievement. Also in attendance was Meghan's mother, Doria Ragland.
This was also the month where Meghan was first introduced to the Queen at the monarch‚Äôs summer residence, Balmoral Castle. 
Though she'd been spending a lot of time in the U.K., Meghan still had to finish shooting her role on Suits. In late November 2017, it was reported that she was an official London resident.
‚ÄúMeghan has officially moved out of her Toronto apartment,‚Äù a source told US Weekly. ‚ÄúMovers were seen there yesterday and today. Meghan‚Äôs furniture from her Toronto home will be going into storage and her personal belongings are being sent to the UK.‚Äù
The actual engagement supposedly took place earlier in the month, but it was announced on November 27.
‚ÄúHis Royal Highness The Prince of Wales is delighted to announce the engagement of Prince Harry to Ms. Meghan Markle,‚Äù the official statement read. ‚ÄúHis Royal Highness and Ms. Markle became engaged in London earlier this month. Prince Harry has informed Her Majesty The Queen and other close members of his family. Prince Harry has also sought and received the blessing of Ms. Markle's parents.‚Äù
Meghan's ring was designed with diamonds from one of Princess Diana's brooches, connecting her to her late mother-in-law.  In an interview with the BBC, Harry said, ‚ÄúThe ring is obviously yellow gold, because that's her favorite, and the main stone itself I sourced from Botswana, and the little diamonds on either side are from my mother's jewelry collection, to make sure she's with us on this crazy journey together.‚Äù
Meghan discussed in the same interview how she had met Queen Elizabeth II, Harry's grandmother. ‚ÄúShe's an incredible woman,‚Äù she said.
In Harry & Meghan, the couple shared how exactly Harry popped the question: he got down on one knee on a blanket outside Kensington Palace. ‚ÄúIn the North garden, being overlooked by the staff flats, I got 15 of those electric candles,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúOf course I got down on one knee. Of course I did.‚Äù 
Meghan knew her answer immediately. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs down on one knee and I was just like, ‚ÄòYes!‚Äô‚Äù she said in the doc. ‚ÄúWe were so joyful and excited. I was like, ‚ÄòAh, we‚Äôre doing this!‚Äô‚Äù
In a gorgeous ceremony at the traditional St. George‚Äôs Chapel in Windsor Castle, the couple officially wed on May 19, 2018. Forbes reported that 29 million people tuned in for the live-broadcast, and there were 600 guests in attendance. Meghan wore a Givenchy dress designed by Clare Waight Keller with a boat neck and elegant train, which she adorned with Queen Mary's diamond bandeau tiara.
This couple announced their first pregnancy on Instagram, writing, ‚ÄúTheir Royal Highnesses The Duke and Duchess of Sussex are very pleased to announce that The Duchess of Sussex is expecting a baby in the Spring of 2019.‚Äù
‚ÄúTheir Royal Highnesses have appreciated all of the support they have received from people around the world since their wedding in May and are delighted to be able to share this happy news with the public.‚Äù
The announcement came out as they embarked on a 16-day royal tour through Australia, Fiji, Tonga, and New Zealand. After arriving home, they settled in at Windsor Castle's Frogmore Cottage.
‚ÄúThe Duke and Duchess of Sussex will move to Frogmore Cottage on the Windsor Estate early next year as they prepare for the arrival of their first child,‚Äù their office said at the time in a statement to People. ‚ÄúWindsor is a very special place for Their Royal Highnesses and they are grateful that their official residence will be on the estate.‚Äù
Archie Harrison Mountbatten-Windsor was born on May 6, 2019, in London. In a statement on Instagram, the Palace announced, ‚ÄúTheir Royal Highnesses‚Äô son weighs 7lbs. 3oz. The duchess and baby are both healthy and well, and the couple thank members of the public for their shared excitement and support during this very special time in their lives.‚Äù
‚ÄúIt has been the most amazing experience I could have ever possibly imagined,‚Äù Harry said to reporters just afterwards. ‚ÄúHow any woman does what they do is beyond comprehension, but we're both absolutely thrilled and so grateful for all the love and support from everybody out there.‚Äù
In a controversial decision, Meghan and Harry announced that they are stepping back from their duties as working members of the Royal Family and planning to make the move to the U.S.
‚ÄúAfter many months of reflection and internal discussions, we have chosen to make a transition this year in starting to carve out a progressive new role within this institution. We intend to step back as ‚Äòsenior‚Äô members of the Royal Family and work to become financially independent, while continuing to fully support Her Majesty The Queen,‚Äù they wrote in a statement on Instagram.
‚ÄúWe now plan to balance our time between the United Kingdom and North America, continuing to honour our duty to The Queen, the Commonwealth, and our patronages,‚Äù they continued. ‚ÄúThis geographic balance will enable us to raise our son with an appreciation for the royal tradition into which he was born, while also providing our family with the space to focus on the next chapter, including the launch of our new charitable entity.‚Äù
BREAKING: Prince Harry: "There was no other option."Prince Harry has revealed he and Meghan felt they had no other option but to leave the Royal Family behind during a speech for his Sentebale charity.Read more here: https://t.co/2tNh1kBEXM pic.twitter.com/8plUnoJlX5
The couple settled into the neighborhood of Montecito, California, where life seems to move at a more relaxing pace. 
‚ÄúThis kind of stuff is so basic, but it‚Äôs really fulfilling and about getting back to basics," Meghan told Bustle of their hobby of raising chickens and living a regular family life, comparatively. 
A few months later, The New York Times reported that the pair signed a multi-year deal with Netflix through their new production company, for ‚Äúdocumentaries, docu-series, feature films, scripted shows, and children‚Äôs programming.‚Äù
‚ÄúOur focus will be on creating content that informs but also gives hope,‚Äù the couple said in a statement. ‚ÄúAs new parents, making inspirational family programming is also important to us.‚Äù 
In an essay for The New York Times, Meghan revealed she had a miscarriage over the summer.
‚ÄúAfter changing his [Archie's] diaper, I felt a sharp cramp. I dropped to the floor with him in my arms, humming a lullaby to keep us both calm, the cheerful tune a stark contrast to my sense that something was not right,‚Äù she wrote. ‚ÄúI knew, as I clutched my firstborn child, that I was losing my second.‚Äù
Meghan and Harry signed a multi-year deal with the music and podcast streaming giant, through their company Archewell Audio, named after their son. 
‚ÄúWhat we love about podcasting is that it reminds all of us to take a moment and to really listen, to connect to one another without distraction,‚Äù Harry and Meghan said in a statement. ‚ÄúWith the challenges of 2020, there has never been a more important time to do so, because when we hear each other, and hear each other‚Äôs stories, we are reminded of how interconnected we all are.‚Äù
Meghan's show Archetypes begins airing in 2022 and is an instant hit.
The couple shared another photo through a friend of their new expectation, this time a daughter.
On Valentine‚Äôs Day, they said in a statement to US Weekly, ‚ÄúWe can confirm that Archie is going to be a big brother.‚Äù
Harry and Meghan sat down with Oprah Winfrey for a special tell-all interview about their decision to step back as royals and what their lives were like in the palace. 
The couple made some big revelations during the sit-down, including Meghan detailing the racism she experienced in the U.K. and that someone in the royal household made comments on their future child's skin color. Meghan also discussed her mental health struggles while dealing with the pressures of royal life. She recalled that at one point, she ‚Äújust didn‚Äôt want to be alive anymore.‚Äù Harry also said he felt ‚Äúreally let down‚Äù by his father, King Charles, and that his relationship with his brother, Prince William, ‚Äúis space, at the moment.‚Äù
Lilibet Diana Mountbatten-Windsor was born on June 4, and named in honor of her great-grandmother Queen Elizabeth II, who was lovingly called Lilibet by family. Her middle name was clearly intended to honor Harry‚Äôs mother, Princess Diana. They call their youngest Lili for short.
After several years away, and some back-and-forth over safety issues for the family, Meghan and Harry returned to the U.K. to celebrate the Queen's 70th year as a monarch, her Platinum Jubilee.
The family gathered together once more at Windsor following the Queen's death in September 2022. After rumors of frosty relations between Harry and his brother Prince William, the two brothers were seen with their wives greeting mourners and surveying the tributes left in the Queen's honor.
Harry and Meghan spoke about their first date, engagement, and wedding at length for the first time, along with what led them to step back from their senior royal family roles.  
Harry acknowledged he may never receive an apology from his family or the institution for all that happened. ‚ÄúAnd I‚Äôve had to make peace with the fact that we‚Äôre probably never going to get a genuine accountability or a genuine apology. My wife and I, we‚Äôre moving on. We‚Äôre focused on what‚Äôs coming next.‚Äù
‚ÄúThere‚Äôs times when I‚Äôve been angry, but I can‚Äôt be that angry because I genuinely feel that I, and we, are exactly where we‚Äôre supposed to be,‚Äù he added in the last episode's final minutes. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve made it to the other side.‚Äù
Notably, Harry details Kate's icy reception to Meghan from the very beginning. He wrote that Kate was likely ‚Äúon edge,‚Äù understanding that she was now ‚Äúgoing to be compared to, and forced to compete with, Meg.‚Äù 
In late March 2023, Harry returned to the UK to appear in court for the legal case he and several other public figures were waging against Associated Newspapers Ltd (ANL), which are the publishers of British tabloids The Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday. In a witness statement, via People, he discussed how his relationship with Meghan Markle led him to become more concerned about the tabloids' treatment of them. 
The press's treatment of Meghan made him "increasingly troubled by the [royal family's] approach of not taking action against the press in the wake of vicious persistent attacks on, harassment of and intrusive, sometimes racist articles concerning Meghan,‚Äù he said in the statement. He noted the ‚Äúthe situation got worse‚Äù when Meghan was pregnant with their first child Archie.
Harry stated that this claim is ‚Äúnot just about me. I am bringing this claim because I love my country and I remain deeply concerned by the unchecked power, influence and criminality of Associated. The evidence I have seen shows that Associated's journalists are criminals with journalistic powers which should concern every single one of us. The British public deserve to know the full extent of this cover up and I feel it is my duty to expose it.‚Äù
In June, Meghan and Harry ended their deal with Spotify and their Archewell Audio division announced that they ‚Äúhave mutually agreed to part ways and are proud of the series [Meghant‚Äôs Archetypes] we made together.‚Äù
A source talking to People said part of it was the podcast production at Spotify, and part of it was personality-based.
‚ÄúWhat works in podcasting is authenticity and intimacy and revealing things either about yourself or about a topic that says something that [listeners] haven‚Äôt really thought about,‚Äù the insider said. ‚ÄúNone of that happened. And Meghan wasn‚Äôt prepared to do that, because she lives an incredibly guarded life.‚Äù
Another source close to Archetypes‚Äô production said that Meghan and Harry ‚Äúwere given no formal lay of the land to kick things off, so they were already on unsteady footing even before the ink was dry.‚Äù
‚ÄúThings moved very slowly on both ends,‚Äù the source said. ‚ÄúIt was rare to have a direct conversation with them, so everything had to flow through a million middle persons."
Another source told Us Weekly that Meghan and Harry are ‚Äúregrouping.‚Äù 
‚ÄúThey want to figure out how they can best expand the entertainment side of things,‚Äù they said, adding that the couple felt ‚Äúsnubbed‚Äù by Emmys voters when their Netflix docuseries Harry & Meghan received no nominations.

Flawless skin with just one zap.
While you might be feeling down about the end of summer, the fall and winter seasons are the perfect time to finally test out some of the best at-home laser hair removal tools. Even though the convenience of using your favorite razor in the shower is an excellent option for hair removal, it can be tedious, result in ingrown hairs, and become an exhausting process if what you‚Äôre after is skin as smooth as a baby seal. If you‚Äôre anything like me, using an at-home hair removal device is equally thrilling and terrifying. I find shaving tedious, but my first foray into permanent hair removal didn‚Äôt go well. After spending hundreds of dollars at an esthetician‚Äôs office, I found laser hair removal was not effective enough to justify the pain. Because I‚Äôm someone who can easily cosplay as Snow White (pale skin, dark hair, high tolerance for short men), I‚Äôm the ideal candidate for laser hair removal. But alas, I had to give it up for the sake of my sanity and my wallet.
I thought I was resigned to using a razor forever. Then, I stumbled upon the Braun IPL Silk Expert Pro device. Not only was it significantly cheaper, less painful, and less humiliating than the salon service, but I actually started to see results quickly. For all of the many methods of body-hair removal out there‚Äîfrom shaving with the best razors to sugaring to waxing‚Äîlaser hair removal (both professional and at home) is the only strategy that promises more permanent results. 
At-home handheld hair removal devices come in two categories: IPL or a diode laser. Most at-home laser hair removal devices rely on IPL‚Äîintense pulsated light‚Äîtherapy, in which tiny beams of light at different wavelengths zap the bulb within each hair follicle. ‚ÄúIn essence, it is using heat to destroy the hair follicles,‚Äù says dermatologist Dr. Marisa K. Garshick, who mentions that dermatologists also use versions of IPL for photo rejuvenation procedures (a.k.a. fading dark spots). On the flip side, diode laser technology uses one single wavelength of light, which experts say can help minimize damage to the surrounding skin and be used safely on all skin types and shades. The light is selectively absorbed by the pigment, or melanin, within the hair follicle, making it a more targeted (and often more effective) approach to hair removal. 
According to dermatologist Dr. Karan Lal, it‚Äôs important to note that most at-home devices are ‚Äúbest suited for small to medium hairs in small areas‚Äîupper lip, chin, cheeks, bikini, etc.,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúThey are typically not meant for large surface areas like the back.‚Äù (There are a few exceptions, but we‚Äôll get to that later).

Dr. Marisa K. Garshick is a dermatologist practicing with MCDS Dermatology in New York and New Jersey.
Dr. Karan Lal is a dermatologist and director of pediatric dermatology and cosmetic surgery at Affiliated Dermatology in Scottsdale, Arizona. 
‚ÄúBoth IPL and diode devices rely on the same target, which is the pigment of the hair follicle, to have an effect,‚Äù Dr. Garshick says. She adds, ‚ÄúAt the most basic level, the diode refers to an actual laser, while the IPL is a light-based device.‚ÄùWith a bit of consistency and a lot of patience whichever light beam route you opt for will come with real results. Typically, it will take at least a few sessions to see any change, and each session should be spaced out at least one week apart. Remember always to follow the instructions of your specific device.
Depending on the intensity level of the laser (many of the devices have multiple settings), it can feel uncomfortable. When each follicle gets zapped, it might sting a bit‚Äîmany people compare it to a rubber band being snapped on the skin. But hey, no pain, no gain, right?
Before you start shopping (and zapping) away, we do have one important editor‚Äôs note: Since laser hair removal relies on melanin to produce results, it‚Äôs often not effective on lighter hair colors, like blonde and light gray, which, by nature, contain less pigment. If you have a lighter hair color, consult with a dermatologist before investing your money into an expensive at-home device. Also, read the fine print of every product description because most companies disclose this information upfront. Laser hair removal is also safe for people of color, but certain lasers can cause hyperpigmentation and irritation on darker skin tones, so again, it is best to consult your dermatologist.
Generally speaking, laser hair removal devices are safe. But that doesn‚Äôt mean you shouldn‚Äôt take proper precautions. ‚ÄúAt-home laser hair removal can be safe,‚Äù says Dr. Lal. However,  he adds, ‚ÄúIt is not universally safe because many factors play a role in safety. All available devices are safe for those with light skin and dark hair.‚Äù Needless to say, burns and redness can still occur with less powerful at-home devices. Contact a doctor if you are concerned or notice any discomfort or irritation. 
Dr. Lal has a few helpful tips to make removal easier and safer: ‚ÄúBe sure to have tiny stubble the laser can pick up for treatment. Make sure the device you are using is suitable for your skin color and hair color. Don‚Äôt use this laser if you have red or very light blonde hair. For in-office treatments, ‚ÄúThe gold standard is the Gentlemax Pro by Candela. It is a dual alexandrite and Nd-Yag laser that can treat all skin types, hairs of various sizes, and in various locations,‚Äù says Dr. Lal.
