title: ELLE Escapes: Dubrovnik
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
Despite a flood of tourists in recent years, Croatian hot spot Dubrovnik is absolutely worth spending your flight miles on. Often called ‚Äúthe Pearl of the Adriatic,‚Äù this coastal southern European city has so much to offer‚Äîfrom its imposing, sea-kissed fortress walls and palatial architecture  seen on Game of Thrones to its rich history and award-winning food and wine. In fact, this medieval, cliffside marvel has been a UNESCO World Heritage Site for over four decades, and was beautifully restored in the aftermath of the Croatian War of Independence in the ‚Äô90s.
Like the rest of the country, Dubrovnik is a melting pot of Italian and Balkan cultural influences‚Äîyet it still has its own unique identity. I began my 11-day Croatian tour there, followed by a visit to the small island of Korƒçula and major port city Split. And while I was only in Dubrovnik for two days‚Äîa reasonable amount of time to see the city‚Äôs main sites‚ÄîI could have easily stayed there longer, since it was undoubtedly my favorite spot that I visited on my trip. Ahead, your full scoop on what to see, eat, drink and where to stay.
Stradun, or the main street in Dubrovnik, is where you‚Äôll find many key historic monuments, including St. Blaise‚Äôs Catholic Church, dedicated to the patron saint of Dubrovnik; Church of St. Ignatius, which houses the city‚Äôs oldest bell erected in 1355; and two monasteries also dating back to the 14th century. But, in my opinion, no tour of the Old Town would be complete without a visit to Rector‚Äôs Palace. Located in the heart of the city in Luza Square, this Gothic-Renaissance structure was built in the 15th century as the official residence of the city‚Äôs rectors‚Äîwho each served as the leader of the Republic of Dubrovnik for one-month terms. Today, the site houses the city‚Äôs Cultural Museum, which features over 10,000 artifacts ranging from furniture to fashion, artwork, coins, and armory from the 14th to 20th centuries. Spend an afternoon browsing the impressive collections and wandering the historic halls, and make sure to stop by the palace‚Äôs picturesque courtyard for some seriously stunning photo ops. (FYI, Games of Thrones fans may recognize this museum as the Spice King‚Äôs Palace.) While entry to this particular site isn‚Äôt free, you can purchase a single ticket for 15 euros or buy a Dubrovnik Pass, which includes access to this museum and a handful of others in area starting at 35 euros for the day.
As iconic as it may be, walking the Old Town walls is one of the busiest and most expensive attractions in Dubrovnik. Instead, you can hike up to Mount Srƒë for free to enjoy an even more spectacular outlook without all the long lines. (You can also reach the peak by cable car, but a round-trip ride will set you back 27 euros). The head of the trail, called Staza Prema Utvrdi Imperial, is about a 20-minute walk from the main entrance of the Old Town, and once you get started, the hike is moderately challenging. You‚Äôll definitely work up a sweat while climbing the cobblestone switchbacks, but the breathtaking panoramic views at the top make the trek absolutely worth it. Plus, the peak even has a few attractions, including a large fortress, a massive stone cross, the Homeland War Museum, and a dreamy restaurant. Word to the wise: Leave at least three hours for the journey so you can make it all the way to the top, spend some time there, and leisurely walk back down to the City Gates.
If you‚Äôre looking to escape the crowds of the Old Town, I highly recommend visiting the Elaphitis for a day. This cluster of 14 islands is situated just northwest of Dubrovnik, with the three largest islets‚ÄîKoloƒçep, Lopud, and ≈†ipan‚Äîcurrently being the only permanently inhabited. I signed up for a snorkel tour embarking from the Old Town harbor for about 60 euros, which began by stopping at Croatia‚Äôs famous blue and green sea caves off the remote islands of Bi≈°evo and Ravnik. During certain times of day, sunlight will creep through the cave walls and bounce off the white seabeds, giving the water an enchanting, iridescent effect. Finally, we enjoyed a few hours at Lopud‚Äôs beautiful Sunj Beach, one of the most beloved and only sandy beaches on the Elaphiti Islands. While I chose to relax shoreside and splash in the shallow waters during my time there, you can also hike up to the town to explore an old ruined fortress and Franciscan monastery. Alternatively, sommeliers and foodies may prefer to venture to ≈†ipan, known for its verdant vineyards and olive groves. Or, if you‚Äôre seeking the ultimate tranquil getaway, consider heading to Koloƒçep, the smallest, lushest, and most serene of the three islands.
Pair with Mason Bottom.
Hotel restaurants can get a bad rap for having lackluster menus and sub-par atmospheres, but Restaurant Pjerin‚Äîlocated inside the gorgeous Villa Dubrovnik hotel‚Äîis certainly an exception. This Michelin-recommended eatery offers exquisite Mediterranean dishes and is the epitome of ‚Äúquiet luxury,‚Äù featuring soft, minimalist, neutral d√©cor set against absolutely mesmerizing views of the turquoise-tinged Adriatic. I went for a stunning sunset dinner on the restaurant‚Äôs spacious terrace and ordered the delicately rolled lobster pasta and chocolate cake with pistachio gelato for dessert. To start, patrons were also treated to a complimentary selection of seasonal breads and  hors d‚Äôoeuvres‚Äîwhich included a mouth-watering sea bass tartare, crispy fish balls, and a refreshing green gazpacho made with avocado and black pepper. Each dish was presented so artfully that when my waiter brought out the restaurant‚Äôs (also complimentary) tasting of chocolate truffles at the end of my meal, I did, indeed, nearly shed a tear.  
Dubrovnik admittedly isn‚Äôt an inexpensive European city to visit, so for anyone seeking quality dining options on a budget, I recommend Wanda. Spearheaded by former Los Angeles restauranteur and Dubrovnik-native Goran Starƒçiƒá, this quaint joint on Prijeko street serves up an array of simple, affordable, and tasty Mediterranean classics‚Äîthink icons like squid ink risotto and spaghetti alle vongole, all made with locally-sourced ingredients. (I had the latter and can confirm it was delicious). You can also expect fast service and a relaxing ambiance, complete with a lovely outdoor seating area protected from all the hustle and bustle.
Ask any local for Dubrovnik restaurant recommendations, and they‚Äôll likely point you to 360. The Michelin-starred restaurant is popular for its five-course tasting menus and gourmet √† la carte options delivering fresh spins on traditional Mediterranean and Croatian dishes. With its swanky dining room flanking the harbor, meticulously plated menu, and thoughtful wine pairings, 360 should certainly be on your itinerary. Just note the restaurant is only open for dinner, and it‚Äôs wise to make a reservation, as this place books up quickly.
Tourists flock to this bar built into the cliffs not only to enjoy a refreshing libation, but also namely to watch brave souls jump into the sea below. Head downstairs to the base of the establishment to take in all the action, or if you‚Äôre feeling adventurous, join the lineup. You can jump off the cliff from different points, anywhere from about 15 feet to 60 feet above, depending on your comfort level. Keep in mind the bar is cash only and doesn‚Äôt serve cocktails, only bottled beer. Oh, and it‚Äôs probably not the best idea to drink and jump!
Another dazzling watering hole, Cave Bar More is located on the Lapad peninsula just two miles away from the bustling Old Town. It‚Äôs set within a natural cave beneath the Hotel More, extending three levels and opening up to an idyllic outdoor patio on the cliffs. (This bar can also be rented for private events like wedding parties and proposals, so you can expect the vibes to be top-notch). Naturally, the cocktails are Insta-worthy as well.
Although Croatia is quickly becoming a force in the wine world (Croatian wines earned over a dozen metals at the 2022 Decanter World Awards, the most prestigious wine competition in the global industry), few Croatian wines are exported. To sample some of the country‚Äôs finest while you‚Äôre visiting, head to D‚Äôvino Wine Bar Dubrovnik. This homey haunt has over 60 wine varietals, including a number from local small wine producers and family vineyards across Croatia‚Äôs renowned wine regions like Slavonia, Istria, and Pelje≈°ac. Choose from a vast selection of deep reds to dry whites, and consider pairing your vino with one of the bar‚Äôs gourmet meat and cheese platters. For a more hands-on experience, D‚Äôvino also hosts educational wine tastings Wednesdays through Sundays starting at 210 kn per person (or about $30 a pop).
Nestled on a quiet street just a few steps away from the Pile Gate, the St. Joseph‚Äôs boutique hotel is about as charming as it gets. The 16th-century building contains just six rooms, which have all been elegantly renovated while still retaining some of the original stonework. I began my stay in the cozy attic room and moved to the Deluxe King Suite during my second night. Aside from the Deluxe Apartment (an adjacent cottage that was once a family home in the 13th century), this is the largest space you can stay in‚Äîcomplete with a sizable lounging area, a dining table, kitchenette, and luxe marbled bathroom with his and her sinks. And if the sophisticated digs weren‚Äôt enough, the delightful staff treats you like absolute royalty. Every morning, guests can take advantage of a complimentary breakfast of local sweets, savory dishes, and a signature green smoothie prepared by the in-house chef. And when you stay in the King Suite, you can get the spread delivered to your room (you can best believe I rolled out of bed in the hotel‚Äôs plush bathrobe and slippers to grab mine). The concierge also provides superb 24-hour service and will kindly walk you and your luggage to and from the hotel and city entrance, since no cars are allowed to drive within the Old Town. 
My visit to Restaurant Pjerin left me enraptured by Villa Dubrovnik itself. A scenic 15-minute stroll from the Old Town, this secluded property is a dreamy, airy oasis. There are a total of 56 guest rooms, all of which feature private sea view terraces and some of which even boast their own plunge pools and jacuzzis. Other on-site amenities include an outdoor deck for tanning, an indoor swimming pool, gym, sauna, and even a sun-drenched library for when you just want to curl up with a good book. My takeaway: You could truly relax here all day and not feel guilty about it. 
Part of the Adriatic Luxury Hotels network, Hotel Excelsior is one of the swankiest hotels in Dubrovnik‚Äîwith a five-star rating and past celebrity guests like Queen Elizabeth II and Elizabeth Taylor to prove it. The 158-room property is set in a former royal villa, now outfitted with modern, custom-made furnishings and a variety of opulent amenities. There‚Äôs a fitness center, two restaurants, a spa with Turkish baths and an indoor swimming pool, a private sunbathing area, and more. The entire property is just a five-minute walk from the fortress walls, but if the idea of luxuriating in your bathtub while taking in the Old Town sights tickles your fancy, the Excelsior Signature Suite will be right up your alley. 
Keep your skin protected and looking its best with this dermatologist-crafted sunscreen, featuring added antioxidants and plumping peptides. 
After a dip in the Adriatic, I have to make sure my full brows don‚Äôt look crazy. A quite swipe of this clear, flexible wax, and you‚Äôre good to go. 
For a streak-free mug come rain, sweat, or shine, don‚Äôt forget to pack Charlotte Tilbury‚Äôs Airbrush Flawless Setting Spray. You can also spritz a layer of this underneath your foundation for an extra dose of hydration.
Sam Peters is a Senior Commerce Editor at Hearst covering fashion, beauty and lifestyle. Her writing has appeared in WWD, Footwear News, Real Simple, PopSugar and Bridal Guide, among others. She enjoys¬†unpacking the latest trends and testing and reviewing some of the most innovative, emerging products on the market.¬†

title: The Bizarre Americana Style of Love Is Blind‚Äôs JP
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
He‚Äôs a walking red (white and blue) flag.
Of the three couples who made it out of the pods in season 5 of Love Is Blind, only two of them survived the fateful Mexico trip, where the new fianc√©s are meant to get to know each other physically after weeks of only talking from behind a wall. The couple that didn‚Äôt survive‚ÄîJared Pierce (JP), a firefighter, and Taylor Rue, a teacher‚Äîburned out in such spectacular fashion that it makes you wonder what they even saw in each other in the first place. After an awkward reveal, during which JP looked like he had never interacted with a human woman in his entire life, things only became progressively more uncomfortable, until finally he admitted that he was finding it difficult to communicate with Taylor because he didn‚Äôt like the makeup she wore at the reveal. (Huh?)
Yet throughout each increasingly excruciating scene‚Äîfrom their first pod meeting in episode 1 to their final goodbye in episode 6‚ÄîJP reveals a personal style quirk far more sinister than heavy makeup: the man is obsessed with American flags. This includes but is not limited to: American flag socks, T-shirts, button-downs, basketball jerseys, bathing suits, sneakers, and‚Äîour personal favorite‚Äîan American flag handkerchief that he snots all over and then proceeds to politely fold and gingerly place atop the couch pillow, as if he didn‚Äôt just blow his nose into it. 
JP‚Äôs obsession with the American flag isn‚Äôt just an affectation played up for the show. According to his Instagram, his love of America is not just a style choice, it‚Äôs a lifestyle. Here he is at the beach with red and white stripes down his back, wearing American flag swim trunks and an America baseball hat. Here he is posing his dog next to a red, white, and blue fire hydrant. Here he is going skiing for the first time in a star-spangled snowsuit. His friends even threw him a ‚Äúsurprise America party‚Äù for his 30th birthday. 
Love Is Blind fans across the internet appear to be equally baffled by JP‚Äôs style choices, particularly those who aren‚Äôt American. ‚ÄúJP seems to wear a lot of flags. He‚Äôs either wearing a shirt with stars, stripes, both or it‚Äôs red, white and/or blue. It‚Äôs in every episode which is odd,‚Äù wrote one Redditor. ‚ÄúGranted, I‚Äôm not from the U.S., so this could be just a standard styling choice that a lot of people employ to show their patriotism. Is this abnormal? Do people carry flags? What‚Äôs going on here? Would love some context from someone local.‚Äù
But even Americans are confused. ‚ÄúThis is weird af, right? I‚Äôm an East Coast black male and we don‚Äôt really do the star-spangled thing,‚Äù another Redditor wrote. ‚ÄúThat said, what kind of nutcase owns that much flag stuff? Before anyone says it, I am well aware of the MAGA crazies. I just assume they have other kinds of clothing to cycle through‚Ä¶‚Äù
American flag clothing has a complicated history; for some, donning stars and stripes is the ultimate symbol of pride for one‚Äôs country. For others, turning the flag into something to wear can feel disrespectful. Since the middle of the 20th century, the American flag has been worn as both a sign of protest and a sign of national support. In the wake of Sept. 11, 2001, the flag served as an emotional symbol, meant to unify a grieving nation. But after the 2016 election, the American flag has become seemingly inextricable from Donald Trump and his flock of MAGA followers. As The New Yorker put it, ‚ÄúTo some, the American flag represents freedom, but the nation‚Äôs most enduring symbol is taken on partisan significance.‚Äù This partisan affiliation with the flag hasn‚Äôt been lost on internet commenters: ‚ÄúSomeone needs to find out where [JP] was Jan 6th,‚Äù quipped one Redditor. 
Whatever JP intended to communicate with his stars and stripes getups, he‚Äôs stayed largely under the radar since his breakup with Taylor aired last week. Taylor, meanwhile, has spoken out about how much his comments about her makeup upset her. ‚ÄúIt was hurtful,‚Äù she told USA Today. ‚ÄúI was also really confused, because I don't know how you can completely change because of the way someone looks.‚Äù This season, it seems the show has finally answered the question its title poses: Love is not, in fact, blind. But it is patriotic.
Jessica Roy is the former Digital Director of ELLE.com. Prior to that, she worked as the News Editor of The Cut. She likes baking, running, and Instagrams of your dog.

title: Fair Play Was Always Going to End Like This
text:
‚ÄúFor me, more than being a film about female empowerment, this is really a film about male fragility,‚Äù director Chloe Domont tells ELLE.com.
This story contains discussions of sexual assault. If you or someone you know needs support, contact the National Sexual Assault Hotline at 800-656-HOPE (4673) or visit rainn.org.
Spoilers below. 
Fair Play‚Äôs first and final scenes couldn‚Äôt feel more different. The former shows two lovers in a state of careless bliss, hooking up and simultaneously getting engaged in the bathroom at someone else‚Äôs wedding; the latter has them unraveling in a fierce confrontation, one wielding a blade at the other. But in a way, the film ends the same way it begins: in blood. 
In the opener, Emily (Phoebe Dynevor) is on her period while her fianc√© Luke (Alden Ehrenreich) performs oral sex on her. In the closer, Luke is the one who bleeds as Emily scolds him and slashes his arm with a kitchen knife. Their tense confrontation concludes with her killer last line: ‚ÄúNow wipe the blood off my floor, and get out. I‚Äôm done with you now.‚Äù 
‚ÄúIt was always going to build to that moment, and it was always going to end there,‚Äù writer and director Chloe Domont tells ELLE.com. So, how exactly did we get there?
Let‚Äôs go back to the beginning: Domont wanted her lead couple to get engaged at the start of the film so viewers could see them happy and in love before things went downhill. She wondered, ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs the most ridiculous way that a couple could get engaged?‚Äù Then she realized: ‚ÄúOh, if they‚Äôre covered in blood, basically.‚Äù The result is a messy, dysfunctional, yet charmingly awkward sex scene, but the stains on Luke‚Äôs face and Emily‚Äôs dress are an omen: ‚ÄúWhat the blood represents is the violence to come, which is telling the audience, ‚ÄòDon‚Äôt get too comfortable.‚Äô‚Äù
Throughout the course of the film, Emily and Luke‚Äôs seemingly perfect romance crumbles when she gets promoted over him at their cutthroat hedge fund where, by the way, no one knows they‚Äôre dating. Luke is reluctantly congratulatory at first; he wants to be a caring, supportive partner, but his resentment grows as Emily buddies up with the guys at the office and makes big wins for the firm (further proving that she deserved the job and he didn‚Äôt), all while still dressing like ‚Äúa cupcake‚Äù at work. 
Luke‚Äôs snide remarks turn into slut-shaming and eventually into a full spiral that involves him showing up to work erratic and disheveled, sabotaging Emily‚Äôs career during a high-stakes meeting. Grasping any semblance of power or so-called manhood, Luke tries to keep the upper hand on Emily by using physical force: Later that night, he sexually assaults her at their engagement party in a scene that starts consensually but then becomes aggressive as she tries to resist. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs the only way for Luke to reclaim the power from Emily in that moment, because he‚Äôs physically stronger than her,‚Äù Domont says.
This is the last straw for Emily. When she confronts Luke at their apartment at the end of the film, she‚Äôs feeling a lot of things‚Äîpain, anger, and still, love‚Äîbut decides to hold him accountable for his abuse. She finds him ready to move out and fly to San Francisco the next morning‚Äîto start his own firm. Apologizing isn‚Äôt on his list of priorities. 
‚ÄúUnfortunately, the only way to hold Luke accountable in that moment is to use the same physical force that he used against her,‚Äù says Domont. So, Emily grabs a knife, and makes him apologize for hurting her‚Äîprofessionally, emotionally, and physically. ‚ÄúYou sit here, suddenly acting normal after terrorizing me, after cutting me down day after day, and you think that I‚Äôm just gonna let you walk out that door and act like nothing happened?‚Äù she says in disbelief. 
She slices Luke‚Äôs arm and brings him to his knees, making him say ‚ÄúI‚Äôm nothing.‚Äù Here is when Luke finally acknowledges everything he‚Äôs done, weeping and begging for Emily‚Äôs forgiveness (‚ÄúI will do anything to make it okay for you,‚Äù). But she just orders him to clean up his bloody mess and leave. In the final shot, focused on Dynevor‚Äôs face, her knife is heard clattering to the floor off-screen. The credits roll.
‚ÄúFor me, the ending is really about Emily reclaiming the power that Luke takes away from her when he sexually assaults her,‚Äù Domont says. 
She explains, ‚ÄúUltimately, I never saw this as an ending of female revenge. While there are definitely elements of female rage from the abuse that he‚Äôs put her through, for me, the whole movie really builds up to the moment where he mutters the words, ‚ÄòI‚Äôm nothing.‚Äô That‚Äôs the moment where he finally faces his own inferiority, when he finally faces his own weakness, and his own failures. His inability to face all those things causes so much harm, and so much destruction for both of them over the course of this film. When he finally does embrace that, you see him just release everything in his body, everything that he‚Äôs been holding his whole life is just released in this moment of finally just accepting this thing that he‚Äôs been running from. For me, more than being a film about female empowerment, this is really a film about male fragility.‚Äù
Domont set out ‚Äúto make a thriller about power dynamics on the ugliest level,‚Äù and she did.
As for the ‚Äúwipe the blood off my floor‚Äù closing line, she wanted to give the audience ‚Äúone final surprise.‚Äù And it‚Äôs true: Before she utters those words, it‚Äôs unclear what Emily will do or say to Luke, thanks to Dynevor‚Äôs layered performance. She‚Äôs not entirely consumed with rage and it seems possible she‚Äôll lean in to kiss him. 
‚ÄúWe‚Äôve seen her go back to him before, and so I wanted to just tee up the audience to believe, ‚ÄòOh my God, is she going to go back together with him again? Is this going to be a moment where they just both submit to a life of pain and dysfunction?‚Äô As you‚Äôre sitting with that, then she undercuts him with the [line], which is, ‚ÄòNo, I‚Äôm actually done with this, and I‚Äôm done with you.‚Äô It‚Äôs almost like she holds him for the last time, and once she does that for the last time, it‚Äôs a light switch. She‚Äôs now past it, and she‚Äôs out, and that‚Äôs it.‚Äù
Even the blocking, with Luke kneeling and Emily hovering above then bending down to him, is telling. ‚ÄúThis is a man who refuses to accept this submissive role‚Ä¶but as soon as she forces him into submission, that‚Äôs when he‚Äôs able to release it all.‚Äù
It would be too easy to write Luke off as solely pathetic, even if that last scene really makes him seem so, but Domont empathized with the character. Luke makes a compelling antagonist because his toxicity isn‚Äôt obvious at first; his misogyny is subtle before it grows more blatant. He‚Äôs charming and loves Emily and knows he‚Äôs supposed to root for her, but struggles when his own power is tested. He‚Äôs the kind of liberal millennial man who was raised on traditional gender roles but learned to shed them as he grew up. But still, when he feels threatened, he reverts to suppressing Emily.
‚ÄúThe more I leaned into Luke‚Äôs pain, I think I just realized that was the more interesting version of the film,‚Äù Domont says. ‚ÄúThe more that Alden tapped into that pain onscreen, and the more that we saw him struggle with those two things‚Äîwanting to support her, but also wanting to get there first‚Äîthe more that we saw him internalize the duality of those opposing forces, I thought that it‚Äôs the more human version of the film, and it‚Äôs the more exciting version of the film, because it‚Äôs not black and white.‚Äù
Even the fact that Luke goes down on Emily while she‚Äôs on her period is supposed to signal to us that he is a progressive guy. ‚ÄúI wanted to show early on that we as the audience are made to believe that this is a man who‚Äôs not threatened by a woman, because he‚Äôs literally got her blood on his face. How could he be threatened by a woman if he has her blood on his face?‚Äù Domont laughs. 
That period sex scene is also notable for breaking film taboos. Domont wrote it because ‚Äúit‚Äôs not something I had seen before.‚Äù She pointedly adds, ‚ÄúI also liked it because I knew that a man would never write this scene, so that was exciting to me, too. I am here to flip the script, and so that just felt like part of that.‚Äù
Dynevor agrees. ‚ÄúWhen you see a film like this, it really pushes you to want to create more and put more female influence out into the world. We as women know these things happen all the time, but why are we not seeing it on our screens?‚Äù she told ELLE in our October cover story.  
With themes like menstruation, sexism in the workplace, apologizing for one‚Äôs success, and the emotional labor of tending to the male ego, Domont expected Fair Play to resonate with women. But it has resonated with men too.    
At one screening, she saw ‚Äúa group of men [aged] 60-plus just huddled in a circle, just talking about their marriages, and talking about their divorces, and talking about the way they were raised. It felt like this film unlocked something that they felt afraid to talk about.‚Äù At another screening, a man in his early 80s approached her ‚Äújust so triggered by the film on so many different levels, and opening up to me about his personal experiences, and some of these dynamics. It‚Äôs incredibly gratifying.‚Äù 
Domont senses that writing a nuanced story and morally gray characters might have something to do with those reactions. ‚ÄúI think that people really appreciate that they‚Äôre not being told, or it‚Äôs not on the nose‚Äîa lesson about feminism, or a lesson about the way men should be. It‚Äôs not telling you anything, it‚Äôs just allowing you to experience something, and at the same time, enjoy it. Ultimately, I made a film that I wanted to be entertaining.‚Äù  
The director herself has enjoyed films done in a similar tone from European filmmakers like Ruben √ñstlund, Andrea Arnold, and the Dardenne Brothers. While Fair Play is just her feature debut (she‚Äôs previously directed episodes of Billions and Ballers), she aims to create more narratives like these in the future. ‚ÄúI want to continue to explore provocative shades of gray. I want to continue to tell stories that provoke, that ask tough questions, but I also want to continue to take audiences on a ride. I think there was nothing more gratifying than feeling like I had the audience on the edge of their seat for two hours.‚Äù She laughs, then continues, ‚ÄúI think there‚Äôs nothing more exciting than feeling like I have them by the throat.‚Äù
Dumont doesn‚Äôt just mean during the movie, but after, too. She‚Äôs very eager to see what debates Fair Play ignites, and ‚Äúwhat relationships we can break up.‚Äù She calls it ‚Äúthe date movie from hell,‚Äù as a joke‚Äîbut also not. ‚ÄúProbably not the first date, but if you‚Äôre starting to date someone, go see this movie, then have a conversation after....That can reveal a lot about a person.‚Äù
Erica Gonzales is the Senior Culture Editor at ELLE.com, where she oversees coverage on TV, movies, music, books, and more. She was previously an editor at HarpersBAZAAR.com. There is a 75 percent chance she's listening to Lorde right now.¬†

title: Gigi Hadid and Bradley Cooper Were Photographed Getting Dinner Together
text:
Gigi Hadid‚Äôs one-year ‚Äúsituationship‚Äù with Leonardo DiCaprio has come to an end, but the model may have another relationship with an A-lister brewing. The Daily Mail ran photos of Hadid, 28, leaving dinner with Bradley Cooper, 48, at New York City‚Äôs Via Carota yesterday, which you can see here.
The two stars left in the same car after their meal. Hadid wore a low-rise miniskirt with a white crop top and leather jacket. Cooper, meanwhile, was seen in an open flannel shirt, blue T-shirt, and jeans. It is unclear whether they were on a date or just having a friendly dinner. Both are single at the moment.
Hadid was also romantically linked to 27-year-old music producer Cole Bennett last month. 
Us Weekly confirmed that Hadid and DiCaprio‚Äôs romantic relationship had ended in mid-September. While DiCaprio ‚Äúreally saw himself dating‚Äù Hadid, the feeling wasn‚Äôt mutual.
A source explained that lifestyle differences were a factor in their split, and that it was more Hadid‚Äôs choice to end their fling than DiCaprio‚Äôs. 
The two stars ‚Äúboth travel a lot by nature of their jobs,‚Äù the source said. ‚ÄúBut Gigi is taking more work that allows her to spend more time with her child [3-year-old Khai]. And Leo still travels a lot and likes to go out a lot. And there‚Äôs temptation and all those factors had been concerns of hers.‚Äù 
‚ÄúShe doesn‚Äôt want her boyfriend to be in and out going to clubs and events and working all the time,‚Äù the source continued. ‚ÄúShe wants someone to be hands-on and a partner. [She] doesn‚Äôt want to date someone seriously unless she can introduce them to her child.‚Äù She and DiCaprio remain friends, the source said.
As for Cooper, he last made headlines for his relationship with Irina Shayk, his ex and mother of his daughter Lea de Seine. For a moment there was a rumored possibility of them rekindling their romance. 
But a Page Six source dismissed the theory Cooper was bothered by Shayk dating Tom Brady in mid-September. ‚Äú[Shayk and Cooper] haven‚Äôt been together in so long,‚Äù the source said. ‚ÄúThey are co-parents and that‚Äôs that. They are best friends. They are happy. Brad really likes Tom, and there is nothing but support.‚Äù
Alyssa Bailey is the senior news and strategy editor at ELLE.com, where she oversees coverage of celebrities and royals (particularly Meghan Markle and Kate Middleton). She previously held positions at InStyle and Cosmopolitan. When she's not working, she loves running around Central Park, making people take #ootd pics of her, and exploring New York City.

title: The 8 Best Nail Trends From the Spring 2024 Runways
text:
Open this before your next nail appointment.  
Feeling down? Need to juuz up your look a bit? Desiring a little self-care? You can never go wrong with a relaxing manicure. Personally, my eyes are always on the lookout for the latest nail trends as to prevent future me from wasting 20 minutes in the nail salon, perusing through Instagram for my next design (sorry to my nail artist). Whether you want some nail art inspiration or to simply know the latest nail color trends, the fashion week runways are like the crystal ball of trends.  And this season was no exception! On the  Spring/Summer ‚Äô24 runway, nail art focused on the feminine, drawing inspiration from the viral balletcore trend seen all over the runways. Classic styles, like the french manicure, got a modern update with chrome detailing and silver chrome nails, which are currently trending for Fall/Winter ‚Äô23 (you can thank Beyonc√© and the Renaissance Tour), will continue to trend into the new year. Logomania was heavily trending in the pandemic era and now has popped up on nails and in a world full of stiletto and coffin lengths, this season, short nails reigned supreme. 
I caught up with Natalie Minerva, celebrity nail artist and OPI Global Ambassador, to talk all the Spring/Summer ‚Äô24 trends we loved on the fashion week runways. You don‚Äôt have to wait for the new year to discover the new trends (or even ask your Magic 8 ball). Keep reading to discover all the new trends, first! 
Helmut Lang played scrabble with nail art for Peter Do‚Äôs runway debut as the new Creative Director. A simple clear manicure spelled out H-E-L-M-U-T L-A-N-G in black font, a refreshing take from the logomania of past seasons. We have all the details, here.
If Scrabble isn‚Äôt quite your thing, go for the logo to spell out the love for your favorite brand. Celebrity nail artist Julie Kandalec hand painted the Kate Spade dot noel monogram on nails and gave the logomania trend an update by finishing it off with a black, skinny french design. 
Skinny jeans may be out, but skinny french manicures are in. A thin line turns this barely there manicure into Parisian chic.  
Remember when colorful french manicures were the summer must-have nails? It applies to the skinny french trend, too! This red, skinny french manicure goes perfectly with a classic red lip. 
Chrome nails are currently trending (thanks, Beyonc√©) and do not seem to be going anywhere anytime soon. ‚ÄúThis trend will definitely dip into Spring/Summer‚Äîit‚Äôs applicable yar-round in my opinion,‚Äù says Minerva. 
‚Äú3D lined chrome French nails, like the ones we saw at Parabal Gurung, will be a big trend for Spring/Summer ‚Äô24,‚Äù shares Minerva. ‚ÄúWe love a futuristic French,‚Äù she exclaims.
Balletcore beauty gets an update at Mirror Palais with this pink, pearly chrome version. ‚ÄúPink pearl is always a refreshing look that combines a nostalgic touch on a new modern classic,‚Äù says Minerva.
If pink is not your thing, you can still get into the balletcore trend by leaning into a pearly white or vanilla chrome look. 
No manicure, no cry. At Michael Kors, Jin Soon Choi focused more on nail health, and gave models barely there manicures with light pink polish. 
Proenza Schouler had models walk down the runway with short, clean, manicured nails. Mani minimalism at its finest!  
Negative space will have a positive impact on manicure trends for Spring/Summer ‚Äô24 and is a fun way to have a minimalist manicure, but still play up design. ‚ÄúSimple lines and dots in black kept this manicure so simple and yet so impactful,‚Äù says Minerva.
‚ÄúFor Spring Summer ‚Äô24, expect to see lots of shimmers that evoke a dreamy feeling like frosted chromes, baby pink shimmers, and sheer milky lavenders,‚Äù says Minerva. 
Saweetie once sang, ‚ÄúTen white toes, I'm always tip top;‚Äù however, at Alice + Olivia, that monochromatic minimalist energy was invested in the nails. 
White nails were spotted on models at Libertine and is the perfect option for your clean girl aesthetic.  
I will keep it short and sweet‚Äîgo short and red for Spring 2024. Red nails are a classic and often showcased on long nails, but Proenza Schouler reminds us how great the color looks on short, manicured nails.
Classic red nails always look sexy, no matter the nail length, as proven backstage at Brandon Maxwell. 
Danielle James is the Digital Beauty Director of ELLE.com. Previously, she was the Fashion and Beauty Director of HelloBeautiful.com and MadameNoire.com. She‚Äôs written for The Cut, InStyle, Allure, The Business of Fashion, Nylon, Essence, Good Housekeeping, and more. She enjoys sailing, thrifting, Japanese whiskey, Naomi Campbell‚Äôs runway walk, and Rihanna in the comment section.

text:

Each skin care collection houses a bevy of serums that take on a heavy responsibility. Serums packed with salicylic or glycolic acid are asked to address pesty breakouts; vitamin C helps to brighten the dark spots left behind from said breakouts, and niacinamide and peptides smooth skin, among many other benefits. However, if there‚Äôs face serum your beauty arsenal should keep in stock, it‚Äôs hyaluronic acid.
No need to second guess what the purpose of a hyaluronic acid serum is‚Äîa close look at the name will tell you all you need to know about the popular ingredient: retaining moisture is its primary goal. ‚ÄúSerums are low viscosity, thinner liquids that are typically formulated to be used under a moisturizer. Hyaluronic acid is a humectant,‚Äù Dr. Camille Howard, NY-based dermatologist and founder of Girl+Hair, tells ELLE.com. 
Like a tall glass of water on a hot day, hyaluronic acid allows your skin to soak up all that hydration so you can look fresh and plump throughout the day. Choosing the right serum for your skin type doesn‚Äôt need to be complicated. We consulted Dr. Camille Howard, and several customer reviews to find the 15 best simple-yet-effective hyaluronic acid serums to incorporate into your routine.
Neostrata‚Äôs iteration of a hyaluronic acid serum exfoliates and soothes. Plus, it's formula works well with my Solawave‚ÄîA+ in my book!‚Äù‚ÄîNerisha Penrose, ELLE.com beauty commerce editor

A dime-sized drop of this covered my entire face and was immediately absorbed. Works beautifully and easily in my facial regimen.‚Äù

While it‚Äôs not the typical packaging for a serum, the Isdin hyaluronic acid ampoules give your skin just the right amount of magic with each tube. The booster comprises two different forms of hyaluronic banding together for one goal: maximum hydration.

An Isdin reviewer said: ‚ÄúI love how my skin feels tighter. Easy to use. I get two days of liquid before using [the] next ampoule.‚Äù
Every skincare newbie needs a place to start. Enter: Cerave‚Äôs affordable line of simple skincare, including this gentle serum that glides on like butter and soothes dehydrated skin. This fragrance and oil-free formula protects the skin barrier, making it an excellent serum for eczema-prone skin.

Think of hyaluronic acid as a serum that helps your skin preserve moisture‚Äîthe good kind. ‚Äú[Hyaluronic acid] attracts and binds water; it is ideal to combine a hyaluronic acid serum and a moisturizer,‚Äù Dr. Howard says.
‚ÄúIt is important to think of the order you apply your products,‚Äù she adds. When using skincare products, apply each formula from lightest to thickest consistency. ‚ÄúFirst, you would cleanse your face. Next, apply your hyaluronic acid serum and then follow with a moisturizer,‚Äù Dr. Howard explains.

title: The Best Reality TV Shows to Help You Escape Your Mundane Existence
text:
Whether you're a Golden Bachelor or Below Deck fan, we've got you covered.
Reality shows have taken over the television landscape. From Bravo hits like The Real Housewives of New York City and Below Deck to the latest entry in The Bachelor franchise, there are a plethora of shows to choose from right now. With classic reality titles like The Hills getting a second life on TikTok, it‚Äôs the perfect time to revisit all of your favorite episodes. And with Netflix‚Äôs reality TV output only growing following the success of Selling Sunset and Love Is Blind, it can be difficult to pick just one series to watch.
Whether you‚Äôre looking to revisit a classic like Big Brother or ready to dive into the Real Housewives universe, here are 65 of the best reality TV shows to add to your watch list in 2023.
After what feels like the longest wait, The Golden Bachelor has finally arrived to shake up the Bachelor franchise. Season 1 stars Gerry Turner, a 72-year-old widower searching for love and dishing out roses week by week, until he finds romance with one of many hopefuls. 
WATCH NOW
In this delightful Real Housewives spin-off, Sonja Morgan and Luann de Lesseps trade in the glamour of New York City for the small town charm of Benton, Illinois. More than a little inspired by The Simple Life, Sonja and Luann are forced to get their hands dirty as they help out the town's locals with a series of projects.
WATCH NOW
New York drag king and Somebody Somewhere star Murray Hill hosts Drag Me to Dinner, a competition series bringing together drag artists from all over the United States. Contestants compete in a number of categories for a chance to be named The Glorious Golden Grater. Judges include Neil Patrick Harris and Bianca Del Rio.
WATCH NOW
Airing its 25th season in 2023, Big Brother needs no introduction. The contestants, known as HouseGuests, compete for a prize of $750,000, while having their lives filmed 24 hours a day. One by one, HouseGuests are voted out, until a lucky winner remains. 
WATCH NOW
Netflix's Last Chance U follows college football players as they strive for success, in the hopes of becoming professional athletes. The show explores the lives of players who have faced difficulties in their lives, for whom football provides an outlet, with the first two seasons focusing on East Mississippi Community College.
WATCH NOW
This Summer House spin-off takes place during colder climes and enlists the help of cast members from a plethora of Bravo shows, including Below Deck, Southern Charm, and Vanderpump Rules. As they enjoy the winter weather, the group gets into all kinds of trouble, as you'd likely expect.
WATCH NOW
Netflix's Korean reality series follows a group of influencers who think they're filming a dating show, only to be attacked by hoards of zombies. Contestants must fight to survive the unexpected outbreak, while completing a series of quests. Both horrifying and entertaining.
WATCH NOW
Temptation Island is the ultimate relationship test. Several couples sign up to live in an idyllic location with some seriously hot singletons, to prove whether or not their relationships are strong enough to survive temptation.
WATCH NOW
Based upon the film of the same name, Buddy Games focuses on several groups of friends as they take part in a series of summer camp-inspired challenges. Josh Duhamel, who directed and starred in the movie, plays host, while the groups fight it out for a cash prize and a killer trophy.
WATCH NOW
E!'s House of Villains brings together the reality TV contestants we all love to hate, as they battle it out for a cash prize and the title of America's Ultimate Supervillain. Season 1 stars Vanderpump Rules alum Jax Taylor, Love Is Blind's Shake Chatterjee, and Flavor of Love's Tiffany Pollard, amongst others.
WATCH NOW
Bravo's Real Housewives of New York reboot has been a big hit with fans, revitalizing the franchise with a fresh new cast and some serious drama. Whether you're a fan of Jenna Lyons' wardrobe, Jessel's one liners, or Ubah's positive attitude (as long as you don't steal her phone), this show has something for everyone.
WATCH NOW
In this Korean survival series, athletic contestants compete via a number of strength and endurance tests. Showcasing their physical abilities (and abs), contestants fight for the chance to be crowned the fittest of them all and to win approximately $250,000. It'll make you want to hit the gym, pronto.
WATCH NOW
Netflix's glossy travel show takes us around the world, showcasing a plethora of unusual, over-the-top, and hidden away properties. Hosted by content creators Megan Batoon, Luis D. Ortiz, and Jo Franco, The World's Most Amazing Vacation Rentals will make you want to book your next trip right away.
WATCH NOW
Twelve contestants compete for a prize fund in Netflix's reality hit, but there's a mole in their midst trying to sabotage the group every step of the way. If the mole is successful, they'll lose the group money by ruining various challenges, and by keeping their identity a secret. But how long can they stay hidden for?
WATCH NOW
Netflix's Hack My Home addresses a very real world problem: what do you do if you've outgrown your living space, but aren't able to move? Through some incredibly innovative DIY techniques and home renovation inspiration, Hack My Home makes even the smallest of rooms more functional again, which is fun to see.
WATCH NOW
Lauren Conrad and Heidi Montag's feud defined a generation (‚ÄúI wanna forgive you and I wanna forget you‚Äù), and over a decade later, the late '00s series still holds up. From the birth of Speidi to Justin Bobby wearing combat boots to the beach to Brody Jenner's faux relationship drama with just about everyone, The Hills remains a reality TV staple. Sure, The Hills: New Beginnings already got canceled, but that's even more reason to return to where it all started. 
WATCH NOW
Netflix's Selling Sunset was an instant smash hit, and it's easy to see why. The glossy real estate show is as much about decadent properties as it is girl gang drama and flawless hair and makeup. Christine Quinn's beef with Chrishell Stause kickstarted the series, which is already in its fifth season. We hope it never ends. 
WATCH NOW
It's hard to believe that people haven't gotten wise to online scammers after watching an impressive eight seasons of MTV's Catfish, but here we are. Nƒìv Schulman and Kamie Crawford make every episode entertaining, whether they're exposing con artists abroad or uncovering decade-long liars. And you can always go back to where it all began with the 2010 documentary Catfish, that tells Nƒìv's own internet romance disaster. 
WATCH NOW
After 20 seasons on E!, the Kardashian-Jenner clan decided it was time for a change (and reportedly, a more lucrative deal). Cue Hulu's The Kardashians, a ludicrously glossy way for us all to watch Kravis make out, Kimye get divorced, and Khlo√© move the hell on from Tristan once and for all. We can't wait! 
WATCH NOW 
The looks! The fashion! The shade! With 14 seasons and several spinoffs in the books (so far), Drag Race remains one of the most thrilling reality shows on television, as queens from all walks of life compete for the title of ‚Äúnext drag superstar‚Äù under the guidance of Mama Ru. Each week brings a new high-fashion runway looks, side-stitching skits, and life-saving lipsyncs. It's not just a competition show, it's a celebration of individuality. Now, sashay away and start your next binge. 
WATCH NOW

title: The Best Documentaries and Docuseries to Watch on Netflix
text:
Netflix has a fantastic collection of documentaries or docuseries, from gripping true-crime tales to eye-opening environmental expos√©s to intimate looks into the lives of your favorite musical artists. Even dedicated documentary aficionados can find new films on the streaming service, but dabblers in search of something fresh to watch will be satisfied by the list below. 
If you‚Äôre in the mood for something breezy, fun, yet educating, try a food and travel series like David Chang‚Äôs Ugly Delicious, where the Momofuku chef embarks on culinary adventures with his celebrity friends. For super fans of pop culture, Netflix has docs on stars like Taylor Swift, Jennifer Lopez, Pamela Anderson, and Beyonc√©, in particular the latter‚Äôs opus, Homecoming. And if you‚Äôre a true crime fanatic, the streamer covers everything from murder to cults, all with a healthy dose of mayhem for added entertainment.
Scroll through below to to discover 35 remarkable documentaries currently available for your viewing pleasure on Netflix. 
This doc tells a fairly recent story, covering the highly unusual events surrounding the GameStop stock rise of early 2021. Amateur investors organized primarily on the Reddit forum WallStreetBets faced off against Wall Street's hedge funds. Disgusted with market manipulation by some of the richest people in the world, they supported the struggling video game retailer and caused its stock price to climb astronomically. The hedge funds lost money and the response from financial institutions exposed the hypocrisy in the system. If you gleaned some details from social media at the time, this film will fill in the blanks and then some.
Watch Here
The FLDS (Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints) is a secretive and highly insular world, and Keep Sweet: Pray and Obey gives a rare, deep look into the church for outsiders. The polygamous sect broke away from the mainstream Mormon Church long ago and were under the rule of charismatic leader, Warren Jeffs. Interviews with people who escaped FLDS include their personal experiences of arranged marriages and systemic abuse within the community. The picture of religious extremism is dark, but the survivors ability to transform and thrive is inspirational.
Watch Now
In the 1980s, the Rajneeshpuram commune, a controversial spiritual community, consumed a swathe of rural Oregon. The series traces the path that the guru Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh took through the area with the help of his most devoted and controlling follower, Ma Anand Sheela. The events that unfolded are very well-remembered in that part of the state, so the docuseries is full of fascinating interviews and first-hand footage of the increasingly sinister antics of the group. You'll be quickly absorbed in the inner workings of the commune and figuring out who the real villains and heroes of the story were.
Watch Now
Directed by the acclaimed filmmaker Martin Scorsese, the docuseries Pretend It's a City follows author and humorist, Fran Lebowitz, as she walks the streets of her favorite place on earth. Scorsese and Lebowitz are friends, and he clearly delights in her observations about NYC, how it has changed over the years, and in the stories of her own life‚Äîwhich is a fascinating one! The show is a comforting, nostalgic glimpse into a landscape that is both familiar and constantly changing, with a host who has seen it all.
Watch Now
Craig Foster is both a filmmaker and free diver, who forms a bond with a wild octopus during his trips underwater to the kelp forests of South Africa. The documentary shares their intimate interactions over an entire year and Foster honors his new friend's intelligence, resilience, and beauty in the clips he catches of her life. His octopus teacher profoundly increases his appreciation for the ocean and the film illustrates our connection to it, and all marine life, as fellow living creatures. 
Watch Now
Disclosure explores the portrayal of transgender people in film and television through interviews with activists, performers, and scholars. In addition to being a fascinating historical analysis of cinema at large, it shows how cisgender actors are commonly promoted to play trans characters, often relying on caricatures and stigmatizing portrayals. The doc makes a clear case for why real representation matters on every level, from social to economic to political.
Watch Now
Pamela Anderson's life story has been a subject of much scrutiny and often used without her permission for sensational stories and other people's profit. This doc made with Netflix is from her perspective, exploring her career from Playboy model to today, her relationship with Tommy Lee, the infamous sex tape, and her reaction to Hulu's Pam and Tommy. It includes intimate interviews and appearances from her kids, and most importantly, Anderson's permission.
Watch Now
Charles Cullen worked for 16 years as a nurse in New Jersey and Pennsylvania, and killed as many as 40 people in nine different hospitals. Cullen was under suspicion for a long time, but he was continuously shuttled to new jobs as institutions sought to protect themselves from liability. He was finally taken in with the help of another nurse, Amy Loughren, who got a confession out of her former friend. This doc was additionally fictionalized on Netflix in The Good Nurse, starring Jessica Chastain and Eddie Redmayne.
Watch Now
Girl in the Picture is a true-crime documentary that covers the story of Tonya Hughes, also called Sharon Marshall. Tonya was kidnapped by Franklin Delano Floyd, who raised her as his daughter‚Äîbefore marrying her. Tonya was allegedly killed by a hit-and-run driver in Oklahoma City in 1990, leaving behind a son named Michael. Michael was taken out of Floyd's charge, and it was discovered he was not the boy's biological father. This started an unraveling of Floyd's many crimes, and the fact he had been on the run as a fugitive from Georgia since 1973. 
Watch Now
This doc offers a behind-the-scenes look at Jennifer Lopez's halftime performance at Super Bowl LIV in 2020 alongside Shakira. The film incorporates the personal and professional challenges J.Lo faced in the lead-up to the performance, including the intense scrutiny of the media and the pressure to deliver an incredibly memorable show. 
Watch Now
Dr. James Marion Sims was a prominent fertility doctor who exploited and abused his patients for decades, violating their trust by using his own sperm to impregnate them without their consent. The doc interviews the women he betrayed and their families, explaining how Sims was able to continue his unethical practices with impunity for so long. It connects Sims to the urgent need for greater accountability and oversight in the healthcare industry, and for teaching patients to advocate for themselves.
Watch Now
‚ÄúVegan Queen‚Äù Sarma Melngailis was famous for her recipes and vegan restaurant that attracted celebrities from all over. But then she met a man. This docuseries is about how Melngailis fell for the manipulations of Shane Fox, a guy who promised immortality for her and her dog. Soon her life was falling apart, and while there's plenty of testimony from observers of her wild ride, the woman are the center of it all gets interviewed as well. 
Watch Now
This documentary shares a message directly from the earliest spokespeople of conversion therapy: it doesn't work. Conversion therapy is an abusive tactic to suppress and abuse LGBTQ+ people, and it hasn't waned in popularity since its advent in the 1970s. This film covers the beginnings of the movement with interviews from queer people who now admit they never changed, and why it's so important to come forward decades later.
Watch Now
The infamous Simon Leviev was a pro at making women trust him after matching on the dating app Tinder. He claimed to be the heir to a diamond mogul and was seemingly able to back up these claims with outrageous displays of wealth. Then, all of the sudden, he'd need a little loan. While you might scream in frustration watching woman after woman get taken in by Leviev, the doc does explain how anyone could get taken in by a conscienceless scammer under the right circumstances.
Watch Now
John Wayne Gacy is a very well-known serial killer, partly because he was so prolific (he killed over men in about a four year timespan) and because he dressed up as a clown. But if you want to delve deeper than these two very striking facts, this doc goes very deep into Gacy's history and includes new audio of the murderer talking with his defense team about his reasons for killing, and how he got away with it for so long.
Watch Now
The models for Abercrombie & Fitch might be nice to look at, but this documentary delves into the unsexy side of the century-old company. If you grew up in the nineties, looking at the history of the store's rise and fall will bring back a lot of memories. And if you didn't, this will give you a deeper understanding of fashion, trends, and how ugly things can get in the retail market.
Watch Now
Most people associate Bob Ross with ‚Äúhappy little trees,‚Äù but the behind-the-scenes story paints a very different picture. This doc won't ruin your image of Mr. Ross, thank goodness, but it will shine a light on the destructive effect money can have on people after the person they loved is gone.
Watch Now 
Are you a royal family follower solely for the conspiracy theories associated with the Windsors? Have you watched every documentary ever about Scientology? This 2015 docuseries has you covered.
Watch Now
Samin Nosrat teaches foodies about the four essential elements of cooking good food. You'll become an expert on the title subjects‚Äîand want to cook and eat everything.
Watch Now
Filmmaker Coodie has been following Kanye West since the advent of his career, long before his recent controversies, so the doc contains the sort of intimate footage most music biographers can only dream about. The three-part series contains so many details about one man's path to world-wide fame and fortune, and all the ups-and-downs such a journey entails. 
Watch Now

title: Ariana Grande and Dalton Gomez Have Finalized Their Divorce Just Weeks After Filing
text:
Ariana Grande and Dalton Gomez filed for divorce last month, and just a few weeks later their marriage has reportedly ended. The former couple had a prenup, according to TMZ, and there will be no spousal support. 
A source told Page Six, ‚ÄúAriana and Dalton really wanted to take care of each through all of this and make it as easy on one another as possible‚Äîwhich is why they really took their time with everything.‚Äù

Grande is also obligated to pay up to $25,000 of her ex-husband's attorney fees. He is also entitled to continued 24-hour security. The settlement has been filed and simply awaits a judge's signature.
Another source told TMZ, ‚ÄúThere is still a strong mutual love and respect between Ariana and Dalton and they wanted to make sure everything was done right in lockstep with one another.‚Äù
Both Grande and Gomez have moved on, the latter is said to be dating, and it's well-known that Grande is in a relationship with her Wicked co-star, Ethan Slater. 
On their documents, Grande and Gomez dated their separation as being February 20, 2023. However, their marital issues allegedly began long before.
‚ÄúThey came to the decision together,‚Äù another source said in July. ‚ÄúThey were having problems before January, but they want to remain best friends.‚Äù

‚ÄúThey‚Äôve been really good friends throughout the entire process, and their friends and families have been trying to protect them,‚Äù the source added.

title: Travis Kelce Says He Feels ‚ÄòOn Top of the World‚Äô as Taylor Swift Romance Progresses
text:
On Friday, Travis Kelce was grilled about his budding relationship with pop star Taylor Swift, and he had nothing but good news to share. The Kansas City Chiefs player came out for an interview at the team's practice facility, sharing how it feels to be at the center of so much speculation.
‚ÄúAs all the attention comes it feels like, you know, I was on top of the world after the Super Bowl and right now even more on top of the world,‚Äù he told reporters. ‚ÄúIt's fun.‚Äù
Swift has attended two games to see her rumored love interest, one at Arrowhead Stadium and another last weekend at MetLife Stadium, where the Chiefs faced off against the New York Jets. At the October 1 game, she brought friends Blake Lively, Ryan Reynolds, Sabrina Carpenter, Sophie Turner, and Hugh Jackman, adding to the spectacle. These appearances have sparked even more intense interest in the potential couple.
‚ÄúWe're learning with the paparazzi just taking photos from all over the place, but at the same time it comes with it,‚Äù Kelce continued. ‚ÄúYou got a lot of people that care about Taylor and for good reason.‚Äù

title: Julia Fox States Kanye West ‚ÄòWeaponized‚Äô Her Against the Kardashians When They Dated
text:
With the imminent release of her memoir, Down the Drain, Julia Fox has been sharing more details of her personal life that have caused a lot of conjecture before, particularly about her relationship with Kanye West. In an interview on Friday with The Los Angeles Times, Fox shared that when she and the rapper were linked in 2022, she felt he ‚Äúweaponized‚Äù her against his former wife, Kim Kardashian. 
‚ÄúI thought ultimately I‚Äôd be helping a precarious situation, but I learned very quickly that I was being weaponized,‚Äù she claimed.
She added that she ‚Äúreally understood‚Äù West ‚Äúon a visceral level‚Äù and thought their connection ‚Äúcould be something real,‚Äù but he did not treat her as she expected to be treated.
Fox stated, ‚ÄúI just felt like his little puppet.‚Äù
The memoir will share some more details on the time she spent with West, though she says she ‚Äúwent lightly‚Äù on him. However, she never signed a non-disclosure agreement.
‚ÄúI‚Äôm not signing a f-cking NDA just on principle,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúI never have, and I never will... Unless it‚Äôs a professional opportunity, then sure.‚Äù
West and Fox only dated briefly, but she still said she believes that the relationship interfered with certain opportunities. The rapper was himself dropped from a number of brand deals following his very public anti-Semitic comments.
‚ÄúI know for a fact I‚Äôve been up for certain things and couldn‚Äôt do it because of dating Kanye. It‚Äôs kind of wild,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúIt really wasn‚Äôt that big of a deal, but other people made it such a big deal.‚Äù
After they broke it off, Fox said she stopped dating for a while. She focused on her two-year-old son Valentino, who she shares with ex-husband Peter Artemiev.
‚ÄúThat romanticized idea of men doesn‚Äôt exist anymore,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúAll the validation I could ever get, I get from my son‚Äîthe love, the intimacy, the closeness. We co-sleep at night. I have all of that. I wouldn‚Äôt want anyone to come in and take my attention or time away from my son.‚Äù

title: Rihanna Wears Tie-Front Top With Denim Ensemble on Date With A$AP Rocky
text:
On Friday, Rihanna stepped out with boyfriend A$AP Rocky in New York City. The couple were spotted leaving a hotel together in their early fall looks. The Fenty Beauty founder was wearing a tie-front top that offered a glimpse of her torso and a peek at her lacy black bra where the shirt's low neckline was unbuttoned. Over it, she wore a denim jacket with the shirt's cuffs hanging out and wide-legged jeans in the same wash. 
On her feet were a pair of black heels, and she accessorized with earrings, some chains around her neck, and black sunglasses. Rihanna's hair hung in slight waves around her, and she flashed a red manicure.
The rapper also wore a matching jacket and slacks, both in a loose summer cut in a beige shade. Under the jacket he wore a white tee, and over one shoulder A$AP carried a woven green leather purse. He also had on sunglasses, a chain necklace and wore black boots. 
The parents welcomed their first son, RZA Athelston Mayers, in May of 2022. Their second child came just a few months ago, another son who they reportedly named Riot. 
After her first child was born, Rihanna told British Vogue that the experience ‚Äúwas beautiful‚Äù and that she felt ‚Äúblessed,‚Äù but it was still a huge transition. 
‚ÄúEssentially, from one person I became two,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúYou walk into the hospital as a couple and leave as a family of three. It‚Äôs nuts.‚Äù
She added that ‚Äúyou don't sleep. At all. Not even if you wanted to.‚Äù
‚ÄúWe came home, cold turkey, had no one,‚Äù the ANTI singer went on. ‚ÄúIt was just us as parents and our baby. Man, you're a zombie for the most part.‚Äù
When asked about her notably excellent maternity style, Rihanna said it was much harder to figure out how to dress postpartum.
‚ÄúDressing for pregnancy was such a piece of cake,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúBut dressing in postpartum, what the f-ck do you do? The week that I came home from the hospital‚Äîthat was nothing but sweats and hoodies.‚Äù
She continued, ‚ÄúYou kind of just gotta wait it out otherwise you end up buying so many clothes you‚Äôre not going to use. Well, unless you get pregnant again.‚Äù

title: Sofia Vergara Is 'Doing Great' After Split From Joe Manganiello
text:
On Friday, Sofia Vergara's good friend Julie Bowen spoke with People while attending the Step Up Inspiration Awards and was asked about her Modern Family co-star of 11 years. Bowen said that she will ‚Äúalways‚Äù support her friend, and that she has been seeing Vergara thrive after her breakup with Joe Manganiello.
‚ÄúHer Instagram says it all,‚Äù Bowen claimed. ‚ÄúWe have spoken, and she's doing great. Sofia has always had such a wonderful family that surrounds her and wonderful friends,‚Äù before adding jokingly, ‚ÄúShe doesn't need Taylor Swift to take her to a game.‚Äù 
Bowen added, ‚ÄúShe's good. But I'm super happy that all those other girls are going to games with T Swifty. I wish she had been around for me.‚Äù
She shared more about their longstanding working relationship and the close friendship that developed over their many years together on the hugely popular ABC sitcom.
‚ÄúSofia has always been my role model as far as embracing being a woman and womanly, and yet also being powerful and not,‚Äù said Bowen. ‚ÄúI always felt like you had to compromise one for the other.‚Äù 
The actress has been asked about her friend quite a bit. In August, she told E! News that Vergara does everything ‚Äúwith grace.‚Äù
‚ÄúAnd she rises above and she just goes forward. She's warm and generous and giving to everybody around her,‚Äù Bowen continued. ‚ÄúI have no doubt that if she wishes to be in a relationship she will be, but she sure don't need one.‚Äù
Vergara and Manganiello were married for seven years, and split shortly before her 51st birthday, which she celebrated with friends in Italy and without her husband or wedding ring. Manganiello was the one who officially filed for divorce, citing ‚Äúirreconcilable differences.‚Äù
In a statement to Page Six, the former couple said, ‚ÄúWe have made the difficult decision to divorce. As two people that love and care for one another very much, we politely ask for respect for our privacy at this time as we navigate this new phase of our lives.‚Äù

title: Simone Biles Becomes the Most Decorated Gymnast Ever With Another Gold Medal
text:
On Friday, Olympic great Simone Biles broke yet another record with her win at the World Artistic Gymnastics Championships in Belgium. The 26-year-old athlete was awarded her sixth all-around world championship gold, making her the most decorated gymnast ever. She was previously tied with Belarus gymnast Vitaly Scherbo, who competed in the 1990s and took home 33 medals. Biles is now at 34. 
It was an emotional moment for Biles as she stood on the podium during the U.S. national anthem, alongside silver winner Rebeca Andrade and bronze winner Shilese Jones. Cameras caught her getting a bit misty-eyed while soaking in the accolades.
‚ÄúI was emotional because it was my first worlds here, 10 years ago, and then now my sixth one, so it's crazy,‚Äù Biles told reporters after the competition. ‚ÄúBut I swear, I do have something in my eye that's been bothering me for like four hours and I cannot get it out‚Ä¶ So while I was looking up there, it was like a combination of both.‚Äù
We're not crying, you're crying. ü•πThe national anthem plays for 6-time world all-around champion Simone Biles. üá∫üá∏ü•á pic.twitter.com/pp0PQ65KSV
The champion's success is particularly poignant this year. She only returned to competing this summer after stepping back following the 2020 Olympic Games, which were held in Tokyo in 2021. At the time, Biles was experiencing something gymnasts call the ‚Äútwisties,‚Äù a very dangerous change in perception that makes it extremely difficult to land safely when doing their gravity-defying moves in the air. That year, she withdrew from some events effected by the condition, but won bronze at the balance beam final.
During the world championships, Biles has earned two golds so far, including one during the U.S. team final on Wednesday, and she is still set to compete in the women's vault, uneven bars, balance beam, and floor routine. She will likely make her return to the Olympics in Paris which are set for 2024.

title: Lindsay Lohan, Amanda Seyfried, and Lacey Chabert Reportedly Filmed a ‚ÄòMean Girls‚Äô Commercial Together
text:
On Friday, a mini-reunion for the classic teen comedy Mean Girls assembled in Los Angeles. The film's stars, Lindsay Lohan, Amanda Seyfried, and Lacey Chabert, were spotted shooting a commercial on a football field dressed in pink, a nod to their characters from the movie. Lohan played Cady Heron in the 2004 film, a naive girl moving to a U.S. high school after growing up in Africa and finding it difficult to navigate a new social hierarchy.
Seyfried and Chabert were a part of ‚ÄúThe Plastics,‚Äù the most popular clique in school who accept Cady into the fold, only to find their status quickly disintegrating. Their leader was played by Rachel McAdams as the notorious Regina George, but McAdams did not appear to be on set. 
Chabert was photographed in a silver convertible very similar to the one she drove in the original movie, and in another picture Seyfried is talking into a microphone. In Mean Girls, she does the school weather reports. In another photo, Lohan was carrying a bag that reads, ‚ÄúPlastics Club Member,‚Äù and the tagline, ‚ÄúOn Wednesdays, we wear pink.‚Äù
Next year is the 20th anniversary of the movie and it was recently October 3, a date that has a joking significance in the script and which the cast has often marked on social media since its release. Next year is also when Mean Girls Musical Movie is set to hit theaters, an adaptation of the musical of the movie. The new movie and the original were penned by Tina Fey, and she'll be reprising her role as Ms. Norbury in the adaptation. 
The gals have been asked about the likelihood they'd make a cameo in the new Mean Girls and in February, Seyfried told Entertainment Tonight that she was ‚Äú100 percent into‚Äù making an appearance.
‚ÄúIt's been a long legacy for Mean Girls, and I think we all kinda just need to hang,‚Äù she said.

title: Kendall Jenner Joins Bad Bunny in Miami After His Billboard Latin Awards Wins
text:

The couple headed to the SuperBlue art installation together, then went out for dinner at Hometown BBQ. In the images, both are dressed casually, with Jenner in a gray tank and white jeans cinched with a thin black leather belt. 
She left her hair down and wore a pair of narrow black sunglasses. In some photos, her white hair clip is lifting the hem of her shirt, showing a glimpse of torso. On her feet were a pair of white Adidas sneakers.
Bad Bunny wore a white t-shirt, brown pants, and a red and blue bandana around his neck. He had on a backwards brown baseball cap. 
On Thursday, at the BillBoard Latin Music Awards, Bad Bunny received the prestigious Artist of the Year and Tour of the Year awards, as well as Global 200 Latin Song of the Year, Sales Song of the Year for ‚ÄúTit√≠ Me Pregunt√≥,‚Äù Top Latin Albums Artist of the Year, Male, Latin Rhythm Artist of the Year, Solo, and Latin Rhythm Song of the Year.
The couple have been fairly private about their relationship, but they went ‚ÄúGucci ad official‚Äù in a new campaign last week. The Kardashian's star posed with her boyfriend in a number of fashion shots for the brand's luggage line, seeming to confirm that at the very least, they're traveling together a lot.
They also appeared at a Gucci show, sitting side-by-side during Milan Fashion Week.

text:
Rami Malek has found love again with Emma Corrin after his years-long relationship with Lucy Boynton came to a quiet end. The two actors made their romance very official when they were photographed kissing on September 21 in London.
The PDA display comes after the couple was seen together at the US Open, and a source told People in August that Malek started seeing Corrin, who uses they/them pronouns, earlier in the summer. He ‚Äúhas fun‚Äù with them, the insider said.
Here, a breakdown of their history together.
Malek, 42, and Corrin, 27, are seen together at a Bruce Springsteen concert in London‚Äôs Hyde Park. At this point, his breakup from Lucy Boynton hasn‚Äôt been confirmed. 
Malek and Corrin appeared talking close to each other in paparazzi photos from the mid-July concert. Page Six reported that, at one point, Malek rested his hand on Corrin‚Äôs knee.
On August 4, The Sun reported Malek and Boynton‚Äôs breakup. A source said that since the breakup, Malek has been spending time with friends, including Corrin. In fact, he asked them out to the Springsteen concert.
‚ÄúRami and Lucy split earlier this year without much fanfare,‚Äù the source said. ‚ÄúThey were together for a long time but had grown apart. They are both moving on with their lives and are busy with work. Rami has surrounded himself with his mates and has spent the summer enjoying himself. He asked Emma to join him to watch Bruce at BST last month, and they had a great time. Rami is enjoying life and living it up.‚Äù

Their walk happened earlier in August in North London. A witness told The Sun, ‚ÄúThey looked very much like a couple.‚Äù

‚ÄúRami and Emma were very low-key and when fans approached them for pictures, they politely declined,‚Äù the source said. ‚ÄúThey were very passionate and looking into each other‚Äôs eyes. They kissed and didn‚Äôt seem to mind who could see. Rami and Emma just seemed totally besotted with each other and paid no attention to anyone else.‚Äù
Malek and Corrin took their romance to New York City. The couple was seen sitting next to each other at the September 8 matches. They did not show PDA in the pics.

title: A Complete Timeline of Khlo√© Kardashian and Tristan Thompson's Relationship
text:

Relationship status-wise, Kardashian and Thompson are off for now but have been on-off romantically throughout their history.

September 2016

October 2016
In October, the couple coordinated their costumes for Halloween, going as Marvel's Storm and the Black Panther.

April 2017
