title: All About Dalton Gomez, Ariana Grande‚Äôs Ex-Husband and Partner of 3.5+ Years
text:
The former couple officially filed for divorce on September 18, 2o23.
On May 15, 2021, Ariana Grande secretly made one of the biggest moves of her life: She married her fianc√© and partner of over a year, Los Angeles real estate agent Dalton Gomez. The pair got engaged just ahead of the Christmas holiday, less than a year after the two were first seen together in February. On May 26, Grande shared the first photos from their wedding, taken by Stefan Kohli. The shots gave the public a rare and intimate look at the two together. 
Gomez and Grande had publicly been together for over a year and privately longer. But they always kept their relationship out of the limelight, from the very beginning. 
TMZ reported in late March 2020 that the man Ariana Grande was seen making out with around Valentine‚Äôs Day was actually Gomez, and he had been her new boyfriend for ‚Äúseveral months,‚Äù according to the outlet‚Äôs Grande sources. People and E! independently reported the same news hours later: that Grande is off the market but has been keeping her new relationship private.
Grande and Gomez quarantined together, and he appeared on her Instagram Story, TMZ pointed out.
The singer confirmed their relationship in her ‚ÄúStuck With U‚Äù music video on May 8, 2020. On May 26, 2020, Grande gave Gomez his first proper Instagram shoutout.
Gomez made his Instagram private right as news broke of their dating, but Grande did follow him. Amid news in July 2023 of their separation, Gomez's Instagram appears to have been disabled or deleted. Gomez and Grande ultimately filed for divorce in September 2023.
So who is Gomez? Here, all you need to know about him and his relationship with Grande, including info about their private wedding and what led the couple to privately separate in January 2023.
According to his bio on the site, Gomez was raised in southern California and has been working in the luxury real estate market for five years. He works with A-list buyers and has sold multi-million dollar homes.
TMZ points out he has other celebrity friends. He shared an Instagram Story of himself hanging out with Miley Cyrus in July 2017.
Dalton Gomez via Instagram Stories pic.twitter.com/wm5j3WUOKV
A little over a year after Grande and Gomez made their first public appearance together, the two have wed, TMZ and E! report. A rep for Grande confirmed the wedding on May 17, detailing that the two wed in a private ceremony in her Montecito home over the weekend.
As for why the venue was chosen, a source told People, ‚ÄúBoth Ari and Dalton love Montecito. They spend a lot of time there. It seems only natural that they would get married at Ari's beautiful and historic house.‚Äù
An insider describes the gathering to E! as ‚Äútiny and intimate. There was a lot of love and everyone is really happy.‚Äù TMZ was told by sources that there were less than 20 guests, and the nuptials were informal. There was no real ‚Äúceremony,‚Äù per the outlet, just a casual vow exchange. Neither Grande nor Gomez have posted about the news immediately after it broke.
E! was told that ‚Äúhundreds of white florals‚Äù were used as decor. ‚ÄúIt was beautiful but not over the top,‚Äù a source said. ‚ÄúAri wanted it to be simplistic and tasteful. All they cared about was having family there and to be able to enjoy the special moment together.‚Äù 
On May 26, Grande shared photos from their wedding, taken by Stefan Kohli, in three Instagram posts. She confirmed their wedding date was May 15. She wore a Vera Wang dress for her nuptials. 
Grande broke the news of their engagement on December 20, sharing rare photos of them together and showing off the diamond and pearl ring that Gomez gave her. ‚Äúforever n then some,‚Äù Grande wrote. The engagement comes 10 months after the couple were first seen in public together in February 2020.
People reported that Gomez gave Grande a platinum, diamond wedding band he helped design. Solow & Co designed the band, and a spokesperson for Solow & Co told People that ‚Äúthey worked with Dalton on this. It's a beautiful, tasteful platinum and diamond pave band. Dalton was very happy with it.‚Äù
Grande didn't keep the couple's honeymoon destination a complete secret. On July 11, she shared a gallery of honeymoon photos featuring her and Gomez in Amsterdam.
Grande and Gomez kissed in a photo she shared of them on her Instagram two days after Valentine's Day. Grande wore a lace black dress alongside her suited up husband.
Grande shared a series of photos of her and her friends, including her husband Gomez. ‚Äúhome is wherever these humans (and dogs) happen to be :),‚Äù she wrote. Gomez appears in the second slide:
On November 29, 2022, Grande shared a gallery of images including rare snaps of her husband. It was captionless, but within its first five hours up, had already garnered 3.4 million likes.
For Valentine's Day 2023, Grande gave another rare look at her and Gomez's relationship in a tribute to him.
Grande, who had kept a relatively low profile on social media while shooting Wicked, posted two Instagram Stories to celebrate her husband on Valentine's Day 2023. She reposted his tribute to her from his private Instagram (‚Äúmy forever Valentine,‚Äù he wrote) and added her own post of just him, tagging him.
Grande and Gomez have kept most details about their relationship out of the press. But after their May 2021 wedding, sources spoke to Entertainment Tonight and People about what the two's relationship is like.
‚ÄúAriana's brother Frankie and her mom are so happy for her. They think Dalton really balances Ariana out and allows her to be her true self,‚Äù Entertainment Tonight's source said. ‚ÄúAriana appreciates that Dalton accepts her and loves her for who she is. He's a little nerdy and hardworking and she loves that about him. He's also very protective over her and goes above and beyond to make her happy.‚Äù
Two sources spoke to People after the wedding.
A friend told the outlet that ‚Äúthey're a great fit together. Dalton's entirely unfazed by the scope of her celebrity and is very grounding for her. He's young but mature and knows what he wants out of life.‚Äù
A second source said that ‚Äúhe is very hardworking and focused. He is low-key and doesn't like attention. He isn't impressed by celebrities. He is perfect for her. Their life together is pretty special.‚Äù
Gomez appeared on Grande‚Äôs social media, hanging on her couch and petting her dog. TMZ‚Äôs sources told the outlet that the two were ‚Äúseeing each other for several months now.‚Äù
People‚Äôs source confirmed that Grande ‚Äúhas been with the same group of people for days‚Äù on March 25. ‚ÄúOne of the people she is with right now is Dalton‚Äîthey have been hanging out for a couple of months. Ariana doesn‚Äôt want to do another public relationship so she is trying to keep this one quiet, but she seems very happy with Dalton.‚Äù
Another source updated Entertainment Tonight on the couple‚Äôs quarantine at the end of May 2020. The insider said Grande is ‚Äúin a really good place‚Äù but is in no rush to share her private life with him on social media.  ‚ÄúAriana has had some hesitation being so public about her relationship with Dalton as she‚Äôs seen how that has worn on her past relationships [like with Pete Davidson and Mac Miller],‚Äù the source told ET, adding, ‚ÄúDalton and Ariana are in Los Angeles together during quarantine, and it has been a great opportunity for them to spend quality time together.‚Äù
While Grande hasn‚Äôt shared extensive details about her relationship on social media, she offered a little glimpse of it during her and Gomez‚Äôs birthdays. In late June, Grande went ‚Äôgram official with Gomez in honor of her 27th birthday. She posted a series of photos, one of which was a cuddled-up selfie of the couple. ‚Äúalmost 27 :)‚Äù she captioned the post.
After celebrating her 27th birthday with a Midsommar-themed birthday affair, Grande shared a few more snaps of herself and Gomez kissing. 
For Gomez‚Äôs 25th birthday in 2020, Grande gave the biggest glimpse into their relationship yet on Instagram. She shared several photos and videos of the pair, writing, ‚Äúhbd to my baby my best friend my fav part of all the days :) i love u.‚Äù He wasn‚Äôt tagged in the post, but she also hasn‚Äôt disabled the comments‚Äîa difference from her last post featuring Gomez. 
For Gomez‚Äôs 26th birthday in 2021, Grande posted a tribute with what looks like a photo from their Amsterdam honeymoon:
‚Äúhappy birthday to my baby my husband my best friend,‚Äù she wrote on her Instagram Story post. ‚Äúi love you infinitely.‚Äù
She also shared this black-and-white image from their wedding:
Grande confirmed her and Gomez‚Äôs relationship during the final minute of ‚ÄúStuck With U.‚Äù The two appear dancing and showing PDA together. This is Grande‚Äôs first public acknowledgement of their relationship.
Grande featured a clear shot and footage of Gomez on her Instagram Story on May 26. Gomez had helped her with her and Lady Gaga‚Äôs Chromatica Weather Girls short. She captioned a shot of him creating ‚Äúrain‚Äù for the video with emojis. It was one of the first unobscured shots she‚Äôs shared of him. Gomez was hooded in her ‚ÄúStuck With U‚Äù music video, which was the first glimpse she gave the public of their relationship.
In February, footage came out of Grande making out with Gomez at Bar Louie in Northridge, California. She arrived with him and her friends at 1 a.m. and stayed for about 30 minutes. Grande just had water there, TMZ reported at the time, while her friends drank. The guy she kissed ‚Äúwasn‚Äôt instantly recognizable.‚Äù 
wait i hope the rumors about ariana dating dalton gomez are true.....i mean look at himü•∫ pic.twitter.com/5xvcZPHpiN
Since she seems to be ready to reveal this, here is part of my old thread: Ariana is dating Dalton Gomez, a real estate agent. pic.twitter.com/x8VXiifhMF
Finally, last night Ariana posted several stories on instagram where Dalton is clearly seen. In the one he pets Toulouse, you can get a glimpse of an offering bowl he has, as posted by his brother Dakota. pic.twitter.com/DHdqupUyyA
Grande was last linked romantically to Social House‚Äôs Mikey Foster. But multiple sources confirmed to ELLE in September that actually, Grande had been single. Grande and Gomez‚Äôs relationship is her first remotely public one since her engagement to Pete Davidson ended in October 2018.
No outlet has reported specifically on how the two met, but E! was told by a source at the end of March that the two share a lot of friends. ‚Äú[They] run in the same circle,‚Äù the source said. ‚ÄúHe used to be a dancer, and they have many mutual friends. She‚Äôs gotten to know him quickly with the quarantine. They‚Äôve been spending a lot of one on one time at home.‚Äù 
Grande hasn‚Äôt posted on social media about Gomez. She explained why days after news broke that they‚Äôre dating. Grande wrote on a since-deleted Instagram Story that the internet‚Äôs criticism of her personal life led her to choose to share less of it on social media.
Grande shared the video Florence Pugh posted defending her boyfriend Zach Braff after he was bullied by fans on Pugh‚Äôs IG because of his 21-year age gap with Pugh . ‚ÄúI am 24 years old,‚Äù Pugh told those fans in her video. ‚ÄúI do not need you to tell me who I should and should not love. And I would never in my life ever, ever tell anyone who they can and cannot love. It is not your place. And really, it has nothing to do with you. So if those rules are something that you do not like, then please unfollow me because the abuse that you throw at him is abuse that you‚Äôre throwing at me.‚Äù
Grande praised Pugh for her statement and wrote that it resonated deeply with her because of her own experience sharing her life online. ‚ÄúSharing special, personal life things that make u happy on the internet can be truly traumatic,‚Äù Grande said. ‚ÄúI know I‚Äôve taken a step back from doing so to protect my loved ones and myself but I just wanted to share this and let u know how perfectly u expressed this and how appreciated u are for doing so @florencepugh.‚Äù 
Sleuth fans noticed Grande follows both Gomez and his tattoo artist brother Dakota. One pointed out that Gomez and Aaron Kirman had the listing for the property she purchased. He also commented ‚ÄúThis gurl cute‚Äù on her Instagram Live in March, the fan pointed out, to which Grande responded ‚ÄúI feel blessed.‚Äù
Now to the more solid proof. Ariana has gone live on instagram yesterday, and one particular comment made her say ‚ÄúI feel blessed.‚Äù This comment is by Dalton, and her response is in a little delay, like responses usually are in a live stream on instagram. pic.twitter.com/WG08R9xokq
A source confirmed this account to Us Weekly. ‚ÄúAriana was looking for a home outside of Los Angeles to be her getaway house, and her team found Dalton to help,‚Äù the insider explained. ‚ÄúWhen she saw him, she immediately thought he was cute and very good-looking, and she asked her team to set up an in-person meeting with him. Ariana fell very hard for Dalton shortly after they met.‚Äù 
The fact that Grande and Gomez are keeping their dating low-key isn‚Äôt the only difference between him and her exes. A source told Us Weekly in late August that Gomez really takes care of her. Grande‚Äôs previous boyfriends never ‚Äúmet her needs in the same way Dalton does. Her exes acted as though she was demanding and had crazy standards,‚Äù the source said.
That source added that Gomez ‚Äúis the type of guy she has been looking for. He‚Äôs very protective of her, will go out of his way for her and does little things that are chivalrous. Dalton will go above and beyond to meet her needs.‚Äù
Given that things have really escalated. Us‚Äôs source said that ‚Äútheir relationship is serious. They‚Äôve fallen madly in love with each other.‚Äù
A few days after this update on their relationship, Gomez attended the MTV VMAs by Grande‚Äôs side. She posted a photo of the pair holding hands on Instagram, sneakily placing it as the last pic in the post. Us‚Äôs update came just three months before the two announced their engagement.
Entertainment Tonight got an update from a source about how Grande and Gomez were settling into life as newlyweds‚Äîand how marriage changed how they feel about sharing their relationship publicly.
‚ÄúAriana and Dalton felt like before they were married they couldn't be as open about their relationship without it being scrutinized in the media and now they feel way more at ease,‚Äù the outlet's source said. ‚ÄúThey have plans to travel more together and feel closer than ever.‚Äù
Grande and Gomez enjoy their new life as a married couple, the source added: ‚ÄúAriana is happy and feels very relaxed. She feels like she is entering a new chapter of life and is excited to see where it goes.‚Äù
The couple really likes ‚Äúmaking unified decisions,‚Äù the source said. ‚ÄúAriana is Dalton's first priority in everything that they do and he really values her and shows it. Ariana loves that Dalton is super chill and how understanding he is of her.‚Äù 
Days after Entertainment Tonight reported that Grande and Gomez were more comfortable sharing their relationship publicly, Grande did just that on her birthday. The singer posted a video of the two kissing on her Instagram Story. She captioned it, ‚Äúa bday baby. deeply thankful for so much love.‚Äù
Ariana Grande Via Instagram Stories pic.twitter.com/NxZ24yr6JO
October 30 marked a new era in Grande‚Äôs music, and several songs on her sixth studio album seem to be about Gomez. In her first song, ‚ÄúPositions,‚Äù Grande sings about wanting to ‚Äúmeet your mama on a Sunday‚Äù and ‚Äúmake a lotta love on Monday‚Äù in reference to her current relationship.
Other ‚ÄúPositions‚Äù lyrics nod to her new romance, including ‚ÄúPerfect, perfect / You're too good to be true (You're too good to be true)‚Äù and ‚ÄúHeaven sent you to me / I'm just hopin‚Äô I don‚Äôt repeat history‚Äù as she did with ex-fianc√© Pete Davidson. However, Grande doesn‚Äôt name Gomez outright as she did with her past loves in the track, ‚Äúthank u, next.‚Äù
There are other nods to Gomez throughout the record. The explicit ‚Äú34+35‚Äù lyrics paint a picture of the couple‚Äôs sex life. It also talks about her desire to have a family with Gomez. ‚ÄúYou might think I‚Äôm crazy / The way I‚Äôve been cravin‚Äô / If I put it quite plainly / Just give me them babies,‚Äù she sings, later belting, ‚Äúwho‚Äôs counting the time when we got it for life?‚Äù
‚ÄúSafety Net‚Äù is about Grande falling for Gomez after being hurt by past relationships. In that track, she sings, ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre making me forget my past / Never thought I‚Äôd feel like that / I came to peace with my past / Now you got me off track.‚Äù 
The song ‚ÄúPOV‚Äù also cements just how serious Grande and Gomez are. ‚ÄúI wanna love me / The way that you love me,‚Äù she sings. ‚ÄúFor all of my pretty / And all of my ugly too / I‚Äôd love to see me from your point of view.‚Äù
On Christmas Day 2020, Grande posted a photo of her and Gomez cuddling near the Christmas tree as the first photo in a holiday gallery.‚Äú"merry :)‚Äù she wrote. 
She also included photos of her and Gomez spending the day with her brother Frankie, Frankie‚Äôs boyfriend, and her mom Joan. 
In a sign things between Grande and Gomez are still going strong a year into dating, the private couple made a rare appearance in Los Angeles. On March 6, Grande and Gomez enjoyed a romantic dinner at the FIA restaurant in Santa Monica. Paparazzi photographed the two lovebirds wearing matching masks as they left the restaurant. Grande also wore her massive one-of-kind engagement ring, of course. The date was one of the first public sightings of Grande and Gomez together since Gomez proposed.
In a rare public show of affection, Grande posted a few photos of her and Gomez getting cozy.
Love a just-because romantic moment. 
Grande and Gomez leaned into their first Halloween as a married couple with two different looks. They did an elaborate Miss Creature From the Black Lagoon look, with Grande as the swamp monster and Gomez as a handsome scuba man. They then debuted a more causal (for celeb standards) second couple costume: Audrey and Seymour from Little Shop of Horrors. A PDA shot capped off the gallery of that second look:
Grande had family and contestants from Season 21 of The Voice over for Thanksgiving, and shared a series of photos and videos from the night of celebration.
Amongst them was a cute picture of Grande sitting next to Gomez and hugging their dog Toulouse, hiding her face so only her signature ponytail and ribbon were visible.
Ariana Grande has been incredibly busy with the filming schedule for Wicked, in which she plays Glinda. A source told ET that Gomez has been backing her up during this demanding time.
‚ÄúAriana Grande and Dalton Gomez have both been keeping busy with work projects,‚Äù the source claimed. ‚ÄúAriana has been so focused, but Dalton has been there with her and supporting her behind the scenes... He is happy for her and they are very in love.‚Äù
A second source added, ‚ÄúThis role is Ariana's dream and she's throwing herself fully into it and Dalton is supportive.‚Äù
Grande revealed just how long she and Gomez had been dating in May 2023 when she posted a photo of them kissing on their wedding day to mark their two-year anniversary. ‚Äú2 [years married], 3.5 years together!!!! I love him so,‚Äù she wrote. It served as a remarkably rare look into their relationship:
On Sunday, July 15, Grande was seen at Wimbledon without Gomez, watching the men's singles final between Djokovic and Alcaraz. Fans noticed that there was no ring on her wedding ring finger, despite it being a high profile event. She had been seen on social media without it as well, so this added fuel to rumors that they might be going through a rough patch.
Grande was seated between Spider-Man actor Andrew Garfield and Bridgerton star Jonathan Bailey. 
Grande has been in the UK filming Wicked Part 1 for some time now, and Gomez has deleted his Instagram. 
Grande‚Äôs lawyer Laura Wasser was the first to file for divorce on Monday, September 18, citing ‚Äúirreconcilable differences‚Äù as their reason for splitting. Gomez filed after. Their date of separation was listed as February 20, 2023.
Sources explained to TMZ that Grande and Gomez worked everything out before they filed. Grande will ‚Äúcut Dalton a check, and that will be that,‚Äù the outlet wrote.
A source revealed to TMZ that there are no hard feelings between them, and their delay in filing was just because the former couple was sorting out everything and settling in private.
Grande sparked speculation that she and Gomez may have broken up when she attended Wimbledon on July 16, 2o23, not wearing her wedding band. A day later, TMZ confirmed that Grande and Gomez had privately separated in January, per multiple sources connected to the couple. Their issues predated Grande going abroad to the U.K. to shoot Wicked in December. The outlet reported that privately, Grande and Gomez tried to reconcile a few months ago, but the effort failed.
Grande and Gomez are still on good terms though, with the outlet describing them ‚Äúfriends [who] still talk on the phone regularly.‚Äù Their romance has ended though, and one source characterized them as ‚Äúheading for divorce.‚Äù
Grande did not immediately comment on the report.
In the first day after TMZ broke the news of Grande and Gomez's split, more outlets received details on the private effort they made the reconcile. TMZ reported that Gomez and Grande lived separate lives starting in January; they tried reconciling briefly in May but after two weeks, called it. Entertainment Tonight received more intel from a source on that last-ditch effort. ‚ÄúDalton went to Europe recently to be with Ariana and try to work things out between them,‚Äù the source said. ‚ÄúBut it just wasn‚Äôt working. They were having issues for a while, but they are trying to be as respectful as they can and protect each other's privacy through this breakup.‚Äù
Sources told TMZ that Gomez has already begun dating again with Grande's blessing since they separated. The outlet reported that Gomez struggled with Grande's fame once COVID-19 restrictions lifted.
A source also noted to People that distance was a factor as Gomez's work keeps him in Los Angeles. ‚ÄúShe was happy in Los Angeles for a couple of years. She wanted to make a life there with Dalton,‚Äù the source started.
‚ÄúHe is super focused on his career and needs to live in Los Angeles,‚Äù the source continued. ‚ÄúIt's definitely been an issue for them. Dalton's career is demanding and he can't leave Los Angeles often. So when [Grande] started filming Wicked in England, they were in for a long-distance marriage.‚Äù
On August 25, Gomez was photographed out in public for the first time since his breakup from Grande was announced. He appeared downcast in photos and was no longer wearing his wedding ring. A source spoke to Us Weekly on August 28 and confirmed that Gomez was still having trouble with the split.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been a little while since Ariana and Dalton split, but he‚Äôs been adjusting to his new normal and learning to accept it for what it is,‚Äù the source said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs certainly not how he expected things to play out because he obviously assumed they would be together forever.‚Äù
‚ÄúHe never imagined he would be going through a divorce in the public eye,‚Äù the source added. ‚ÄúBut he‚Äôs hanging in there and is grateful for his friends and family who have been really supportive.‚Äù
On September 13, a source told Entertainment Tonight that Gomez is still healing from the end of his and Grande‚Äôs marriage. ‚Äú[He‚Äôs] throwing himself into work and working harder than ever since his split from Ariana,‚Äù the source said. ‚ÄúHe is trying to stay distracted and keep himself busy in positive ways.‚Äù
As for his love life, Gomez ‚Äúis dating a little bit and a lot of girls are giving Dalton attention. He is not completely over his relationship with Ariana, but he is doing his best to move forward.‚Äù
The update came a day after a source claimed to Daily Mail that Grande hadn‚Äôt completely let Gomez go. ‚ÄúIt seems as if Ariana is holding onto Dalton in case things with Ethan don‚Äôt work. It is just so strange that she is living with Ethan and has not filed documents to end it with Dalton,‚Äù the source alleged. Of course, neither Grande, Gomez, nor Slater have commented on any of this.
Just a few weeks after filing for divorce, the former couple came to an agreement on the end of their marriage. TMZ reports they had a prenup and there will be no spousal support. However, Gomez is reportedly receiving $1,250,000, tax-free, and half of the net proceeds from the sale of their home in Los Angeles. Grande will be asked to pay up to $25,000 of her ex-husband's attorney fees and for his continued 24-hour security. 
A source told Page Six, ‚ÄúAriana and Dalton really wanted to take care of each through all of this and make it as easy on one another as possible‚Äîwhich is why they really took their time with everything.‚Äù
The insider added, ‚ÄúThey have a strong mutual respect for eachother.‚Äù 
Another source told TMZ, ‚ÄúThere is still a strong mutual love and respect between Ariana and Dalton and they wanted to make sure everything was done right in lockstep with one another.‚Äù
Alyssa Bailey is the senior news and strategy editor at ELLE.com, where she oversees coverage of celebrities and royals (particularly Meghan Markle and Kate Middleton). She previously held positions at InStyle and Cosmopolitan. When she's not working, she loves running around Central Park, making people take #ootd pics of her, and exploring New York City.

title: All the Celebrity Breakups in 2023 (So Far)
text:
Love comes and goes, but the going tends to be much more dramatic. It's only spring, but the year 2023 has seen the end of several high-profile celebrity relationships, and there will likely be more to come. It's not a wish; it's just a fact.
Check below to see if any of your favorites have said goodbye to one another this year.
Taylor Swift and Joe Alwyn's six-year romance was kept mostly private by the couple, although Alwyn inspired many of Swift's love songs over the years. News of their secret breakup, which took place in March and was initiated by Swift, broke on April 8. A source told People days later that although they had talked about marriage just months before, greater incompatibilities made it clear to the pair that they weren't right for the long, long term. ‚ÄúJoe has struggled with Taylor's level of fame and the attention from the public,‚Äù the source said. ‚ÄúThe differences in their personalities have also become harder to ignore after years together. They've grown apart.‚Äù
‚ÄúTaylor didn't see them working out in the long run,‚Äù the source added.
Soon after her break up with Alwyn, Taylor Swift was romantically connected to The 1975 frontman Matt Healy. The two had been linked for a brief time in 2014, but never confirmed anything. It seemed like they were very hot and heavy for a month or two, but sources said they split in June for good.
Elle Fanning, 24, and Max Minghella, 37, were first linked in July 2018 when they were seen holding hands in Florence, Italy, according to Us Weekly. The pair worked together on Teen Spirit, which Fanning starred in and Minghella wrote and directed that same year. The project is where their love story started. (Read more about their history here.)
Throughout their run as a couple, both members opted to keep intimate details to themselves, although they would sometimes go to events together or post Instagrams showing moments from their life together.
Fanning announced the pair's breakup indirectly during her interview with Harper's Bazaar UK, published at the beginning of April. She revealed she was currently single but hopeful about finding love again. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm a hopeless romantic. I believe in love at first sight,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúCall me crazy, but I believe in those things. I feel that it‚Äôs my destiny.‚Äù
Captain Marvel star Brie Larson and Elijah Allan-Blitz, a 36-year-old virtual reality director, were first photographed kissing in July 2019. The couple didn't talk about their relationship much while dating, but they did attend events together, such as the 2020 Oscars, The Daily Front Row's 2022 fashion awards in Los Angeles, and the D23 Expo in September 2022. The pair worked together on The Messy Truth VR Experience series, which earned them an Emmy in the ceremony's outstanding original interactive program category, per People.
Larson and Allan-Blitz were last photographed together showing affection in September 2022, as seen above. 
Larson revealed that they privately broke up sometime after during a Harper's Bazaar interview published in late March 2023. She didn't specify when exactly the split occurred. She only said she's open to what's next in her life: ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt have a next job. I don‚Äôt have a home. I don‚Äôt have a partner. I don‚Äôt have a plan. I‚Äôm just completely open.‚Äù
Noel Gallagher and Sara MacDonald met in the year 2000 while in Ibiza, and they got married in 2011. After 12 years of wedded life, they announced on January 16, 2023, that they were getting a divorce. 
‚ÄúNoel and Sara will together continue to look after their children who remain their priority,‚Äù a spokesperson said. ‚ÄúNoel and Sara ask the media to respect their privacy and that of our family at this time.‚Äù
The former couple share two sons, Donovan, 15, and Sonny, 12. Gallagher has a daughter, Ana√Øs, 22, who he had in his former marriage to Meg Mathews, who he divorced in 2001.
After five years together, Maisie Williams and Reuben Selby broke up. Williams shared the news with her followers on February 23, posting a selfie with Selby on her Instagram Stories. 
Over the pic, she wrote, ‚ÄúThe end of an era. @reubenselby_ and I decided to end our relationship. Since we met 5 years ago, our connection always extended deeply into our shared, and separate, creative careers... and it will continue to do so."
She continued, ‚ÄúThis decision is something we are so grateful or as we can protect the magic, that we can't help but emit, whenever we put our brains together. P.s no further questions, please, we must protect our children (my dog).‚Äù
Selby reshared the announcement in his own Stories, adding a heart emoji.
Avril Lavigne and Mod Sun started dating in January 2021, and became engaged in April 2022. But they ended their relationship, confirming their split on February 21.
‚ÄúAvril and Mod Sun have been on and off for the past two months, but are no longer together as a couple,‚Äù an insider told People. 
Mod Sun posted in early March that his life had ‚Äúcompletely changed‚Äù on Instagram.
‚ÄúIn 1 week my entire life completely changed,‚Äù he said in the caption. ‚ÄúI just know there‚Äôs a plan for it all. üíî Being surrounded by love every night on tour has been an absolute blessing. I have the best friends in the entire world, thanks for always having my back. See you on stage.‚Äù
After eight months together, singer Camila Cabello and Lox Club CEO Austin Kevitch split up after first being linked in summer of 2022. Entertainment Tonight reports that the news broke when a newsletter for Lox Club subscribers stated that, ‚ÄúAustin is single again.‚Äù 
In news that shook the reality TV fandom, Tom Sandoval and Ariana Madix broke it off in March 2023 after nine years together. The breakup was famously instigated by Sandoval's ongoing affair with Vanderpump Rules costar Raquel Leviss. 
‚ÄúThey had been having problems for a while, but this was the final straw for Ariana,‚Äù and insider told People. ‚ÄúShe put up with a lot over the years, but she won't sit back and be disrespected this way.‚Äù
Maddie Ziegler and Eddie Benjamin went public with their relationship in March 2020 after about a year together, but a source close to the couple told People that the Dance Moms alum and Australian singer broke up in February after three years.
Their last photos together posted on Zeigler's Instagram page were three months ago around the Christmas holidays.
Just days shy of their 12th wedding anniversary, Witherspoon announced on her Instagram that she and her husband Jim Toth had decided to separate. She wrote in a statement from the former couple:
In late July, 2023, it was reported that Rosal√≠a and Rauw Alejandro had split and broken off their engagement after two years together. The former couple recently released a three-song EP titled RR featuring the hit song ‚ÄúBeso.‚Äù  
‚ÄúYes, a few months ago Rosi and I ended our engagement,‚Äù Alejandro wrote in his Instagram Stories July 26. ‚ÄúThere are thousands of problems that could cause a breakup, but in our case it was not due to third parties or infidelity.‚Äù
He added, ‚ÄúDuring the space that I am taking to assimilate all of this, erroneous public allegations have emerged, and out of the respect I have for her, our families and all that we lived through, I could not stay silent and continue to watch how they try to destroy the story of the most real love that God has permitted me to live.‚Äù 
‚ÄúI never saw myself in a position of even thinking that I would have to give public statements on this matter that is so private to me,‚Äù he concluded.
A day later, Rosal√≠a wrote a statement on her Instagram Stories.
‚ÄúI love, respect and admire Ra√∫l very much,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúNot paying attention to the theatrics, we know what we have experienced. This moment is not easy so thanks to everyone for understanding and respecting.‚Äù
Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and his wife, Sophie, announced their separation after 18 years of marriage. The couple were married in 2005. They'd actually know one another in their childhoods, but reconnected again in 2003 at a charity gala. They share three children, 15-year-old Xavier, 14-year-old Ella-Grace and 9-year-old Hadrien. 
‚ÄúAs always, we remain a close family with deep love and respect for each other and for everything we have built and will continue to build,‚Äù they said in a statement on Instagram. 
Ariana Grande and Dalton Gomez reportedly broke up in January, but it was noted in July when the Wicked star was seen at Wimbledon without her wedding ring. Soon after, it was confirmed that she is dating her co-star Ethan Slater.
They first broke up in November 2021 after dating for two years.  In July of 2023, it was confirmed that model Bella Hadid had broken up a few minutes earlier. In April of 2022, she shared some more about her relationship with Vogue, saying, ‚ÄúI think that‚Äôs why things have been able to last. When you give other people room to have opinions on things that are so personal to you, it poisons it.‚Äù
Camila Cabello and Shawn Mendes broke up in November of 2021, but in April of 2023 they sparked dating rumors again when they were seen kissing at Coachella. However, a source told Entertainment Tonight in June, ‚ÄúShawn and Camila broke up and are no longer seeing each other. They gave things a try, but ultimately the timing isn't right for either of them. They're both staying busy and doing their own things.‚Äù 
The couple announced their divorce on July 17, 2023, after seven years of marriage and one of dating. Manganiello filed, citing ‚Äúirreconcilable differences‚Äù as the reason for their split.
‚ÄúThey have been growing apart for some time now and tried to resolve things, but they are focused on different areas of their lives,‚Äù a source told People. ‚ÄúThey definitely love and respect each other, but once that initial passion dies down and other areas get in the way, then little differences get bigger.‚Äù
Shortly after their 11th wedding anniversary, Portman and Millepied reportedly separated after news of the choreographer's affair, with 25-year-old climate activist Camille √âtienne, broke. They have supposedly been working on rebuilding trust because the actress wants to preserve a home for their two children.
‚ÄúNatalie believes Benjamin‚Äôs affair was a brief and stupid liaison that means nothing to him,‚Äù a source told US Weekly in August 2023.
After 14 months of marriage and seven years together, Spears and Asghari separated at the end of July 2023. The marriage has ‚Äúbeen on the rocks for months‚Äù according to a source. 
Though they have yet to comment on their alleged split, TMZ reported that Jonas and Turner's relationship has been ‚Äúcircling the drain‚Äù for the past six months over Labor Day weekend. He has supposedly contacted divorce lawyers in the Los Angeles area as the two face conflict over the care of their two daughters.
After 27 years together, actor Hugh Jackman and his wife Deborra-Lee Furness announced in a statement to People that they were breaking up on September 15, 2023.
‚ÄúWe have been blessed to share almost 3 decades together as husband and wife in a wonderful, loving marriage,‚Äù they wrote. ‚ÄúOur journey now is shifting and we have decided to separate to pursue our individual growth.‚Äù
The statement continued, ‚ÄúOur family has been and always will be our highest priority. We undertake this next chapter with gratitude, love, and kindness. We greatly appreciate your understanding in respecting our privacy as our family navigates this transition in all of our lives...This is the sole statement either of us will make.‚Äù
The pair share two children, Oscar and Ava. They met on the set of Australian TV series Corelli, and were married a year later.
On Monday, October 2, Jodie Turner-Smith filed for divorce from Joshua Jackson after being married for nearly four years. They share a three-year-old child. The former couple was recently photographed together, but a source told Entertainment Tonight that they have been having issues and Turner-Smith is firm in her decision to end the marriage.
‚ÄúJodie and Joshua have been having issues lately,‚Äù the source said. ‚ÄúThey celebrated Jodie‚Äôs birthday on September 9 at The Flower Shop in NYC but arrived separately and left separately. It was a big party, and they were distant throughout the night and barely around each other. Jodie spent majority of the evening downstairs.‚Äù
Another source told US Weekly, ‚ÄúJoshua was clearly caught off guard by Jodie‚Äôs decision to divorce...They had their issues, as many couples do‚Äîespecially two busy actors who are also juggling a child. Joshua obviously didn‚Äôt realize it was this bad, that Jodie was this unhappy.‚Äù
Aim√©e Lutkin is the weekend editor at ELLE.com. Her writing has appeared in Jezebel, Glamour, Marie Claire and more. Her first book, The Lonely Hunter, will be released by Dial Press in February 2022.

She previously held positions at InStyle and Cosmopolitan. When she's not working, she loves running around Central Park, making people take #ootd pics of her, and exploring New York City.

title: Israel-Palestine: How to Help the Victims of Yesterday‚Äôs Deadly Attack
text:
A list of organizations offering relief to those in need and working toward peace.
Hamas, a Palestinian militant group, launched an attack on Israel this Saturday, firing at least 2,200 rockets into the country and adding 500 or more to the death toll in a war that has carried on for decades. 
The Israeli Defense Forces, in return, declared a state of war and retaliated with airstrikes. 
Bloodshed is not something to take sides in. And a conflict that has gone on for centuries, killed millions of innocent families, and wreaked religious, political, and economic havoc in two populations, can only be described as a catastrophe that must find its resolution. 
Below, a list of organizations calling for peace and helping the victims of this war.
ALLMEP is the largest network of Palestinian and Israeli peace builders. Donate here.
The Carter Center has been promoting peace in Israel and Palestine since the 1990s. ‚ÄúThrough election observation, conflict resolution, and human rights work in the occupied Palestinian territory, The Carter Center has developed strong relations among key Israeli and Palestinian political leaders, electoral officials, civil society leaders, and human rights practitioners,‚Äù they say. Donate to their cause here.
The United Nations remains a neutral organization aiming to bring peace between the two territories. Donate here.
The International Red Cross provides assistance during times of crisis, and has pleaded for an end to the violence between Israel and Palestine. ‚ÄúIn our role as a neutral intermediary, we are ready to visit anyone detained so we can check on their well-being and provide news to their loved ones,‚Äù the organization says. Help here.
Doctors Without Borders provides immediate medical aid during humanitarian emergencies. Help them save lives here.
International Medical Corps works with local health agencies and partners to provide emergency health services, gender-based violence services, and COVID-19 prevention services. Donate here.
Save the Children is providing resources to affected children. Donate here.
Direct Relief provides medical resources in vulnerable communities worldwide. Help here.
The International Rescue Committee is assessing needs on the ground and the organization‚Äôs capacity to ensure critical, life-saving humanitarian relief reaches affected civilian populations. Donate here.

title: 11 Indigenous Designers to Support on Indigenous Peoples‚Äô Day and Always
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
This month, we celebrate and honor Native American people and commemorate their histories and cultures. But the time to support Indigenous artists is year-round. Sustainability and tradition are often at the forefront of Indigenous design, whether it‚Äôs the way Keri Ataumbi  uses visual storytelling in her jewelry or the history behind Jamie Gentry‚Äôs bespoke moccasin boutique. For Amy Denet Deal of 4KINSHIP, creativity is also about telling Indigenous stories, which have so often been misunderstood or not told at all. ‚ÄúI want people to know we are limitless,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúOur creativity has been highly coveted by the fashion industry, and for decades has been appropriated. It‚Äôs our time to step into the fashion space to tell our own stories and present our own creative visions ourselves.‚Äù  
By uplifting Indigenous, Native American, and First Nation-owned brands, you help grow small businesses, spread inclusivity, and encourage authentic art. ‚ÄúThere is such a pan-indigenous view of native people, yet we are over 574 different tribes, so there is certainly not just one point of view,‚Äù Denet Deal says. We hope to see more and more of these talented visionaries sharing their perspectives in the years to come. For now, here are 11 designers to support this Indigenous Peoples‚Äô Day‚Äîand always. 
Korina Emmerich descends from a long line of Coast Salish Territory fisherman on her father‚Äôs side, and her designs for EMME Studio often reflect that legacy. She is known for crafting beautiful jackets and shirts in bright sunset and oceanic colors, and in patterns that pay homage to the sacred relationship between humans and animals. Celebrities and politicians like Deb Haaland have worn Emmerich‚Äôs designs, and one of her creations, a wool skirt and coat, was even featured in the Metropolitan Museum of Art‚Äôs ‚ÄúIn America: A Lexicon of Fashion‚Äù exhibit. At the height of the pandemic, Emmerich used her sartorial skills to help her community by crafting hundreds of face masks in traditional patterns and hues. ‚Äú[Indigenous] masks can carry heavy ceremonial responsibilities in recovery and healing,‚Äù Emmerich told ELLE at the time. ‚ÄúEverything created is meant to be used and masks help share traditional teachings in a sort of theatrical way.‚Äù
Lauren Good Day, an Arikara-Hidatsa-Blackfeet-Plains-Cree designer, learned beadwork from her mother as a child. She then took that passion for art and traditional design and incorporated it into her eponymous contemporary clothing brand, which is known worldwide for its bright unisex graphic tees, hoodies, and pants. Her latest collection honors the ‚Äúaesthetic of the flourishing Northern Plains‚Äù and features traditional floral and elk patterns in bright colors.
Growing up on the Wind River Reservation in Wyoming, Keri Ataumbi developed a love for contemporary Native American design at an early age. The Kiowa fine jeweler categorizes her work as ‚Äúwearable art,‚Äù because it incorporates conceptual narrative and often features juxtaposing materials. ‚ÄúIn the Western world, there‚Äôs been a real separation in terms of what‚Äôs art and what isn‚Äôt art,‚Äù she said in an interview. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs not an integrated feeling about jewelry, that jewelry is actually art and can have all the same stories and potency that a painting does.‚Äù  
Renowned beadworker Jamie Okuma is thoughtful and eco-conscious when she comes up with her luxury designs‚Äîwhich often incorporate intricate patterns of florals and animals. Okuma‚Äîwho is Luise√±o, Shoshone-Bannock, Wailaki, and Okinawan‚Äîkeeps production quantity relatively low in order to avoid overstock. ‚ÄúWe all have those go-to pieces in our closet that we keep for years and literally wear out before we retire them,‚Äù she said in an interview. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm here to make the go-tos, the keepers.‚Äù
Lesley Hampton, who landed a spot on ELLE Canada‚Äôs list of designers to watch, credits her Anishinaabe and Mohawk heritage for shaping her work. Hampton‚Äôs sleek designs, which bring to light issues like mental health via phrases and sayings emblazoned on them, have been spotted on runways and red carpets (Lizzo is a fan). But that‚Äôs not why Hampton got into fashion. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been doing a lot of growing up and discovering my Indigeneity,‚Äù she told ELLE Canada. ‚ÄúI use the collection as a catalyst for figuring out my identity. Being able to present that with beautiful garments on the runway is just a bonus.‚Äù
Jamie Gentry is from the Kwakwaka‚Äôwakw Nation, and grew up immersed in a world full of traditional culture and art‚Äîparticularly sewing, beading, and weaving. She took that deep-rooted passion for all things handmade and turned it into a bona fide bespoke moccasin-making business. Each pair is custom-made and, Gentry says on her site, says ‚Äúinfused with love.‚Äù
As a teenager, Tania Larsson immersed herself in her Gwich‚Äôin culture‚Äîteaching herself how to make traditional jewelry and beaded garments. She found a mentor in Ataumbi, featured above on this list. After apprenticing under the designer for two years, Larsson began making her own beautiful jewelry under her brand Gwich‚Äôin Fine Jewellery, which she described in an interview as ‚Äúa conduit that creates connections between the land, animals, elders, hunters, community members, and the wearer.‚Äù 
Fast fashion didn‚Äôt suit artistic designer Amy Denet Deal. So in 2018, she left her corporate fashion job in Los Angeles and headed to New Mexico. Inspired by the sense of sustainability of her native Navajo community, Deal launched 4KINSHIP as a woman-led ‚Äúartwear‚Äù brand focused on upcycling and producing one-of-a-kind clothing and accessories and uplifting Indigenous communities, particularly those in the Southwest where 4KINSHIP is based. She also founded the 4KINSHIP Indigenous Futures Fund to help incubate emerging talents and encourage Native creativity and expression. 
ThunderVoice Hat Co. is one of Denet Deal‚Äôs personal favorites for its ‚Äúexquisite upcycled luxury products.‚Äù ThunderVoice does offer an array of high-end hats and jewelry, but you can also find a wide variety of smaller items that would be perfect for gifting, like stickers, pins, and fanny packs. One thing that is particularly special at TVHC is the art. You can find classic works like ‚ÄúGirl With a Pearl Earring‚Äù  and ‚ÄúAmerican Gothic‚Äù reimagined through a Native American lens. The results are stunning. 
There‚Äôs only one Indigenous denim brand in the entire world‚Äîone!‚Äîand it‚Äôs Ginew. This brand takes modern Native American style and adds inflections of Ojibwe, Oneida, Stockbridge-Munsee motifs. All of Ginew‚Äôs apparel and goods are made of the highest quality and with the utmost care and tradition. All leather goods are made with pre-industrial techniques informed by generations of craftsmanship.  
From northern Arizona‚Äôs Din√© (Navajo) people, comes Di‚ÄôOrr Greenwood. Greenwood specializes in hand making bespoke wooden flutes, skateboard decks, and longboards. Her designs are colorful and, more importantly, meaningful. ‚ÄúAny art that comes from me is definitely ancestral based,‚Äù she said in a Navajo Times interview. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs more of a feeling.‚Äù Themes and symbols Greenwood incorporates include the four directions, elements, mountains, and the seasons.

title: Taylor Swift Takes a More ‚ÄòPrivate‚Äô Approach to Her Travis Kelce Relationship‚Äîand Skips Sunday‚Äôs Game
text:
Taylor Swift is taking some of the spotlight off her and Travis Kelce‚Äôs burgeoning, highly-publicized relationship. After attending two of Kelce‚Äôs NFL games in a row, the singer opted to skip the Kansas City Chiefs‚Äô face-off against the Minnesota Vikings. The NFL confirmed her absence shortly after the game began. 
She also wasn‚Äôt seen with Kelce on his birthday last week. The singer had sparked rumors that she traveled to be with him when she was seen leaving New York City the day before the big day. Kelce was instead photographed hanging out with friends in a stadium parking lot in Kansas City, Missouri for an hour before returning to a training facility.
So, why the change in approach? Kelce and an Entertainment Tonight source warned people that Swift and Kelce intended to be a little more private last week.
‚ÄúWhen Taylor and Travis first connected, Taylor was looking to have fun while enjoying some downtime,‚Äù a source said on September 28. ‚ÄúSo far, it‚Äôs been a nice change of pace for her. Now, as things progress between Taylor and Travis, they‚Äôre both looking to keep it more private. They‚Äôre both excited about where things are headed.‚Äù
In his New Heights podcast on September 27, Kelce said, ‚ÄúI want to respect both of our lives. She‚Äôs not in the media as much as I am doing this show every single week and you know, having fun during the NFL season and on other guys‚Äô shows like the McAfee Show, and any other show that I go on from here on out. I‚Äôm enjoying life, and I sure as hell enjoyed this weekend so everything moving forward, I think me talking about sports‚Ä¶will kind of have to be where I keep it.‚Äù
Rest assured, the excitement remains between them, though.
In fact, a source spoke about Kelce‚Äôs feelings for Swift yesterday to The Messenger, along with his thoughts on her attending his games. ‚ÄúHe jokes she is his good luck charm,‚Äù the source said, since the Chiefs won both the games that Swift attended. (They also won yesterday‚Äôs game, where she notably wasn‚Äôt present.) ‚ÄúTaylor is having the time of her life at these football games cheering on Travis. Her and her friends are fully embracing this era and are having a lot of fun being there. Taylor has worked very hard this last year and It's fun for her to bring all of her friends along, let loose and show support.‚Äù
Kelce and Swift haven‚Äôt been physically seen together since Swift attended her first Chiefs game on September 24. 
He was photographed leaving Swift‚Äôs apartment after spending a little time there the morning of October 1, before his game against the New York Jets. Swift attended that game with a group of friends including Blake Lively, Ryan Reynolds, and Sophie Turner. She left with the group.
Swift, of course, is no stranger to flying under the radar. Much of her last six-year romance with Joe Alwyn was kept completely private.

title: The 14 Best Natural At-Home Hair Color Dyes
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
Salon-level results, right this way. 
 From skincare to sunscreen to our favorite fragrances, we constantly look for new ways to shop for clean, sustainable beauty products. As we are becoming increasingly conscious about what we‚Äôre putting on our bodies, it makes sense to want to upgrade your beauty stash, including finding a more natural alternative for your hair dye. Whether you want to touch up your roots, cover any errant gray strands, or are just a fan of the spontaneous color change, it may be time to find a natural at-home hair color.  
While there are natural options like henna or even a few interesting vegetable concoctions that claim to help color your hair, there are plenty of simpler DIY hair dyes out there as well. If you are prone to irritation or itchy scalp, natural colors are your best bet to reduce the likelihood of allergic reactions. Plus, they are a better alternative for the planet and your overall hair health. We did the hard work by scouring the internet to find dyes free of the harsh chemicals found in popular traditional formulas. Below, find 14 of the best natural hair dyes for salon-level results in the comfort of your home. 
Formulated without ammonia, silicones, and alcohol (and housed inside a recyclable carton), Schwarzkopf‚Äôs newest at-home hair color is its best yet. Equally exciting as what‚Äôs been left out is what this dye is formulated with: oat milk, soy protein, and argan oil to nourish and reinforce strands for a final color that‚Äôs natural and healthy-looking. Find it in twelve shades (all costing less than $10).
Walmart rating: 4.4 stars 
A Walmart reviewer says: ‚ÄúNo heavy odors while applying. Absolutely no scalp discomfort! The color is staying in my hair well and my hair is feeling and looking healthier than it usually does after applying a color. Great product.‚Äù 
Madison Reed is pretty much synonymous with quality at-home hair dye‚Äîthanks to the brand's breakthrough formulations, product ease-of-use, and tech-savvy shade matching. It's not without very mild itching for a few days but it's 95% better than store bought. You get a box with absolutely everything you need to do the job!‚Äù

This powder formula provides intense pigment with a mix of natural herbal ingredients. An Amazon reviewer says: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm allergic to every hair dye I‚Äôve tried. Thought I‚Äôd just have to be ok with these grays. Read countless reviews of other products as well as this one and decided to give it a shot. Did an allergy patch test but was still skeptical. Turned out that I didn‚Äôt have an allergic reaction and proceeded to dye my roots. Make sure to read directions thoroughly before application as the process is a little different from standard box dyes. I was really Impressed with the coverage and the fact that I did not have an allergic reaction which is what sealed the deal. I will continue to purchase this brand from now on! Made with a 60 percent oil blend, this permanent color is perfect for those looking for extreme shine with their color. Amazon rating: 4.4/5 stars
An Amazon reviewer says: ‚ÄúCovers all my grey. It‚Äôs gentle and doesn‚Äôt have much smell. Pricing is fair. Leaves my hair shiny and very natural looking. I use the light brown and it gives me light brown with lovely natural looking golden blonde streaks when I go out in the sunshine. It‚Äôs the only hair dye I will use.‚Äù 
If you aren‚Äôt quite ready to dive headfirst into a new hair color or are just looking to seriously enhance your natural color, Aveda is probably a brand to reach for. Formulated with shea butter, and a combination of strawberry, apricot, and raspberry seed oils, this treatment masque deeply hydrates and revives both natural and color-treated hair for a vibrant look with a visibly healthier shine. Aveda rating: 4/5 stars
An Aveda reviewer says: ‚ÄúThis color renewal treatment is everything! I hate how my brown hair often gets discolored or yellow and this really helped me combat that! Would definitely keep using it. An absolute favorite right now.‚Äù 
When discussing hair, the term ‚Äúnatural‚Äù hair color is far from one-size-fits-all‚Äîit can mean a lot of different things, such as that the formulation swaps out harsher chemicals (like ammonia) for less-irritating ones, that it‚Äôs eco-friendly, or that it contains plant-derived ingredients.
Whatever the case, you‚Äôll never find a 100 percent natural hair dye that doesn‚Äôt contain any chemicals at all‚Äîbecause for hair color to work, a chemical reaction must occur. It‚Äôs worth noting that there is one exception here‚Äîpure henna, although that‚Äôs another story, as it can create problems of its own. 
Generally speaking, there are two well-known chemical irritants that you‚Äôll want to steer clear of: ammonia and paraphenylenediamine, or PPD, which is known to cause severe allergic reactions.

title: The Crown Season 6: Everything We Know
text:
Creator Peter Morgan said he's ‚Äúhappy that I‚Äôm never going to write‚Äù about Harry and Meghan's step away from royal life.
Contrary to initial reports, Netflix is opening its palace doors one more time for The Crown season 6. In July 2020, show creator Peter Morgan reversed course on his decision to end the royal drama after its fifth season: ‚ÄúAs we started to discuss the storylines for Series 5, it soon became clear that in order to do justice to the richness and complexity of the story we should go back to the original plan and do six seasons,‚Äù Morgan said in a statement, via Variety. 
Morgan‚Äôs change of heart is his second regarding a sixth and final season. Back in January 2020, Morgan had originally stated, ‚ÄúAt the outset I had imagined The Crown running for six seasons, but now that we have begun work on the stories for season 5 it has become clear to me that this is the perfect time and place to stop. I‚Äôm grateful to Netflix and Sony for supporting me in this decision.‚Äù But best laid plans couldn‚Äôt support the heft of numerous important storylines, particularly those surrounding Prince Charles and Princess Diana‚Äôs divorce, and the Princess of Wales‚Äôs death in 1997. 
Ahead, everything we know about the final installment, including which prime ministers will be depicted and why the Sussexes have been excluded from the season.
The final season will be split into two halves. Part 1 premieres on November 16, and part 2 premieres on December 14. 
A late 2023 premiere date was already expected as past seasons have been released in the fall. Filming for season 6 began in September 2022.
Watch The Crown on Netflix
Season 5 ends shortly before Princess Diana departs on a vacation with Mohamed and Dodi Fayed. Season 6 will cover events from 1997 through 2005, Netflix confirms. 
Part 1, the first four episodes, portray the relationship between Princess Diana and Fayed, including their fatal car crash. Part 2, the last six episodes, features Prince William acclimating to life at Eton following his mother‚Äôs death; the Queen assessing the future of the monarchy upon her Golden Jubilee; the marriage between Prince Charles and Camilla; and William and Kate‚Äôs courtship.  
That means there won‚Äôt be any episodes that address the marriage of Prince William and Kate Middleton (2011), Meghan Markle and Prince Harry‚Äôs decision to step back from royal duties, or Prince Andrew‚Äôs ouster due to his friendship with Jeffrey Epstein. 
In fact, Peter Morgan has said he‚Äôs relieved to not cover recent events. ‚ÄúThe Meghan and Harry story is nowhere near over yet,‚Äù he told Town & Country in October 2020. ‚ÄúAnd I‚Äôm happy that I‚Äôm never going to write it.‚Äù 
It‚Äôs likely that, in addition to Princess Diana‚Äôs car accident in Paris on August 31, 1997, season 6 will cover the 2002 deaths of Princess Margaret and Queen Elizabeth, the Queen Mother. (Margaret died on February 9, 2002, while the Queen Mother passed less than two months later, on March 30, 2002.)  
Netflix first confirmed on Twitter that both seasons 5 and 6 of The Crown will star Imelda Staunton as Queen Elizabeth, with Lesley Manville, Jonathan Pryce, Dominic West and Olivia Williams playing Princess Margaret, Prince Philip, Prince Charles, and Camilla Parker-Bowles, respectively. Elizabeth Debicki will return to play Princess Diana in season 6, though only for the first four episodes.  Salim Daw will return as Mohamed Al Fayed and Khalid Abdalla will reprise his role as Dodi Fayed.
In September of 2022, the showrunners also announced casting for the younger versions of Kate Middleton and Prince William. Two actors will be portraying William in season 6: 16-year-old Rufus Kampa and 21-year-old Ed McVey. Both actors are relative newcomers, though McVey has appeared frequently on stage in London. Meg Bellamy will play Kate Middleton. Both she and Kampa were discovered after submitting casting tapes to an open call on social media. 
Prince Harry will be portrayed by Fflyn Edwards in his younger years and by Luther Ford as a teen.  
While we wait for an official trailer, we can rely on behind-the-scenes images and paparazzi shots for an inside glimpse at The Crown‚Äôs last chapter. One image published on March 10 features a scene between Prince William (Ed McVey) and Kate Middleton (Meg Bellamy) on a jog. Could it be their first encounter on the show? In real life, the couple first met as college students in 2001 while attending St. Andrews University in Scotland. 
On March 17, British Vogue released another image of Bellamy and McVey together on set, playing Kate and Will during their time at St. Andrews University.
Netflix shared the first stills from the new season, once again starring young Will and Kate in their college years, in late April. 
This post will be updated.

title: 20 Books To Read This Latinx Heritage Month‚ÄîAnd Beyond
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
Add these reads to your TBR stat.
If we‚Äôre being honest, the diversity within the publishing industry is abysmal at best. (We‚Äôre still not quite over the trauma porn fiasco of 2018.) Despite being the fastest growing demographic in the United States, the Latinx population is vastly underrepresented in the literary arts. In fact, as of 2021, only 7.62 percent of published authors identify as Hispanic or Latino. And that doesn‚Äôt even begin to touch upon the novels written by white authors that depict harmful stereotypes about the Latinx community.
Needless to say, the publishing industry has a long way to go before it can accurately represent the world we live in. Still, the books written by Latinx authors on the market today are vibrant and full of power. They represent different ethnicities and life experiences, proving once again that the Latin community is anything but a monolith.
From queer teens navigating Catholic school to gothic romances with bone-chilling vampires and everything in between, we have plenty of recommendations to help you refresh your home library.
In the Dream House has no shortage of well-earned awards for Machado‚Äôs expert storytelling, including the 2020 Lambda Literary Award for LGBTQ nonfiction. The intimate memoir takes a look at Machado‚Äôs own experience with domestic abuse and understanding herself as a queer Latina. 
This powerful collection of stories spans over a century to document Black and Afro-Latinx life in Puerto Rico and the United States. It‚Äôs great for fans of moving novels that‚Äôll have you questioning your own sense of belonging and hunting for a community of your own.
Actor Diane Guerrero, best known for her roles in Netflix‚Äôs Orange Is the New Black and Disney‚Äôs Encanto, penned a heart-wrenching memoir about her life as the daughter of undocumented immigrants. After both her parents are deported, Diane is left alone to navigate the world and the darkness within it.
This Good Morning America book club pick follows the life of a Dominican-American family ahead of a living wake‚Äîyes, you read that right. One of the sisters can predict when someone is going to die and decides to host her own wake while she‚Äôs still alive. If that didn‚Äôt sound exciting enough, the novel has no shortage of family drama, secrets, and chisme to keep you entertained in its entirety.
From the mind of The Hacienda author, Vampires of El Norte is a masterclass in horror and romance. This supernatural western *might* give you nightmares, but it‚Äôs totally worth it.
This riveting Mexican-inspired fantasy from the author of New York Times best-selling novel Cemetery Boys follows a group of semi-dioses as they compete in a grueling competition to claim fame and glory for themselves (and their godly parents).
If you haven‚Äôt read Olga Dies Dreaming yet, you‚Äôre missing out on a contemporary fiction novel that perfectly blends romance with a poignant deep-dive into Puerto Rico‚Äôs turbulent political strife and familial pressure.
The latest gothic horror novel from Mexican Gothic author Silvia Moreno-Garcia needs to be at the top of everyone‚Äôs TBR pile. Set in 1990s Mexico City, Moreno-Garcia takes you on a terrifying journey complete with occultism and curses.
This 2023 International Latino Book award winner dissects exactly what it means to be your truest self. The alternating POVs take a deeper look into the lives of three sisters and how they‚Äôve each coped with their childhood trauma.
In this poignant debut, readers follow the interwoven stories of women from the same family. It delves into the political state of Cuba in the 1800s, modern-day immigration struggles, addiction, and so much more in an effort to remind us all to never let anyone silence us.
From the author of I‚Äôm Not Your Perfect Mexican Daughter comes a collection of must-read essays that delve deep into her personal life. America Ferrera called this book ‚Äúequal parts pee-your-pants hilarity and break your heart poignancy‚Äîlike the perfect brunch date you never want to end.‚Äù
A rich and enticing fantasy involving five rulers fighting to break their generational curses, Alex Aster‚Äôs expertly crafted novel is great for fans of The Hunger Games. Complete with a movie in development and a massive fanbase on TikTok, you‚Äôll want to add this novel to your library ASAP. Oh, and did we mention there‚Äôs a love triangle? Sign us up.
If we‚Äôre being honest, any of C√≥rdova‚Äôs novels should be on your TBR list, but The Inheritance of Orqu√≠dia Divina is particularly special. Great for fans of Paulo Coelho and Isabel Allende, this novel is mesmerizing and insightful in all the right ways.
A hopeful YA about two queer teens falling in love? Yeah, we don‚Äôt need to say anymore, because this novel serves and delivers an epic love story.
Second-chance romance fans will fall head-over-heels in love with A Lot Like Adi√≥s. When childhood best friends Michelle and Gabe reunite to work on a project together, they might just rekindle their spark‚Ä¶
Silvia Vasquez-Lavado is many things. A career woman. An author. A trailblazer. In this bone-chilling memoir, she recounts her experience on Mount Everest and how it helped her better understand her own experiences with alcoholism, abuse, and complicated family dynamics. In 2020, it was announced that Selena Gomez was set to play the Peruvian mountaineer in an up-coming biopic.
This non-fiction book delves into the history of BIPOC witches and their revival in modern pop culture. It chronicles the lives of different practitioners in an attempt to destigmatize and decolonize the idea of witches as they‚Äôve been perceived throughout time.

title: How Hip-Hop Reinvented Style, Over and Over Again
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
Sowmya Krishnamurthy‚Äôs new book Fashion Killa looks back at 50 years of hip-hop aesthetics. 
Style Points is a weekly column about how fashion intersects with the wider world.
When the 50th anniversary of hip-hop came around this summer, Sowmya Krishnamurthy, like so many fans, made the pilgrimage to Yankee Stadium to watch artists like Slick Rick and Big Daddy Kane being honored. ‚ÄúI love seeing the legends getting their flowers,‚Äù she says. Still, for the longtime music journalist and author of the new book Fashion Killa: How Hip-Hop Revolutionized High Fashion, there was a disconnect. 
The anniversary celebrations, and the media blitz that accompanied them, ‚Äúfocused a lot on the old school, and we didn‚Äôt really see a huge emphasis on aesthetics and style, especially as it relates to luxury fashion.‚Äù Yes, classic images of Run-DMC in their Adidas tracksuits were everywhere, but with Fashion Killa, Krishnamurthy hopes to expand our understanding of hip-hop‚Äôs impact on and interplay with fashion beyond those much-circulated moments. 
Growing up in Kalamazoo, Michigan in the ‚Äô90s, Krishnamurthy felt a bit removed from the hip-hop scene then flourishing on the coasts. But after school, glued to MTV and BET, she‚Äôd follow the scene, and the fashion, watching Lil‚Äô Kim‚Äôs ‚ÄúCrush on You‚Äù video on repeat. ‚ÄúThe wigs and the fur, the makeup, just everything being so playful and fun and ostentatious!‚Äù she enthuses. ‚ÄúImagine seeing those images over and over again for months on end. We were almost self-brainwashing and fully inundated with the style.‚Äù
For the book, Krishnamurthy spoke to a number of rappers and designers, including Nas, A$AP Ferg, Meek Mill, Dapper Dan, and Tommy Hilfiger. COVID pushed some of those interviews to Zoom, but she fondly remembers her in-person encounters, like chatting with Cam‚Äôron while he was jewelry shopping right before his Verzuz performance. Or Pusha T telling her that ‚Äúhe actually gives away a lot of his clothes because his wardrobe is just too big. I‚Äôm like, ‚ÄòTell me where that Goodwill is, and I will take those clothes off your hands if you need me to.‚Äô‚Äù 
Through these firsthand accounts, Fashion Killa traces the way hip-hop style evolved over half a century: from rappers emulating luxury brands, with LL Cool J and Big Daddy Kane sporting Dapper Dan ‚Äúknock-ups,‚Äù to serving as inspiration for said brands, to becoming, in many cases, designers themselves and defining luxury on their own terms. 
Along the way, she tells the stories of designers like Karl Kani and April Walker, who catered to rappers in the ‚Äô80s and ‚Äô90s. ‚ÄúBack then, they were largely minimized as so-called ‚Äòurban designers,‚Äô which was a way of saying that your main demographic is not white people, essentially,‚Äù she says, ‚Äúbut they really were successful streetwear brands. Because whether it be April having relationships with Biggie Smalls and Tupac, or Karl using Tupac and Puffy as some of his earliest brand ambassadors, they were able to work with these future fashion icons.‚Äù Plenty of brands today ‚Äúare essentially riffing‚Äù on what they did, with pieces like signature hoodies or denim suits. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs cool that after all these decades, later those brands are being properly recognized and acknowledged,‚Äù she says, ‚Äúbecause without them, we don‚Äôt get Sean John, we don‚Äôt get Rocawear, we don‚Äôt get Baby Phat, we don‚Äôt get any of those.‚Äù
She traces hip-hop‚Äôs love affair with Polo Ralph Lauren through the story of the Lo Lifes, a group of young men in Brooklyn who started out ‚Äúboosting‚Äù the brand from stores and became some of its most ardent fans. (‚ÄúThey were literally walking billboards, and probably connected to more people than traditional advertising.‚Äù) And she looks at the way music figures like Snoop Dogg and Aaliyah helped popularize Tommy Hilfiger. The rap fandom for both brands was intense. ‚ÄúIt became almost a competition: ‚ÄòAre are you a Polo person? Are you a Tommy person? Are you both?‚Äô For Aaliyah's Hilfiger photo shoot, pieces from the designer's men‚Äôs collection were cut up and repurposed, with a pair of men‚Äôs underwear transforming into a bandeau. ‚ÄúBeing more collaborative and letting an artist put their own spin on it was really smart,‚Äù she says.
Soon, of course, rappers were fronting their own fashion lines. ‚ÄúYou started seeing guys who had that entrepreneurial mindset, somebody like a Puffy or a Dame Dash. They came in saying, ‚ÄòWhy are we supporting other people‚Äôs lines when our name is hot in the streets? We‚Äôre the ones moving things.‚Äô‚Äù
When we speak, a few months have passed since Pharrell Williams‚Äô debut show as the men‚Äôs creative director of Louis Vuitton, a bona fide pop-culture event that drew Beyonc√©, Jay-Z, and Megan Thee Stallion to the front row. Krishnamurthy calls it ‚Äúa full-circle moment, in that now he‚Äôs sitting inside these rarefied rooms, where before Dapper Dan had to take logos and create his version of what looked good for the hip-hop audience. Pharrell is being welcomed with open arms and his ideas are being executed...I like to say Pharrell gave me the best period to this book.‚Äù
Another major through line of the narrative is the cohort of female rappers who helped push fashion forward. Early on, many female artists wore baggy clothes and emulated their male contemporaries‚Äô style. When Lil‚Äô Kim brought a more sexed-up look to the masses, ‚Äúthere were people, from parents‚Äô groups to daytime TV hosts, even female fans, who were like, ‚ÄòWe don‚Äôt like what you‚Äôre doing, what you‚Äôre selling. We feel it degrades you; it degrades us.‚Äô She faced a lot of backlash.‚Äù 
Those conversations carry over into the present day, with the ongoing commentary about what artists like Cardi B or Megan Thee Stallion wear. ‚ÄúThere will always be that constant struggle, as a female artist. How much should the emphasis be on what you‚Äôre wearing, or what you‚Äôre not wearing? How much skin should you be showing? Does that somehow undermine you as an intelligent and competent and lyrically-skilled rapper?‚Äù  Krishnamurthy says. ‚ÄúI would love to live in a world where just because you wear a bikini does not mean that you can‚Äôt be an intelligent and respected professional.‚Äù
She points out that ‚Äúanytime people talk about the greatest rappers of all time, it‚Äôs rare that a woman even makes the list. And if [one does], it‚Äôs usually Lauryn Hill because she is beautiful and talented, but she was also covered-up and that makes people feel safe and feel like she‚Äôs a ‚Äògood girl.‚Äô It‚Äôs unfortunate, because men have been hyper-sexual and hyper-masculine since the dawn of time. No one‚Äôs going to question your morality behind the scenes: ‚ÄòAre you a good dad? Are you a good role model?‚Äô‚Äù
The most successful female rappers today, she adds, are the ones who shake off the criticism and ‚Äústay true to themselves. And if that means you ruffle a few feathers? So be it.‚Äù
V√©ronique Hyland is ELLE‚Äôs Fashion Features Director and the author of the book Dress Code, which was selected as one of The New Yorker's Best Books of the Year. Her writing has previously appeared in The New York Times Magazine, The New Yorker, W, New York magazine, Harper‚Äôs Bazaar, and Cond√© Nast Traveler.¬†

title: Peter Do Brings Back the Mall Brand With His New Collection for Banana Republic
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
‚ÄúGrounded in reality with a sense of functionality.‚Äù 
‚ÄúBanana Republic is where it‚Äôs at,‚Äù I, much to the surprise of my friends, shared in a recent group chat. ‚ÄúAnd that is the hill I will die on.‚Äù But really, can one deny that? For the past year or so, the heritage mall brand has been in the process of a serious glow-up. Looking back, Banana has been unabashed in returning to its roots by reimagining archival pieces. And based on the murmurs I hear from fellow editors, that route has proven successful. But now, the brand is heralding a new era‚Äîcementing its place as the brand of quiet luxury for the masses with a new capsule: the Peter Do x Banana Republic collection.
Peter Do has made a name for himself as the man behind his eponymous label, which has become known for luxurious, high-quality wardrobe staples with utility at the forefront. To add to that, the Vietnamese designer is also the newly-minted creative director at Helmut Lang and presented his debut collection for the brand at New York Fashion Week this September. Sounds like he has a lot on his plate, no? And yet, he still found time to create pieces for the Banana Republic customer.
‚ÄúAs with any collaboration, I was hesitant at first. We don‚Äôt do too many collaborations, and this was our first big one,‚Äù Do tells me over the phone. ‚ÄúI remember going to the mall with my mom, and we couldn‚Äôt really afford anything from Banana Republic, but I always wanted PD to speak to a wide audience, and offer our pieces at a more affordable, democratic price point, so we really aligned on that.‚Äù For him, this collaboration is about making the finer things in life more attainable. 
How does a designer known for cool, modern takes on timeless silhouettes create a collection for a brand rooted in adventure and exploration? Do took inspiration from the brand‚Äôs past‚Äîbut not quite the same way Banana‚Äôs been embracing its history. Yes, he looked at the catalogs and archives. But the main takeaway he found was the brand‚Äôs world of foundational pieces. And, of course, he injected each design with the Peter Do touch. The result? A collection that could blend seamlessly with either brand, proven by the fact that Do chose to debut his Peter Do x Banana Republic designs at his spring/summer 2024 show during Paris Fashion Week.
For Do, the main focus of this capsule was to create clothes that are transformative and versatile, telling me that he doesn‚Äôt typically think of clothes as occasionwear. The focus on versatility also explains why the designer chose to fit each piece for unisex sizing. ‚ÄúI want people to feel free to wear whatever they want,‚Äù he tells me before adding that it‚Äôs that level of sartorial freedom that feels so indicative of American fashion today, which he defines as ‚Äúgrounded in reality with a sense of functionality.‚Äù 
Functionality feels like one of the core values of Do‚Äôs designs, including those for the Banana Republic capsule. He explains how, when doing the fittings, a lot of the ideas that led to the utilitarian designs came from asking the question of how to wear them in different ways. ‚ÄúWe want this trend to be addressed or we want something to transform into a cropped jacket to share with multiple people; maybe the sleeves come off so you can wear it in multiple seasons.‚Äù Bringing all of that to this capsule, the designer feels confident in joining the brand as it embarks on a new journey.
Citing his most recent projects, Do thinks about his own journey as a designer over the past few months and sees the through line that ties it all together. ‚ÄúThe common thread is providing a system of solutions for people to express themselves; to be helpful in a way when it comes to everyday dressing.‚Äù On that note, I ask if there‚Äôs a favorite piece from the capsule that serves as the standout for this system, and he simply says, ‚ÄúI love them all.‚Äù
