title: Shelf Life: Bob Odenkirk
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
The actor and author of Zilot & Other Important Rhymes takes our literary survey.
Welcome to Shelf Life, ELLE.com‚Äôs books column, in which authors share their most memorable reads. Whether you‚Äôre on the hunt for a book to console you, move you profoundly, or make you laugh, consider a recommendation from the writers in our series, who, like you (since you‚Äôre here), love books. Perhaps one of their favorite titles will become one of yours, too.
Writing is nothing new to Bob Odenkirk. The Better Call Saul actor got his start penning sketches for Saturday Night Live in the late ‚Äò80s, for which he won an Emmy in 1989 for Outstanding Writing. Now, one year after the release of his memoir Comedy Comedy Comedy Drama, he‚Äôs teamed up with his daughter Erin for Zilot & Other Important Rhymes (Hachette Book Group), out on October 10. Billed as being perfect for fans of Shel Silverstein and Jack Prelutsky, the book of over 70 poems was inspired by the tales Odenkirk used to tell his kids when they were little.
The Illinois-born multi-hyphenate is most known for his role as Saul Goodman in Breaking Bad and its subsequent spinoff Better Call Saul. He‚Äôs won two Emmy‚Äôs (the other for The Ben Stiller Show), and has been nominated for the award over 15 times. He‚Äôs also acted in Fargo, The Post, Little Women, and, most recently, The Bear. Top off your fall reading list with his book recommendations below.
I am not much for genre writing, but The Day of The Jackal by Frederick Forsyth kept me in a (sad) hotel room in Galway for a day and a night and part of the next day. And it was a memorable time.
Drive Your Plow Over The Bones of the Dead by Olga Tokarczuk. It is so great and, believe me, please, quite funny.
On The Road by Jack Kerouac inspired and bewitched me for many, many years, it is one of the reasons I took some chances as a young person and those risks turned into this (lucky) career I‚Äôve had. Thanks, Jack!
I swear I‚Äôll finish Herman Melville one day. I played a college professor and so the sets were jam packed with books upon books. I finally cracked Moby Dick and found it VERY readable and even funny‚Ä¶ and I want to get back to it!
A Heartbreaking Work of Staggering Genius by Dave Eggers is everything its title promises and its personal and joyful deep inside, amidst the heartbreak.  Not to mention it was on the forefront of the humorously self-critiquing modern style I have enjoyed in some of my favorite stand up comedian‚Äôs work.
Recently I had the great pleasure of reading My Search For Warren Harding by Robert Plunket. It is funny on page one and gets funnier and funnier the more you read it and the more you know the main character‚Äôs petty, egotistical, spirited character.   
Robert Evans‚Äô The Kid Stays In The Picture is genre-writing at its best. What genre? Action/Suspense!  Cliffhanger moments abound‚Äîall ginned-up by the masterful writer (ghost writer? editor?). It‚Äôs SO damn entertaining throughout and made me think about this kind of dynamic construction.
Bill Bryson‚Äôs At Home is an expansive tome detailing the history of his own house in England, an old rectory, and tells the story of houses and the ‚Äúinvention‚Äù of various rooms of a house.  Absolutely a delight to hang out in this easy-going, casual, lallygag through architecture and human proclivities, and the audiobook might be the best way to zone out since pot was invented‚Ä¶ and you‚Äôll end up smarter for it.
The Framley Examiner does this for me.  A compilation from a comedy website that features the pages of an imagined local newspaper in a small town in England (Framley). FUNNY FUNNY FUNNY.  On your worst day, with a sorrow in the pit of your stomach and worries collecting in a cloud over your head, cracking open this book will burst through all of that with a bright ray of sunshiney comic riffery and turn you into a gibbering, joyful, mess. Magic.
William Shakespeare‚Äôs First Folio.
I will choose, again, my current favorite FUNNY book, My Search For Warren Harding by Robert Plunket which has recipes within it!  One for potato salad.  And even the recipes are FUNNY!  So great.
Can I recommend my favorite Audiobooks? I, Partridge by Alan Partridge (Steve Coogan) is unfathomably PACKED with laughs to a density that astounds.  His very pronunciation is a deep delight. The Kid Stays In The Picture by Robert Evans (I‚Äôve listened to it twice!).  And, most recently, Maria Bamford‚Äôs Sure, I‚Äôll Join Your Cult kept me smiling for hours.
Come on, how could it be any place but Portland‚Äôs renowned POWELL‚ÄôS?!!  SO, SO many books, and place to hang out, and read them‚Ä¶ and then a great, cloudy day so you don‚Äôt have to feel bad about being inside, your nose in a book!

In August, Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and Sophie Gr√©goire Trudeau announced their split after nearly two decades together. During their marriage, Trudeau credited his wife, who accompanied him on official government engagements all over the world, with helping him to be a better feminist, world leader, and dad. On the heels of the separation, Gr√©goire Trudeau is taking a step back from politics‚Äîbut she has no plans to leave the public eye. Instead, she is focusing on her mental health advocacy, a new communications company, and the publication of her part-memoir. Below, an exclusive first excerpt of Gr√©goire Trudeau‚Äôs autobiography-meets-self-help-book Closer Together (Random House Canada, April 23, 2024), which reveals, in intimate detail for the first time, her struggles with an eating disorder, career as a television host, and rise to become de facto ‚Äúfirst lady‚Äù of Canada. 
Let‚Äôs start with a tiny confession. There‚Äôs this thing I do every time I find myself standing around somewhere: in a line at the supermarket when someone is taking forever to place their items on the conveyor belt at the checkout, or standing at a function, maybe, or waiting offstage before I‚Äôm announced to make a speech. I also noticed myself doing it while I was sitting at my desk for months writing this book (when I wasn‚Äôt occasionally doing jumping jacks to get the feeling back into my legs!). It‚Äôs subtle‚Äîif you looked at me, you wouldn‚Äôt even be able to tell, unless you were really observing closely, which I hope you were not! First, I root my feet deeper into the floor, which supports me. Then I try to find where my breath is in my body; I make it deeper and longer, and more spacious in my belly than in my chest. Next, I check if my shoulders are too close to my ears and release them. And last, whether I‚Äôm standing upright or sitting in front of the com¬≠puter, comes the pelvic tilt, where I push my hips a tiny bit forward and bring my tailbone down toward the floor. All of a sudden, I feel more grounded, solid, and calm.
I‚Äôve always been curious about how people inhabit their bodies. As a child, I could effortlessly pick up on facial expressions and cues, any quirks in posture or tone of voice or tics. Once back in the pri¬≠vacy of my bedroom, I would attempt to imitate their stances or movements (surprise, surprise‚Äîmy kids pick up on the same stuff!). Ever since I studied yoga in my thirties, and became an occasional teacher, I have had a natural, loving desire to adjust the skeletal posi¬≠tioning of human bodies around me. If you‚Äôve ever attended a yoga class and have given consent to hands-on adjustments, you‚Äôll know what I mean. A beautiful assist while you are sitting on your mat: the teacher takes both hands to roll your shoulders back and then elongate your neck by softly lifting up your head. Sometimes that‚Äôs all it takes to feel more relaxed, to bring out a sigh of relief. 
Did you maybe adjust your own body a tiny bit while reading this? 
There‚Äôs no question that I am deeply interested in physical align¬≠ment, which can offer hints as to mood, health, disease, personality, and energy. The way we walk, sit, or stand can reflect habits, a former injury, and our own fitness level. But I‚Äôm also fundamentally and passionately curious about another type of alignment: our unique emotional alignment. In fact, that‚Äôs why I decided to write this book. 
As a mental health, emotional literacy, and gender equality advo¬≠cate for the past two decades, I‚Äôve discovered more about human emotions than I ever thought I would. As much as we are thinking beings, we are feeling and sensing beings at our core. Whether we feel happy and hopeful or angry and fearful, we engage not only in a physical or facial expression but also in an emotional posture. Are we truly aware of this process and of how we hold ourselves from the inside? Do we observe, strengthen, and stretch the parts of ourselves, and our minds, that need it the most? 
Tell me: If you were to take a snapshot of your mental land¬≠scape, what would it look like? Whatever lights and shadows you can discern, whatever moods, emotions, and images, know that they are all part of you. Much of what you‚Äôve seen or felt was wired into what we call your ‚Äúprimitive brain‚Äù during childhood, through your relationship with your parent or caretaker. You carried this hard-wiring through your childhood and into your teenage years (whether rebellious or not), and through the emotional discoveries you made as you grew into your adult life. We tend to convince ourselves that we are unique‚Äîso very different from everyone else around us. But the truth of the matter is that the structure of our brains hasn‚Äôt changed in more than two hundred thousand years. Where we differ is in our programming, which is dependent on the care we received, the relationships we foster, and the experiences we live through. As therapist and author Vienna Pharaon explains in The Origins of You, ‚Äúunderstanding your origin wound and the long-standing pat¬≠terns it leads to will go a long way to addressing conflicts and behav¬≠iours that trouble you today.‚Äù If you‚Äôre doubting that your childhood experiences affect how you come into relationship with others and yourself, then, just like me, you‚Äôll be surprised by what you‚Äôll learn in this book. 
Twenty years ago, when I was a young radio and television host in Quebec‚Äîa newcomer in my field‚ÄîI decided to speak out about my struggles with an eating disorder. It wasn‚Äôt an easy deci¬≠sion. I was hesitant to show my vulnerability publicly and won¬≠dered if I would ever be hired again. No one spoke much about mental health back then, and especially not about eating disorders. But deep down, I felt like it was the right thing to do. I faced my fear and went ahead with it‚Äîand it became a turning point that has given my life direction.
Suffering is part of life. We don‚Äôt need to avoid or transcend it. Rather, we must develop wisdom, self-reliance, and resilience through and with our pain. In our search for happiness, we must uncover its roots, as we carry them with us into our mental state and, therefore, into whatever we do and whomever we come into relationship with. Yale psychology professor Laurie R. Santos, who has studied the science of happiness, found that many of us are working at and doing things that actually put a damper on our level of happy. ‚ÄúNatural selection isn‚Äôt into us being happy,‚Äù she said in a Time magazine interview, in which she discussed her own experience with burnout during the pandemic years. ‚ÄúIt would prefer we drove ourselves into the ground trying to survive, reproduce, and get the most resources. It‚Äôs not in it for joy.‚Äù 
Think about that for a minute: on a purely neurological level, our brains don‚Äôt care if we‚Äôre happy. We need to make that happen, and running ourselves ragged as we chase good grades, status, titles, eternal youth, and bliss isn‚Äôt going to do it. 
It actually takes courage and work to be happy. We must learn to live with integrity and coherence, staying true to our values and expressing our authentic self. In this way, we can take control over ourselves and our lives. As Dr. Santos says: ‚ÄúGetting out of our own way is the first step to happiness!‚Äù 
I‚Äôm still learning how to get out of my own way. Discovering more about the intricacies of my inner wiring and emotional pos¬≠ture, my childhood, the defense mechanisms I‚Äôve developed, my ongoing longing for safety, and so much more, has allowed me to better understand why I suffered from an eating disorder, how I could heal from it, and how to live with and accept the suffering that had led to it. And along the way, I‚Äôm transforming my life‚Äîand my brain‚Äîwith every step.

title: How Instagram‚Äôs Favorite Chef Molly Baz Turned Viral Fame Into a Namesake Brand
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
The cookbook author charts her modern-day career story, from YouTube to The New York Times best-seller list.
In ELLE.com‚Äôs monthly series Office Hours, we ask people in powerful positions to take us through their first jobs, worst jobs, and everything in between. This month, we spoke to Molly Baz, a pro chef and best-selling author who just released her new cookbook, More Is More. Baz first built a loyal following while working in Bon App√©tit‚Äôs test kitchen and appearing on its viral YouTube page, but after a reckoning at the magazine in 2020, she struck out on her own and has since churned out two cookbooks, a recipe club, a line of wines, and even a Crate & Barrel collection. Below, she shares what it was like to go from anonymous editor to mini celebrity and how she‚Äôs moved forward with a single mission in mind: teaching you how to be a better cook. 
My first job was waitressing at a barbecue restaurant in my hometown when I was about 16. I ate so much fucking cornbread in the year that I worked there. How have I not been able to figure out how to make a cornbread that‚Äôs as moist and tender and delicious as the one that was at that restaurant? I need to go on a journey to recreate it.  
In college, I was super passionate about languages and art history, so I did a study abroad program in Italy. I lived with a family instead of living in an American dorm, and that‚Äôs when I really became exposed to home cooking for the first time. I stayed with this woman named Graciela who was 75, 80 years old. She would go to the market every day and then cook something fabulous at night‚Äîfabulous in the very un-fabulous way Italians cook, which is so rustic, so simple, [with] so much olive oil. I took the opportunity to learn from her and wanted to know everything. I was like, ‚ÄúWhoa, wait, could you tell me what kind of carrots those are?‚Äù and she would always be like, ‚ÄúOh Molly, you‚Äôre so crazy.‚Äù That obsession around Italian food turned into a general obsession of needing to know how to cook everything. 
I was working in a restaurant where I ended up dating the sous-chef, and the environment started to become my whole life in a way that was pretty alienating. I just was so, so, so caught up in this family we had created, which was the most beautiful thing‚Äîbut it also felt like it didn‚Äôt exist in the real world. We were working together at a place where our hours were completely different from everyone else‚Äôs. It felt isolating, and I wanted to figure out how to integrate into the world a bit better. Working in restaurants is a really hard life and a really inconvenient life. The burnout was just literal exhaustion. I asked myself, ‚ÄúWhat path do I want to go down? Do I want to be the head chef, executive chef, owner of a restaurant someday?‚Äù When I couldn‚Äôt answer the question in the affirmative, because it didn‚Äôt feel like exactly the right fit for me lifestyle-wise, then I was like, it‚Äôs time to pivot.
How powerful collaboration is. I feel like all of us were better cooks in that environment, because we were bouncing ideas off each other and being sounding boards for all these other talented cooks. Being around like-minded creatives is so important for staying inspired and doing your best work. It‚Äôs a lot harder to do when you‚Äôre just a solo act, like I am now. It‚Äôs the thing I cherish the most about that time.
It started on the subway, because I would take the train to the World Trade Center [where the Bon App√©tit offices are located], and without fail, every morning, there would be someone on the train who was like, ‚ÄúOh my God, are you...?‚Äù Then I would sit and have a conversation with them. I remember being so out of sorts by it all. I cannot stress enough how strange it is to go from being anonymous to a known entity in the world. It‚Äôs something I think about a lot, and I frankly don‚Äôt know how I feel about it still. It‚Äôs amazing 90 percent of the time, and I get the most incredible feedback and love from random people, which most people never experience. Then there‚Äôs this 10 percent, which is knowing that you are never alone in the world. It‚Äôs such a strange feeling. There‚Äôs something so liberating about being anonymous and being able to just walk into a store and know that, unless you see a friend, no one has any idea who you are. Thankfully, I‚Äôm not like, Beyonc√©, so it‚Äôs not every day, but I never know if I‚Äôm being seen, watched, stared at, or recognized, because people don‚Äôt always vocalize it. As a result, I don‚Äôt really ever feel anonymous in the world. If you sit with that, it‚Äôs pretty wild.
It was a very particular moment for Bon App√©tit, for America at-large. What was best for Bon App√©tit and for me was for me to not be there anymore, frankly. For me to be constantly pitching ideas, that wasn‚Äôt the voice that needed to be heard in the room anymore. I was occupying a space that is so coveted; there are maybe five people in the test kitchen. For so many reasons, compounded with the fact that I had a book coming out, I was like, ‚ÄúThis is the right moment to leave, start a new chapter, open up a new spot in the test kitchen.‚Äù But I definitely didn‚Äôt have a huge game plan. I woke up a few days later and was like, ‚ÄúOh my God, wait, what am I doing all day long now? Where are my recipes living? How are people going to cook my food? I have to wait until my book comes out. That‚Äôs so long. Do I not develop a recipe until then? This is so strange. This is what I do all day.‚Äù That‚Äôs when I started my newsletter, because I had to fill my time and exercise my creative brain in the kitchen.
What‚Äôs most important to me is that I teach people how to cook‚Äînot that I make food that looks yummy that no one ever makes or that people know I know how to cook. I want you to know how to cook. I want to make sure that when I leave this Earth, I‚Äôve impacted many, many, many human beings for the better and have allowed them to find comfort and joy in the kitchen and in the process of putting a meal on the table. When I started thinking about building my brand once I left my job at Bon App√©tit, the first thing that popped into my head was: I feel like I‚Äôm a teacher, and everyone is a student. And the primary colors are the first thing you learn in kindergarten. It‚Äôs blocks and graphic shapes and primary colors. It was never even a question. I was like, ‚ÄúThat will be what we build this brand on.‚Äù
The first book [Cook This Book] was all about teaching good technique and delivering a great education on how to build flavor and create balance in your food. To me, those are the fundamentals. This book is about learning to harness your own power in the kitchen and cooking with intuition, not timidity. Cook like a professional cooks in their home kitchen‚Äîthrowing stuff in and taking control. It‚Äôs about coaxing flavor from whatever ingredients you‚Äôre using and learning to use certain ingredients in multiple ways to layer flavor. If we‚Äôre saut√©ing onions at the base of a stew, then maybe we‚Äôre setting some aside beforehand and quick-pickling them. That‚Äôs a great way to maximize flavor while maintaining a small ingredient list. It‚Äôs a bit more of a no-holds-barred approach to cooking, a little less calculated. My hope is that the many, many people who cooked all the way through Cook This Book feel like they‚Äôre ready for the 2.0.
This interview has been edited and condensed for clarity.

title: 7 Key Takeaways from Julia Fox‚Äôs Memoir Down the Drain
text:
Her highly-publicized relationship and brief stint as a dominatrix are, somehow, not the most scandalous parts.
Major spoilers for Down the Drain below.
When Julia Fox was interviewed by Variety last year, she referred to her upcoming book as ‚Äúa masterpiece.‚Äù And now it‚Äôs finally here. Down the Drain, released on October 10, covers a lot of ground. Though Fox is only 33, she‚Äôs lived a life. The memoir clocks in at just over 300 pages and charts Fox‚Äôs rise from her Italian origins to the streets of New York City where she would become an It Girl (and Josh Safdie‚Äôs muse). As she tells it, drugs were involved. So was sex work. Brief stints in the hospital and psych ward are chronicled, too. And her highly-publicized relationship with Kanye West is given some much-needed context. 
Though her star power has quickly risen in the last few years, she makes note that she doesn‚Äôt consider herself a celebrity. As she writes in the book‚Äôs final pages, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm an artist in the role of a lifetime, playing Me.‚Äù
Below are some of the book‚Äôs most memorable moments. 
Fox was born in Italy and later moved to New York City with her dad while her mom, brother, and grandfather stayed in Europe. The move to America came with financial strife and she says that her family relied on a small pension to get by, sometimes having to resort to drastic measures to make ends meet. Fox recalls that when they ran out of candy at home, she would drink cough syrup instead. She adds: ‚ÄúAt night, I lie in bed and cry. I muffle the noise with my stuffed animals because I don‚Äôt want him to wake up. I‚Äôm trying my hardest to be a big girl, but I really miss my mom and my brother. And I especially miss the comfort of my grandpa.‚Äù 
When she was 11, Fox started smoking weed. When writing about the first time she got high, she recalls the ‚Äúwarm and fuzzy‚Äù feeling that it brought her. But she didn‚Äôt stop at marijuana. Referring to it as her ‚Äúgateway drug,‚Äù she would then go on to experiment with ecstasy, angel dust, Xanax, acid, heroin, and cocaine. She also writes about her overdoses. Fox first landed in the hospital due to drugs in high school when she smoked angel dust. When she begins using heroin shortly after, her overdoses started to happen more frequently. She writes about three heroin-induced instances in the book (one of which occurred on her  20th birthday).
One of the most impactful relationships that Fox writes about is with a man named Ace. When she meets him at a friend‚Äôs apartment, they fall in love fast. They even get each other‚Äôs named tattooed. But Ace is a drug dealer and gets arrested. While in jail at Rikers Island, he becomes obsessed with her and calls constantly. He later hires men to follow her around New York City in order to keep tabs. Things got so bad, she writes, that she slits her wrists and threatens to kill herself if he doesn‚Äôt leave her alone. This eventually lands her in a psych ward.
After Fox gets arrested at a nightclub for being caught with two fake IDs, one of the requirements of her probation is that she gets a job. A listing that catches her eye on Craigslist is an ad that reads: ‚ÄúDominatrix dungeon hiring.‚Äù Once she‚Äôs hired, she goes by the name Valentina. In great detail, she describes her various clients and the acts she performs with each in the dungeon. Her first experience involves a pack of Marlboro Lights and a client nicknamed ‚ÄúSmoking Stewart‚Äù who is fully naked aside from a black rubber mask on his face. ‚ÄúI watch in stunned silence as he attaches a rubber tube to the mask‚Äôs mouthpiece and explains in a distorted voice that I am to chain-smoke the cigarettes and blow the smoke through the tube, which will be in his mouth,‚Äù she writes.
One day, she gets notified that she has an ‚Äúoutcall‚Äù and has to travel to a man‚Äôs house. This client eventually becomes her sugar daddy who gives her the world: a Soho loft, a red Mercedes, a Birkin, and an investment in a fashion line that she has with a friend.
Fox writes that as a teen, she was diagnosed with Borderline Personality Disorder and was prescribed lithium and Seroquel. Later, she suspects that she is also bipolar but she doesn‚Äôt receive an official diagnosis. In one scene, she explains her symptoms to a doctor. ‚ÄúHe listens closely as I describe the excruciating level of self-awareness that plagues me,‚Äù she writes. ‚ÄúI admit how I dread going to bed at the end of the day, fearful of what mood will greet me the next morning. I can usually tell within the first few seconds of opening my eyes what my day is going to be like, and I‚Äôm completely powerless to it. It‚Äôs paralyzing and it‚Äôs only getting worse.‚Äù  
In 2019, Fox became Josh Safdie‚Äôs muse in Uncut Gems. In the book, she talks about how she got the part (Safdie wrote it specifically with her in mind) and even details some of what went down on set, which includes doing drugs. She writes that the night before the first shoot day, she got sick from some ‚Äúbad pills.‚Äù But luckily for her, the scene she needed to film is one where her character had been out all night. Safdie calls her lack of sleep ‚Äúmethod acting.‚Äù On another occasion, ahead of a scene where she has to wear lingerie in front of Adam Sandler, she sniffed ‚Äúa whole bunch of Roxy‚Äôs right before.‚Äù
Though she never mentions Kanye West by name, and only refers to him as ‚Äúthe artist,‚Äù all the clues are there. Fox details the first time she met him when he flew her and her friends out to Miami for New Year‚Äôs. She writes about all of the things they do while together: go out to parties, play a dictionary game that involves highlighting all of the positive words, pose for a photo shoot that would later land in Interview Magazine, and give her entire wardrobe a massive overhaul. He tells her that he wants to appoint a team to style her and then hires two of her friends to dress her. ‚ÄúI immediately think of an episode of Keeping Up with the Kardashians, where he did the same thing for his ex-wife in their early stages of dating,‚Äù she writes. ‚ÄúThis all feels so surreal. I can‚Äôt believe this is my life.‚Äù
She even writes about a moment when they go to the theater to see Jeremy O. Harris‚Äôs Slave Play. Once the show is over, and before they head out to dinner, Fox receives a text from her friend to meet her in the bathroom, where she finds a slew of clothes and different outfit options organized by West. She writes: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm happy to see her but it‚Äôs a little strange he didn‚Äôt just tell me he didn‚Äôt like my original outfit. Without protest, I slip into the garments. The artist is left speechless as I step out of the bathroom, effortlessly transitioning into my new role as the ultimate fashion girlie. His photographer snaps photos of me all night long at the artist‚Äôs encouragement. A part of me kind of feels like a show monkey, but I‚Äôve been performing my whole life, so what‚Äôs the big deal?‚Äù
On their second night together, while at dinner at Carbone, West asked her to be his girlfriend. But Fox instantly shut it down, claiming that it‚Äôs way too early to take their relationship public. He responds by saying that if she‚Äôs worried about him embarrassing her, he wouldn‚Äôt. He credits this to the fact that she has a son and his own mother was a single parent. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs odd, I think to myself,‚Äù she writes. ‚ÄúWould he offer me the same courtesy if I had a daughter?‚Äù 
As Fox goes on to describe their relationship, much of it reads as odd and awkward. She writes that she felt ‚Äúvulnerable and exposed‚Äù by the public attention and refers to West as a ‚Äúmaster gaslighter.‚Äù
Fox writes that the last time they talked on the phone, West told her he had a ‚Äúgood conversation‚Äù with his soon-to-be-ex-wife (Kim Kardashian) where they discussed her past. He claims he had no idea Fox was a drug addict (although she writes that she did tell him, he just wasn‚Äôt listening). He then chastises her for embarrassing him. Later, she finds out that a million-dollar deal with an Italian denim brand (that West orchestrated) has fallen through.  ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs contingent on you being his girlfriend,‚Äù she was told. Some time after their breakup, West then tries to get her to sign an NDA, telling her that he can‚Äôt be friends with her unless she signs, and she refuses.

title: All About Charlie Gooch, Florence Pugh‚Äôs Ex-Boyfriend
text:
Following her breakup from Zach Braff, Florence Pugh sparked rumors that she may involved with a London boy when she and Charlie Gooch were photographed showing affection on Valentine‚Äôs Day 2023. Photographers noted they were also wearing matching rings. Pugh didn‚Äôt commented on Gooch or their relationship status, but they followed each other on Instagram while dating and still follow each other. The Sun reported on their breakup in October 2023, saying that they were privately together for over six months.
Here‚Äôs what to know about Gooch and his time as the rumored leading man in Pugh‚Äôs life.
Gooch, who goes by Guy Gooch professionally, described himself simply on his photography site as a ‚Äúphotographer and filmmaker living and working in South London.‚Äù His website and Instagram showcase his work, and he keeps his online presence minimal beyond his photography.
At that point, Pugh was still dating Zach Braff.
Gooch shared multiple photos of Pugh on his Instagram in June 2021 during her Black Widow press tour, suggesting their friendship started years back. 
‚ÄúShot Florence Pugh as part of her upcoming film Black Widow! Super excited to be part of this journey :),‚Äù he captioned his first shot that Pugh liked on June 3, 2021.
‚ÄúSome more shots of the wonderful Florence Pugh, ready for @jimmykimmellive. An amazing experience with an amazing team!‚Äù he wrote on the second one, posted June 5, 2021.
And on his third shot, shared on June 28, 2021, he wrote, ‚ÄúExcited to share my new moving image with Florence! So great to be able to make this with her and be part of this journey. Everything came together with a wonderful team.‚Äù
Page Six noted that Pugh and Gooch were first seen together in December 2022, partying after she attended the British Fashion Awards. Daily Mail ran photos of them leaving her hotel the morning after, describing Gooch in the headline as the ‚Äúfriend‚Äù she left with.
The two were seen holding hands on Valentine's Day 2023 (see another photo from that outing above), and the photo agency noted they were wearing matching bands on their ring fingers. Neither commented on the relationship speculation. Pugh did mention she recently got a place in South London, where Gooch also lives, during a January 2023 interview with Vogue.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs all very new,‚Äù she said, referring to her breakup with Zach Braff, which she announced in August 2022. ‚ÄúMy breakup has been very new, so I‚Äôm figuring that out [whether I'll get my own place in Los Angeles, too].‚Äù
Pugh chose South London because several of her secondary school friends live there. ‚ÄúYou know, you have a daydream when you start out: What is it that means you‚Äôve made it? What is it that means you are an adult? And for me it was: You live close to your friends and you have a local pub,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúAnd because I didn‚Äôt do that when I was young, because I didn‚Äôt go to university, it meant that for all of my adult years of working and my adult years living abroad, I still, in my mind, hadn‚Äôt got all the pieces together.‚Äù
A source told the outlet, ‚ÄúFlorence and Charlie had known each other for years and things turned romantic at the end of last year. But it hasn‚Äôt lasted. Florence‚Äôs schedule is so busy and there were other factors at play. She eventually ended it over the summer. She isn‚Äôt wallowing though and is doing just fine on her own. There are no hard feelings between them though. She has told friends she‚Äôs single but they wouldn‚Äôt be surprised if Florence changed her mind after some time apart.‚Äù

title: All About Michael Polansky, Lady Gaga‚Äôs Tech Entrepreneur Boyfriend of 2+ Years
text:
She's off the deep end, watch as we dive in. In February 2020, Lady Gaga was spotted cozying up to investor Michael Polansky ahead of her pre-Super Bowl performance.  Page Six ran photos of the pair kissing on a balcony in Miami. Polansky was also on hand during Gaga's Saturday night show and by her side during Super Bowl LIV, per Entertainment Tonight. Now, they're IG official, attended the 2021 inauguration as a couple, and may even be going strong in 2023. Below, everything we know about the musician's man of about three years.
The Daily Mail pondered whether Gaga and Polansky could be reconciling in August after breakup rumors broke in spring 2023. They were photographed grabbing dinner in Studio City on August 13. Gaga dressed up in a black miniskirt and leather jacket for the outing, with her blonde hair up. Neither has explicitly commented on the relationship status recently, but they hadn't been seen together in months. Daily Mail identified Polansky as an ‚Äúex-boyfriend‚Äù in its piece.
Gaga and Polansky seemed to signal the breakup rumors were no longer true in early October. The couple was seen out twice in one weekend in Las Vegas. Gaga and Polansky went to watch Katy Perry‚Äôs Vegas residency show on Friday, October 6, then U2‚Äôs performance on Saturday. Fan photos and footage of them emerged at both shows on social media.
Polansky, a Harvard graduate, runs Facebook co-founder Sean Parker's Institute for Cancer Immunotherapy. According to his LinkedIn, Polansky has served as CEO for The Parker Group, which houses the mogul's various charities and businesses, for the last decade. 
He's clearly steeped in Parker's dealings, as his LinkedIn also shows he's the co-founder/executive director of The Parker Foundation and a managing partner in Parker Ventures. According to the Institute for Cancer Immunotherapy website, Polansky also serves on the six-person board tasked with breaking down barriers against cancer research.
Earlier in his career, Polansky worked at Founders Fund alongside Parker and Peter Thiel (both characters in the 2010 Oscar-nominated movie The Social Network). In 2013, he co-founded the bipartisan policy organization Economic Innovation Group (EIG), which also involves Parker. Interestingly enough, Justin Timberlake played Parker in 2010's The Social Network, and Gaga was the musical guest on Timberlake's May 2011 SNL episode.
Before spending Super Bowl weekend together, Gaga was seen kissing Polansky in Las Vegas on New Year's Eve. Clearly, things are getting serious as he was spotted hanging out with Gaga's family over Super Bowl weekend. Polansky reportedly spoke with Gaga's mother Cynthia Germanotta during her daughter's performance and danced alongside Gaga and her sister Natali during Jennifer Lopez and Shakira's halftime show.
Halftime dance w Ga Ga #SuperBowl pic.twitter.com/LxftKZIFEj
News of their relationship comes about a year after Gaga ended her engagement to talent agent Christian Carino in February 2019.  (Coincidentally Bradley Cooper, who Gaga was previously rumored to be involved with, had a friendly reunion with his ex Irina Shayk on the same weekend.)
Per Page Six sources, Gaga and Polansky have "likely known each other for a while through events Parker has hosted at his LA mansion." The insider claims the couple connected at Parker's December 2019 birthday party.
In fact, Cooper says he met Gaga in April 2016 when she performed at the opening of the Parker Institute for Cancer Immunotherapy at Parker's home. While there, she sang  √âdith Piaf's "La Vie en Rose," which inspired Cooper to cast Gaga in her Oscar-nominated role from A Star Is Born. 
"I was at a cancer benefit with my mother. I really did not know Lady Gaga‚Äôs music," Cooper told W magazine. "They had a surprise musical guest, and Stefani came out with her hair slicked back." 
‚ÄúMichael is a really smart guy, a very serious guy, who has always been low key," a source told Page Six about the CEO and investor. title: All About Marcus Mumford, Carey Mulligan‚Äôs Husband
text:
On April 10, two weeks ahead of the 2021 Oscars, Promising Young Woman nominee Carey Mulligan hosted Saturday Night Live, and Mulligan‚Äôs husband, Marcus Mumford, joined her (sort of). 
During her monologue, Mulligan mentioned that Mumford was at home with their kids, but then‚Äîwait a second‚ÄîMumford popped up in the back of the audience. ‚ÄúVery excited to be here because my husband was actually musical guest three times, Marcus Mumford, from the band Mumford & Sons,‚Äù Mulligan said. ‚ÄúOr, as I like to call it, ‚Äòmy husband and sons.‚Äô But he couldn‚Äôt be here tonight, so he‚Äôs at home watching the children. ‚ÄòHi, babe, love you,‚Äô‚Äù she added, waving. 
‚ÄúLove you, too! Hi, Carey,‚Äù Mumford, who popped up in the back of the audience yelled to his wife. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs me, Marcus Mumford, from the band Mumford & Sons,‚Äù he said, adding that he left the kids ‚Äúwith the Sons.‚Äù
As part of the bit, he offered to jump in as musical guest, but when his wife informed him that there was already a musical guest (Kid Cudi), he still couldn‚Äôt help but pull out his guitar. He finally joined her onstage and played her out when she said the famous SNL-host line: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve got a great show tonight!‚Äù
If you‚Äôve been a fan of English folk rock band Mumford & Sons since their early days, you probably know of their lead singer,  Mumford. But not everyone was singing ‚ÄúLittle Lion Man‚Äù at the top of their lungs in 2010 or spent way too much money on tickets to their ‚ÄúGentlemen of the Road‚Äù tour  in 2013. 
You might have, instead, been more of a fan of Mulligan, whose filmography goes back to 2005, when she appeared as Kitty Bennet alongside Kiera Knightley in Pride & Prejudice. Mulligan was nominated for a 2021 Golden Globe for Best Performance by an Actress in a Motion Picture, Drama for her role as Cassandra in rape-revenge film A Promising Young Woman. 
Mulligan and Mumford have a long history. They got engaged in 2011 and were married on a Somerset farm in April 2012. Colin Firth, Sienna Miller, and Jake Gyllenhaal were among the guests at the wedding. Vogue UK reported that Firth gave a ‚Äútouching speech,‚Äú and Adele performed at the reception. Mulligan wore a Prada dress.
A few details about their wedding have come out, along with the couple. Get to know Mumford beyond his music and his love story with Mulligan.
Mumford, 36, was born Marcus Oliver Johnstone Mumford on January 31, 1987 to English parents, John and Eleanor, in Yorba Linda, California.  They moved back to England when Mumford was a baby, and he grew up in Wimbledon Chase, southwest London and went to King's College School in Wimbledon, where he met his fellow band member Ben Lovett. 
John and Eleanor were leaders in the Vineyard Churches in the U.K. and Ireland for more than 20 years. This was an influence that traces back to Mumford's grandparents. 
"I grew up in a Christian home," John told the Vineyard Church website. "My father had become a Christian when he was at Cambridge in the 1920s. Both my parents loved the lord and served in a local church. It‚Äôs where I grew up. I served with them as we went every Sunday as a family. We prayed together, read the Bible together, and that was entirely natural. It just never occurred to me to do anything else. It wasn't a chore; it was a wonderful heritage."
You can hear Christian references in Mumford's early music, especially. But the band has never taken on the identity as "Christian music." Mumford told Rolling Stone in March of last year: "It felt like early on, people wanted to put you in a box: 'You're a Christian band.' It certainly isn't as simple as that."
As Bustle noted, Mulligan and Mumford reportedly went to the same church camp when they were pre-teens and were pen pals after that. Neither has been public about this story, but it's been widely reported as the way they initially met. Bustle also writes that Mumford's parents officiated his and Mulligan's wedding in 2012. 
Mumford went to school in Edinburgh, but he dropped out at about age 20 and moved to London to pursue his music career. It was there where he got work as a drummer for British folk singer-songwriter Laura Marling, who wasn't quite a name yet herself. Rolling Stone reported that while Mumford was a student in Scotland, he traveled to London on the weekends to "play with Marling, Noah and the Whale, Adele and more."
During that time, he told Rolling Stone, he wanted to be more than a drummer. "You're kind of nervous that you might get the guitar passed to you," he said. "But you also kind of want it to happen. It was constantly that cross between adrenaline and fear. And I still live there."
The Guardian reported in 2012, around the release of Mumford & Son's Grammy Award-winning album, Babel, that when Marling was away doing interviews one day, Mumford wrote "White Blank Page," one of the big tracks on the first Mumford & Sons studio album, Sigh No More (2009).
After blowing up as a band (especially with the popularity of Sigh No More and Babel), they met some criticism from people in England. 
 "England's just very cynical. Like I am. Like we all are," banjo player Winston Marshall told The Guardian. "I think we're all guilty of it as British citizens," says Mumford, "if something gets big we go. . .ugh."
He added: "We get accused of inauthenticity because we play the instruments we play." Their success speaks for itself. 
As The Guardian noted in the profile, Mumford is private about anything other than his professional relationship with Marling, but they did have a romantic relationship that the publication said ended  from some point after [Marling's 2008 album] Alas I Cannot Swim was finished until about 2010. 
In December 2012, when Mumford was 25 years old, he was listed on the 30 Under 30 Music list alongside Adele, One Direction, Taylor Swift, Mac Miller, Wiz Khalifa, Justin Bieber, Avicii, Frank Ocean, Bruno Mars, Katy Perry, and Rihanna. 
"Folksy frontman and his indie rock act, Mumford & Sons, shocked the world by selling over 600,000 copies of their new album, Babel, in its opening week‚Äîthe second-best debut of the year," Forbes wrote. 
The Coen brothers film, Inside Llewyn Davis, starring Mulligan, Oscar Isaac, Justin Timberlake, Adam Driver, and more, features music from Mumford. He and Timberlake worked on the soundtrack together. 
"I did work with Marcus Mumford on the soundtrack, so I became very good friends with them," he said at the time. "Marcus and myself we all kind of worked on the music together and I don‚Äôt know any other world where we would have the opportunity to collaborate like that but it was so much fun. So not only will that be a great movie, but the music to it will be fantastic."
"There's a really beautiful background vocal on 'Cowboy Like Me' sung by someone I‚Äôm a big fan of," Swift hinted during her "Willow" live chat ahead of the album release. 
Her fans, ever the detectives, figured it out pretty quickly:

Everyone has their quarantine hobby. Maybe this is his?
Mulligan welcomed her third child with Mumford in the summer of 2023. The couple already share seven-year-old Evelyn and five-year-old Wilfred. title: How This Month‚Äôs ‚ÄòRing of Fire‚Äô Eclipse Will Affect Your Horoscope
text:
No need to watch a Johnny Cash rockumentary if you want to catch a ‚Äúburning ring of fire‚Äù this fall. Just grab your eclipse glasses and head west of the Rockies. On October 14, the year‚Äôs only Libra new moon is also an annular solar eclipse‚Äîi.e. a ‚Äúring of fire‚Äù eclipse. And yes, it will be visible in several states, including Oregon, Nevada, New Mexico, and Utah.
Unlike a total solar eclipse, where the moon appears so large that it blocks out the entire sun and darkens the skies, during an annular solar eclipse, the size of the moon is smaller than the sun from our vantage point down here on Earth. When the eclipse reaches totality, the glowing edges of the sun peek out around the silhouette of the moon, giving the appearance of‚Äîyou guessed it‚Äîa ring of fire.
Though the cosmic event is exciting on its own, astrology takes it one level deeper. This is also the very first eclipse to land in the sign of Libra since March 23, 2016. Libra is the sign of balance, peace, beauty, and harmonious relationships. All good things, we‚Äôd say! 
Trouble is, eclipses aren‚Äôt exactly cakewalks. Solar eclipses, which always arrive with new moons, can be a bit like power outages. For a short period of time, they leave us groping around in the dark, forcing us to go inward to find solutions from a purely intuitive place.
When the Libra solar eclipse hits this Oct. 14, 2023, at 2 P.M. ET, our closest connections could get a shake-up. So, too, might the institution of marriage or gender equality, which fair-minded Libra rules. Will the backwards #tradwife trend go down in flames? It‚Äôs possible, especially since there are two more Libra eclipses on deck: March 25 and Oct. 2, 2024.
But we might have to wait until this October‚Äôs second eclipse is over. On the 28th, the final lunar eclipse in tradition-loving Taurus rounds out a series that began back on Nov. 19, 2021.
Lunar eclipses, which always arrive with full moons, shine a spotlight on the shadowy issues we wish we didn‚Äôt have to deal with. There‚Äôs a reason lunar eclipses have earned their title as ‚Äúblood moons,‚Äù and it isn‚Äôt just because the Earth‚Äôs rusty red shadow appears across the moon‚Äôs surface. Conflicts heat up during lunar eclipses, forcing us to go to the mat for our beliefs.
For the past two years, we‚Äôve been under the moralizing thumb of these Taurus lunar eclipses. We‚Äôve seen right-wing and religious zealots sign restrictive rules into law. People have become polarized due to their ethics (Taurus‚Äô domain), with some loudly crying for a return to values that only served a slim minority of the population.
Tides may be pulled by the new and full moons, but during eclipse season, they can also be turned. Here‚Äôs hoping they move in a direction that‚Äôs fair and favorable for all. To find out how these eclipses will affect your sign, read your monthly horoscope‚Äîwe wrote all about it for you.

title: See the Killers of the Flower Moon Wardrobe on Full Display in an Exclusive New Clip
text:
Costume designer Jacqueline West and Osage consultant Julie O‚ÄôKeefe walk us through the clothing in Martin Scorsese‚Äôs new film. 
Killers of the Flower Moon is undoubtedly the most anticipated film of the fall. The Martin Scorsese crime saga stars Leonardo DiCaprio opposite breakout Native American actress Lily Gladstone (Blackfeet/Nim√≠ipuu) in a retelling of the mysterious 1920s murders of the Osage people over their oil-rich Oklahoma land. The renowned filmmaker enlisted tribal consultants to ensure he was accurately depicting the tragedy, and the movie is rightly being heralded as one of the first feature films to honestly show Indigenous genocide and erasure in the United States.
To capture that accurate portrayal, all aspects of the film‚Äîfrom the acting and mannerisms to the production design‚Äîhad to hit the mark. For the costumes, Scorsese tapped longtime collaborator Jacqueline West, whose r√©sum√© includes Dune, The Revenant, The Curious Case of Benjamin Button, and more. She dove headfirst into the research to better understand the Osage people‚Äôs unique clothing during that era, as they became the richest people per capita in the world thanks to their reservation‚Äôs natural resources. That newfound knowledge helped West curate culturally appropriate period attire, including power-suit blankets and military-inspired wedding coats. But she wasn‚Äôt alone in this endeavor.
Among the film‚Äôs many Osage contributors was clothing consultant Julie O‚ÄôKeefe, who West jokingly calls her ‚Äúsecret weapon.‚Äù After their painstaking work together, the two have a clear reverence for one another and such a strong rapport that they finish each other‚Äôs sentences. A glimpse of their efforts is on display in a new clip from the film, debuting exclusively on ELLE.com, where Gladstone‚Äôs Mollie gossips with her family, dressed in a mix of traditional and modern fashions, including Osage shawls, tribal jewelry, and French hats.
Here, West and O‚ÄôKeefe talk with ELLE.com about the costumes inKillers of the Flower Moon, which hits theaters worldwide on October 20. (Warning: Spoilers ahead.)
Jacqueline West: I did a lot of my research at the Carnegie Library in Deadwood, South Dakota, which is this huge library on Sioux soil. Andrew Carnegie was a great student of Native American cultures, so there happened to be a lot of information about the Osage people, who you don‚Äôt learn about in school because the American school system wouldn‚Äôt talk about a travesty of this nature.
Marianne Bower, who is a producer on the film and does a lot of Marty‚Äôs research, explained that there were a lot of home movies available. My husband, who is one-quarter Blackfeet and a journalist, helped me find them. The Osage people could afford to make home movies when nobody else could, at $800 a minute, which really revealed their riches at the time. After Native Americans had been deprived of everything, the Osage people suddenly had the wherewithal to buy better, more expensive things than most white people in the United States. It made what happened to them‚Äîbeing given this wealth then having it robbed from them by taking their lives‚Äîall the more poignant.
And of course, I did a lot of reading. Beyond the David Grann book that the film is based on, I read Linda Hogan‚Äôs Mean Spirit, Charles Red Corn‚Äôs A Pipe for February, and many others. From working on the movie The New World, I realized that you often can learn more about how people dressed by reading about their lives rather than looking at pictures, because pictures limit you. When you read, your imagination takes off.
Julie O‚ÄôKeefe: When I first walked into Jacqui‚Äôs studio, she had hundreds of pictures all organized into categories, like Osage people dressed in traditional clothing, in modern clothing, in modern clothing with a blanket, and more. I had seen a lot of these photographs before, but I was struck by this picture of Lizzie Q [one of the Osage murder victims] and her daughters.
Because we are Plains Indians, we hunted for everything. Currency wasn‚Äôt part of our value system; it was really about survival, which is how Lizzie Q and her husband grew up. Then they had these three daughters who were mandated by the government to be sent to missionary schools, so they became the first English-speaking children in this Native American family. It‚Äôs similar to the immigrant experience, except it‚Äôs happening on your own land.
These girls now have this education and a lot of money dropped on top of that, and they‚Äôre grappling with how they fit into this world. When you look at the costumes, you see the mother in traditional clothing. You see Anna Brown, the oldest daughter, who is completely modern and dressing in the latest Parisian fashions. You see Mollie, who is acclimating by wearing a pair of French shoes or carrying a beautiful handbag but who is putting her Osage roots out there for everyone to see. You see Minnie and Rita, who are in modern clothing but still showing their culture with a blanket or shawl.
In presenting themselves to the world, these women are trying to find ways to fit in and stay safe. When you look at it that way, what you actually see in the costumes is the struggle of Native Americans to find their place, which is exactly how the story launches into these guardians, these killings, and all of these heinous things that happened.
West: That was all Julie. Everyone trusts her, because she has worked with a lot of these artists in the past to create items for museum installations. That‚Äôs why Chief Standing Bear recommended her to us to represent the Osage Nation. It made Marty feel confident that we were doing it right, because he‚Äôs all about authenticity and respect. He really wanted to do the story justice, but more than that, he wanted to do the Osage Nation justice. Julie knew all the best silversmiths, ribbon workers, finger weavers, and jewelry makers to bring in. I have to give some shoutouts to our silversmith Kugee Supernaw, our ribbon workers Anita Fields, Maria Lookout, and Janet Emde, as well as Jennifer Tiger, Sean Standing Bear, and Moira RedCorn.
O‚ÄôKeefe: What we were really doing was pulling in the community to be a part of this epic film, because that‚Äôs all Martin Scorsese makes. Production took place during the pandemic and we had all these COVID restrictions, so I arranged a trunk show where people drove up to this airplane hangar and opened up the trunk of their car to show us things as we stood up on this platform.
As Osage, we keep our family heirlooms in a cedar chest in a particular way. People had gone through their heirlooms and brought us original 1920s shawls, blankets, suits, photographs, and more so that we could see authentic items from the time period. We had this line of cars that must have been a mile long. It really made this epic film feel like a community project; it was just so moving.
West: I actually got tears in my eyes when I saw Cecilia Tallchief, the cousin of the ballerina Maria Tallchief. Here is this tribal elder in her eighties who came to share her belongings with us. People actually loaned their family heirlooms to us, and some of them were even worn in the movie. We were so careful with them, because this was a huge film with thousands of costumes in a warehouse the size of a football field.
West: It meant everything to me. I‚Äôm from Berkeley, California, and my parents instilled an activist spirit in me. My heart was marching in 1973 at Wounded Knee. If I hadn‚Äôt pursued this career, I would have gotten a law degree to help fight for Native American rights. Knowing Marty‚Äôs work, I knew the film would be accurate. When I heard he hired [production designer] Jack Fisk, who I‚Äôve done nine movies with, I knew the sets would be perfect and I would have to live up to that with the costumes.
I hadn‚Äôt worked with a consultant before, so I wasn‚Äôt sure what to expect when we brought on Julie. But she was so collaborative and supportive from the get-go, and she really made me feel I was on the right track. Plus, she was so important to Lily‚Äôs performance, because there‚Äôs a subtlety in how things are done as part of these cultural traditions. She gave Lily the confidence that what she was wearing and how she approached certain circumstances was right for her character.
O‚ÄôKeefe: What Lily wore in the film depended on what life event was going on. For example, if you‚Äôre around your house, you‚Äôre going to wear a shawl a certain way. I remember Lily had this particular scene where her mother was dying, and one way we take care of someone as they‚Äôre dying is to comb their hair. Lily walked in after rehearsal that day, and I could tell she was frustrated. She was wearing this 1920s black shawl with all this long crisscross fringe, and she told me, ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know how I‚Äôm going to comb her hair with this on.‚Äù We talked through what was trying to do with her hands, then I went back to the production team and explained that she needed to put the shawl under her arm and flip it back so that she has use of both her arms. That‚Äôs what we did every day‚Äîgo over how Lily would be acting and what her motions would be.
As an Osage person working on this film, it was really an incredible honor. This tragic period is something that‚Äôs very difficult for us to talk about, but I was able to work with some of the very best people in the industry and witness firsthand their level of professionalism in authentically telling this story about our history. It instilled such a deep sense of pride and humility in me to be part of this historic movie that has changed how Native Americans are included in our own stories‚Äîsomething we‚Äôve been waiting for for a long time.
This interview has been edited and condensed.

title: Natalia Bryant on Growth, Self-Care, and the Importance of Routine
text:
Natalia Bryant is taking things one step at a time. As the face of UGG‚Äôs new ‚ÄúFeels Like UGG‚Äù campaign‚Äîwhich is all about self-reflection and self-love‚Äîthe 20-year-old USC student and model says life is ‚Äúall about appreciating the growth and lessons that have gotten you to where you are and embracing your best self.‚Äù  Below, she talks exclusively with ELLE.com about the campaign, navigating difficult moments, and continuing her father‚Äôs legacy. 
‚ÄúI‚Äôve always loved UGG as a brand. I‚Äôm obsessed with their shoes, because they‚Äôre the perfect mix of comfort and style. You don‚Äôt need to sacrifice looking good to feel comfortable, because their designs are so cute.‚Äù
‚ÄúMamba mentality is about constantly trying to be the best version of yourself. It‚Äôs putting your best foot forward at all times regardless of all the noise. I want to make sure that mentality stays intact, because it can be so easy to give up on yourself when things get tough. You have to remind yourself that with positivity and resilience you can do anything.‚Äù
‚ÄúI bring myself out of tough times by focusing my energy on the things that bring me happiness. I spend time with the people I love, like my family. I hang out with my friends, or listen to my favorite music. I do things that bring me peace and that put me in a much better headspace. I think it‚Äôs important to focus on the positive aspects life has to offer.‚Äù
‚ÄúI practice self-care in lots of ways. I like to work out, read, and watch my favorite comfort movies. Really anything that lets me relax and wind down is self-care to me.‚Äù
‚ÄúI always start the day off by making my bed. It‚Äôs such a small thing, but it really sets the tone for the rest of the day. Then, I do my skin care routine and eat breakfast before tackling the day ahead.‚Äù
‚ÄúMy family is my rock. My mom and my sisters are amazing, and I can always lean on them for support. I also have amazing friends and mentors that I love who I know I can count on.‚Äù
‚ÄúBe yourself always. You feel the best when you stay true to yourself and what you believe in, so express yourself the way you want to, regardless of what others may think.‚Äù
‚ÄúI love to express myself through fashion. Everyone has their own unique style, and I love to put my own twists on my looks that speak to my personality. Whether it be with clothes, shoes, or accessories, I think fashion makes a statement about your confidence and sense of individuality.‚Äù
‚ÄúTo me, self-reflection really means taking a step back and looking at how far you‚Äôve come. It‚Äôs about appreciating the growth and lessons that have gotten you to where you are and embracing your best self.‚Äù

title: Bradley Cooper and Irina Shayk‚Äôs Relationship Timeline, From Private Romance to Co-Parenting
text:
Bradley Cooper has always managed to stay relatively tight-lipped on his relationship with model Irina Shayk, and in 2019, People confirmed that the couple had officially broken up. Since they share a child, they've obviously remained in contact over the years since, especially during lockdown. In the summer of 2022, it was rumored that they were considering getting back together, and maybe even expanding their family.
Here, a breakdown of the couple‚Äôs private four years together, the suspected rekindling, and their status in 2023 amid Shayk‚Äôs new romance with Tom Brady.
Cooper and Shayk were first spotted together by sleuths for Page Six, who saw the new couple at a performance of Finding Neverland on Broadway. At the time, a source told the paper that it was ‚Äúa friendly relationship‚Äîfor the time being.‚Äù 
A few days later they attended the Vanity Fair-Bloomberg White House Correspondents‚Äô Dinner party in Washington D.C. but reportedly ‚Äúkept any obvious flirting to a minimum.‚Äù
Both Cooper and Shayk had recently come out of long-term relationships. In January, Shayk split with her boyfriend of five years, soccer star Cristiano Ronaldo, after rumors of Ronaldo‚Äôs infidelity became public, while Cooper had ended his two-year relationship with actress Suki Waterhouse in March. 
The first official photos of the couple came the following month when paparazzi found the pair strolling around New York City arm in arm. 
Both Cooper and Shayk attended the Met Gala early in the month, though they arrived and left separately from the high-profile event. Still, Page Six spies reportedly saw them ‚Äúmaking out‚Äù until the wee hours of the morning at Rihanna‚Äôs after party at a nightclub in Manhattan. 
A week later the new couple seemed much more comfortable with their P.D.A. as they were photographed kissing in the daylight hours on the streets of London.
In June, the couple made their Buckingham Palace debut at a dinner for The Prince of Wales‚Äô Charitable Foundation hosted by Prince Charles. According to Us Weekly, Cooper and Shayk were a little confused over what fork to use during the meal, but that didn‚Äôt stop them from enjoying the evening together. A source told the magazine, ‚ÄúIrina is smart and mature. They have a great connection. Bradley needs a girl who can keep up with him.‚Äù 
Later that summer, the couple took a romantic vacation to the Amalfi Coast in Italy, where they were photographed gazing into each others eyes on a rocky beach. If there were any doubts left over their relationship, these photos quickly put them to rest.  
Shayk met Cooper‚Äôs mother, Gloria Campano, over Labor Day Weekend in 2015 as the trio hung out on the beach together in Atlantic City, New Jersey. 
A week later, Shayk and Campano headed out in New York City for a walk with Cooper‚Äôs dog, Charlotte. During this time, a source told E! News, ‚ÄúIrina is just so happy how things are going with Bradley. She adores his mother and they get along great.‚Äù
While the couple wasn‚Äôt prepared to make their relationship red carpet official, they did attend the premiere of Cooper‚Äôs film Burnt together, even inviting both of their mothers to come along.
The couple took the next big step in their relationship the following month, with Cooper moving into Shayk‚Äôs New York apartment. Cooper had previously been checking out apartments in the city, a supposed ‚Äúbachelor pad,‚Äù according to the New York Daily News, but gave up the hunt to move in with Shayk in the West Village. 
Almost a year after they started dating, Cooper and Shayk made their red carpet debut at the L'Oreal Red Obsession party during Paris Fashion Week. Their appearance during fashion week dispelled some burgeoning rumors that the couple had split, and Cooper had moved on to another supermodel, Naomi Campbell.  
A source told Page Six, ‚ÄúBradley and Irina are both friends with Naomi.‚Äù
During Paris Fashion Week, the couple also attended the Opera together for the Arop Charity Gala, where Shayk gave a standing ovation despite everyone else around her being a dud and staying seated. 
The couple attended the 2016 Met Gala together, offering a rare public glimpse into their romantic life as they held hands briefly on the red carpet. 
More rumors of trouble emerged after Cooper and Shayk were seen at Wimbledon in London, where the couple appeared to be arguing, causing Shayk to shed a few tears. However, photos of the couple at the match show them looking smiling, happy, and chatting. Shortly after a video of the alleged fight went viral, reports came out that her tears were just the result of hay fever. Naturally! 
Later in the month, the couple took another Italian vacation, this time hitting the beaches of Lake Garda. 
In November, Us Weekly reported that Shayk and Cooper were expecting their first child. The model showed off her ever-so-slight baby bump while walking the Victoria‚Äôs Secret Fashion Show in Paris. 
First comes a baby, then comes marriage? A new emerald ring on Shayk‚Äôs left hand ignited rumors of an engagement to Cooper, but the couple remained mum on any new changes to their relationship. 
Cooper and Shayk welcomed their first child on March 21, a daughter named named Lea De Seine Shayk Cooper. 
A few months after becoming parents, the couple took a star-studded vacation to Tahiti with Allison Williams, Anderson Cooper, Andy Cohen, and Diane Von Furstenberg. Further proof that if the couple knows how to do anything, it‚Äôs vacation. 
That fall the new parents headed out in L.A. for a family trip to a pumpkin patch in Los Angeles. Shayk walked the dog while Cooper held Lea in a baby carrier.
A few months later, they enjoyed another family outing to Sunset Beach in Los Angeles, where 10-month-old Lea crawled in the sand and sat on her dad‚Äôs shoulders while Shayk looked on smiling. 
The couple made another rare red carpet appearance at the 2018 Met Gala, where Shayk wore the same emerald ring that was spotted on her left hand over a year earlier. Still, neither Cooper or Shayk discussed the engagement rumors.
Later that month, the couple enjoyed a quiet date night, sneaking in a side door for a screening of Solo: A Star Wars Story. Before the film, they spent time mingling with other celebrities like Tiffany Haddish and Ali Hewson.  
The couple turned the Venice Film Festival into a family affair in August. While Cooper was there to promote A Star Is Born, Shayk and daughter Lea accompanied him, being photographed riding on boats and walking around the city.
While press for Cooper‚Äôs Oscar-nominated film A Star Is Born was at an all-time high that fall, rumors of a troubled relationship began to circulate. A source told Page Six, ‚ÄúThey are miserable together. They have been for months. He doesn‚Äôt drink and is into spirituality. She wants to go out.‚Äù 
But rumors be damned! In early December, Cooper showed his support for Shayk, attending the Versace fashion show in New York where the model walked. 
A few weeks later the couple looked happy during a family trip to Disneyland. A source told Us Weekly, ‚ÄúThey were all smiles and looked like they were having such a fun time. When I saw them, they were leaving Disneyland and heading to California Adventure. He was carrying [Lea]. I was walking in between him and [Shayk], so I saw him look back laughing and gesturing for her to come up next to him.‚Äù
The couple started off the new year with a red carpet appearance, attending the Golden Globes together on January 6, where Copper was nominated for Best Director and Best Actor for A Star Is Born.
A couple of days later, Shayk also accompanied Cooper to The National Board of Review Annual Awards Gala, where they were photographed seated at dinner together.
In early February, Shayk explained the couple‚Äôs need for privacy during an interview with Glamour UK. 
‚ÄúI have a lot of friends who share a lot of their personal life on Instagram or social media, very publicly,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúI admire it and I think it‚Äôs great‚Äîbut I think it‚Äôs all about personal choice.‚Äù 
She added: ‚ÄúBecause my work requires me to be out there, I just decided my personal life will be quiet. That‚Äôs why it‚Äôs called personal, because it‚Äôs something for you and your family, and I feel happy with it.‚Äù
Cooper has also explained why he prefers to keep his relationship with Shayk to himself. During a 2017 interview, Howard Stern asked the actor why he wouldn‚Äôt want to flaunt his model girlfriend to the world on red carpets.
‚ÄúYou're right, it's so great to take someone you're with to a place where a hundred people are going to photograph you every step you make and ask you tons of questions, and then rip it apart the next day,‚Äù he replied. ‚ÄúNo, no, no, no, no."
Still, the couple‚Äôs romance seems to be going strong despite their hectic schedules. Shayk attended the Annual Directors Guild Of America Awards on February 2, and during Cooper‚Äôs acceptance speech at the BAFTAs on February 10, he thanked Shayk for ‚Äúputting up with me.‚Äù
‚ÄúI also need to thank Irina for putting up with me while I was trying to make music in our basement for a year,‚Äù he told the audience.
Later at the Oscars, the first hint of scandal emerges, although it is brushed away just as quickly.
Cooper performs "Shallow" with Lady Gaga during the ceremony, and their chemistry-filled duet sparks affair rumors. Both Shayk and Lady Gaga shut them down. 
Shayk debunks them through her actions: She hugged Gaga during the show. And a source told Us Weekly days after that Shayk hadn't been bothered by Cooper and Gaga's big moment because she knew it was acting. ‚ÄúIrina knows that Bradley and Gaga are artists,‚Äù Us's source said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a nonissue for her. They were in character putting on an Oscar performance."
Gaga, meanwhile, tells Jimmy Kimmel that they really were just acting, and it was staged. "Yeah, people saw love, and guess what? That‚Äôs what we wanted you to see," she said. "I mean, this is a love song, 'Shallow.' The movie, A Star Is Born, it's a love story. We worked so hard. We worked all week on that performance."
People reports that after his award season campaign, Cooper has been prioritizing spending time with his family. ‚ÄúSince the awards season ended, Bradley spends every day with his family,‚Äù the outlet's source says. ‚ÄúMost days, Bradley and Irina take Lea out for activities together. Sometimes they just stroll on the beach. Bradley and Irina seem great.‚Äù
Trouble really starts brewing as the month begins. Page Six is the first outlet to report that Cooper and Shayk are on the cusp of breaking up. ‚ÄúBecause of their daughter, they keep trying,‚Äù a source says. ‚ÄúThings are not good. Neither one is happy. The relationship is hanging by a thread.‚Äù
Then The Sun, E!, and Us Weekly join in.
The Sun reports that Shayk has moved out of the home she and Cooper shared in Los Angeles. A source close to the couple tells the outlet that, "Things are cooling off between Bradley and Irina in a big way. They haven‚Äôt been good for a few months and Irina decided it would be best if she moved into her own place. It‚Äôs not looking like there‚Äôs much long left for the two of them together."
E! reports that the two have been "questioning" their relationship for a while. ‚ÄúThings get a little bit better but then they find themselves back in the same place of questioning whether being a couple is what‚Äôs best,‚Äù E!'s source started. ‚ÄúThey want to stay together for their daughter, but neither of them are very happy.‚Äù
"They‚Äôve spent time apart to test the waters and see if they are better off,‚Äù the source continued. ‚ÄúThey have a lot invested and it‚Äôs very difficult to completely walk away from. They are trying out different arrangements and trying to find their way. They love their little girl dearly and that‚Äôs not going to change no matter what.‚Äù
Us Weekly is told by a source that ‚Äúthey aren‚Äôt calling it quits yet, but they are not in a great place.‚Äù But significantly, the outlet reports a source said that Shayk and Cooper's struggles have "nothing to do with Gaga.‚Äù A second source adds that ‚Äúnothing romantic‚Äù happened between Gaga and Cooper when they played each other's love interests in A Star Is Born.
Finally, People reports on June 6 that Cooper and Shayk are officially done. An insider tells the outlet that the two"are amicably working out how to share custody of their daughter Lea De Seine." 
Irina Shayk shared some photos of a family vacation on Instagram, in which she and Cooper are enjoying each other's company and the company of a bunch of feral pigs.
A source told Page Six, ‚ÄúIt was a real family getaway and they are considering getting back together... She would like her daughter to have a sibling.‚Äù
The source continued, ‚ÄúThey both [Bradley and Irina] haven‚Äôt gotten serious with anyone else and they are both into the idea of having a kid... It‚Äôs not Bennifer 2.0 where the other person is always in the back of their head, it‚Äôs more like, ‚Äòwhy not?‚Äô They have to deal with each other anyway since they are parents together. They are both thinking, maybe it‚Äôs time to finally really settle in.‚Äù 
The two ‚Äúget along well and enjoy each other‚Äôs company.‚Äù
During the previous year, Cooper had been linked to Huma Abedin, while Shayk enjoyed brief flings with Vito Schnabel and Kanye West.
In early November, rumors of a reconciliation were stoked even higher by some paparazzi photos of the duo in NYC being described as full of ‚ÄúPDA.‚Äù
They are a little handsy in the photos, with Cooper wrapping an arm around Shayk, and Shayk having her hand on Cooper‚Äôs behind in one shot. Both their arms are wrapped around each other in another. You can see the photos here. 
Later that month, a source told Page Six that Cooper is on board with making another baby together.
‚ÄúHe is on board to expand their family,‚Äù said a source. ‚ÄúThey are trying to get pregnant.‚Äù
However, it seems ‚Äúmarriage is probably not on the table.‚Äù 
The source added, ‚ÄúBradley seems to have a European laissez-faire attitude towards the institution.‚Äù
Reports came out of Shayk dating Tom Brady in late July. A source told Daily Mail that Cooper was not happy about it. ‚ÄúTo say he is not bothered by this would be a lie,‚Äù the source said. ‚ÄúHe has been on and off and on with Irina and he has so much love for her. She is the mother to his girl and they are his two favorite women in the world. He feels that, for the first time, she met someone in Tom that would take her heart away from him forever.‚Äù
Shortly after, Page Six got a very different take from a source. ‚ÄúRight now, he is taking a wait-and-see attitude,‚Äù the source said. ‚Äú[Brady and Shayk] didn‚Äôt declare their love. This could be over in two, three weeks. He isn‚Äôt freaked out. He knew she was going to meet someone.‚Äù
During the last week of August, Cooper and Shayk made headlines for taking a family vacation in Italy. Shayk shared topless photos of both of them on her Instagram. Cooper was also photographed keeping very close to Shayk while on the trip in photos Page Six ran.
A week before, a source told People that Shayk was very happy dating Brady. ‚ÄúHe is her dream guy. She loves dating him,‚Äù the source said. ‚ÄúThey work around their schedules and meet up wherever they can. Irina doesn‚Äôt mind traveling to see him. She is very excited about their relationship.‚Äù
On August 29, a source spoke to Us Weekly about how Tom Brady felt about Shayk and Cooper‚Äôs vacation photos, describing him as unconcerned. ‚ÄúTom has no idea if Irina is still seeing Bradley, but it‚Äôs really none of his business,‚Äù the source said. ‚ÄúTom and Irina aren‚Äôt in a committed relationship, so she‚Äôs free to see anybody she likes.‚Äù
A source told Page Six in mid-September that Shayk was still hoping to marry Cooper someday despite seeing Brady casually. ‚ÄúYears have been put into the relationship,‚Äù the source said of Shayk and Cooper.
One source claimed that Cooper was a little jealous of Shayk and Brady, while another said that‚Äôs not the case at all. ‚Äú[They] haven‚Äôt been together in so long,‚Äù that source said. ‚ÄúThey are co-parents and that‚Äôs that. They are best friends. They are happy. Brad really likes Tom, and there is nothing but support.‚Äù
The outlet reported that Shayk would keep dating Brady if Cooper wasn‚Äôt going to ‚Äúlock things down‚Äù with her.
Cooper and Gigi Hadid were photographed together multiple times at the beginning of the month. Sources described their relationship as ‚Äúcasual‚Äù with ‚Äúattraction‚Äù there. A source spoke to Entertainment Tonight on October 10 about how Shayk felt about Cooper dating Hadid. Especially because it isn‚Äôt serious, it is fine, the source said: She ‚Äúhas no issue with Bradley dating others, especially while things are still casual between Bradley and Gigi.‚Äù
‚ÄúEveryone is mostly open to their former partners moving on,‚Äù the source added, addressing Hadid‚Äôs ex Zayn Malik‚Äôs feelings too.
Alyssa Bailey is the senior news and strategy editor at ELLE.com, where she oversees coverage of celebrities and royals (particularly Meghan Markle and Kate Middleton). She previously held positions at InStyle and Cosmopolitan. When she's not working, she loves running around Central Park, making people take #ootd pics of her, and exploring New York City.
