Plus a little something for the Kens.
If you didn‚Äôt get the chance to deck yourself out in a girly pink ensemble  for the premiere of Barbie, fear not; your next chance is right around the corner! That‚Äôs right‚ÄîBarbie Halloween costumes are the talk of the town. But this time around, we‚Äôve all seen the movie (or most of us, at least), so the references hit a little different.
Like themes of existentialism housed in a candy-colored trojan horse, there‚Äôs a lot to unpack when it comes to Greta Gerwig‚Äôs Barbie movie, but there‚Äôs nothing ambiguous about the bespoke looks served by its stars. From the nostalgic recreations donned by Margot Robbie on the very pink press tour to the custom-designed Chanel ensembles Easter-egged throughout the film, Barbie has satiated fashion enthusiasm and sparked endless brand collaborations riding on the coattails of this brilliant, box office hit. And if you need a refresher for some inspiration, you can now stream Barbie in the comfort of your own home. 
So for Halloween 2023, it‚Äôs only natural to choose whatever ‚ÄúBarbie‚Äù resonates with you the most. This year, Halloween falls in the middle of the week, which means there are two entire weekends to celebrate and dress up in costume. To make things easy on yourself, why not make at least one of the nights Barbie-related? Better yet? Go for a different version of the pop culture icon each night. 
From the stereotypical blonde bombshell doll to her social justice alter ego and counterpart Ken (or Kens) to rollerblading Barbie, cowgirl Barbie, and beyond, you can literally dress up as Barbie for days. Ahead, we‚Äôve pulled the very best pieces below to help you put together the ultimate 2023 Barbie costumes for Halloween. Shop the 12 best Barbie movie costumes below‚Äîirrepressible thoughts of death not included.
This is Barbie, she‚Äôs everything (and she‚Äôs my entire personality right now). She‚Äôs also pretty easy to emulate in costume form; think girly and think pink. Make the most of your copycat ensemble and invest in something you can incorporate as one of your favorite wardrobe pieces well beyond Halloween, such as a quality A-line dress or this pair of Badgley Mischka pumps.
As one of the first on-set Barbie visuals leaked to eager eyes, the Barbie and Ken rollerblading outfits easily make the best costume choice, mostly because the look is easy and instantly recognizable. If you‚Äôre not someone who travels with your rollerblades, try opting for a neon-heeled boot or chunky sneaker instead. If you are going to fully commit to the role, act fast‚Äîthe Impala x Barbie gear is selling out wherever it‚Äôs being sold.
Western Barbie is peak Barbie fashion. You may already have a few of these items represented in your closet (like white cowgirl boots or pink pants), but if not, this costume, fortunately, consists of individual staples that you can likely repurpose and wear again. Add a little bit of sparkle with these top-rated tassel earrings from Revolve.
I‚Äôm not here to insinuate anything about your day-to-day, but aside from the jewelry, you likely won‚Äôt get much use out of this costume‚Äôs sparkly seashell nipple covers or imitation mermaid tail after Halloween is over. So, this is an instance where you want to keep your items on the cheaper side and use make-up‚Äîlike metallic purple eyeliner or sparkly eyeshadow‚Äîto polish off the look.
This Barbie is a social justice warrior, and she‚Äôs here to reclaim her DreamHouse from Mojo Dojo Casa Ken in the name of gender equality. A great group costume, the pink Barbie jumpsuits are actually Greta Gerwig-approved, because the director was spotted in various on-set and behind-the-scenes photos wearing one from Pistola Denim.
In Barbie Land, every night is girls‚Äô night. Send the Kens home and grab your sparkliest garb to recreate dance party Barbie. A little bit of planned choreography wouldn‚Äôt hurt, either.
The catalyst for all to come, black-and-white maillot Barbie was the very first doll to hit shelves in 1959, along with her vintage chevron suit, red lipstick, and cat eye sunglasses. This particular Barbie, created by Ruth Handler, also graces the movie‚Äôs opening scene. For a more modern, Malibu-style Barbie, play around with different shades of pink and perhaps a pair of your favorite mule sandals or kitten heels.
She‚Äôs Weird Barbie, and she‚Äôs always in the splits. If her fondness for Birkenstocks and blunt expressions speaks to you, add a little bit of your own chaos to her costume. Try mismatched earrings, a neon tutu, or highly teased hair. A Guy Fieri wig may also suffice here, and only here.
While this Barbie costume isn‚Äôt featured in the Barbie movie, it was Margot Robbie‚Äôs swoon-worthy London Barbie premiere look‚Äîone that evoked complete nostalgia for the 1960s Enchanted Evening Barbie doll. Or, for younger generations, the 1996 version.
Barbie is the President, she‚Äôs a doctor, an astronaut, a lawyer, a figure-skater, the list goes on. Ask yourself what you wanted to be when you grew up, and then make it Barbie.
He may be ‚Äújust Ken,‚Äù but he‚Äôs still prepared to go head-to-head with Barbie when it comes to style. Sure to be the couples costume of 2023, I better not catch sight of any western Barbie and Ken duos that aren‚Äôt addressing each other with the appropriate ‚ÄúHi, Barbie!‚Äù and ‚ÄúHi, Ken!‚Äù sentiments.
This Ken is...straight out of the Mojo Dojo Casa House. The culmination of Ken‚Äôs patriarchal interpretation, this costume isn‚Äôt quite complete without a trusty steed or a boombox looping Matchbox Twenty‚Äôs ‚ÄúPush‚Äù.

title: How Does the Lessons in Chemistry Series Compare to the Book?
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
Spoilers below.
I know by now not to judge a book by its cover, but diving into Lessons in Chemistry still surprised me after flipping past its bubblegum pink cover and playful design. Set in the 1950s, Bonnie Garmus‚Äô wildly popular debut novel follows protagonist Elizabeth Zott, a lab tech at the prestigious Hastings Research Institute. Her lack of a Ph.D. means she cannot get the respect she deserves‚Äîher all-male team treats her like a glorified maid‚Äîand rampant sexism is far from the only challenge. Amid a sequence of traumatic events, Elizabeth‚Äôs dark tale is also one of resilience, love, community, and career. Can the limited series adaptation of the book capture the richness of the source material?
The short answer is yes, and then some. As with any book-to-screen journey, there are notable differences that take a TV audience into account. Lee Eisenberg‚Äôs Apple TV+ series, starring and produced by Brie Larson, follows the recipe but isn‚Äôt afraid to make some substitutions for a more substantial final dish. That‚Äôs particularly true of some supporting characters and the finer details of Elizabeth‚Äôs journey from lab tech to reluctant host of TV cooking sensation Supper at Six. However, there are some bumps in the road, and a particularly unusual perspective could be divisive‚Äîor at least distracting.  
Just as theLessons in Chemistry book cover is deceptive in its eye-catching flirty illustration, Elizabeth‚Äôs television series is a trojan horse. Supper at Six presents itself as a cooking show for housewives to brush up on their skills in the kitchen, but it also offers tools of empowerment that cannot be found in a recipe book. Still, ambition and romance can co-exist, and neither takes a backseat, in the Apple TV+ period drama as brilliant scientist Dr. Calvin Evans (Lewis Pullman) is the fiery catalyst that ultimately puts Elizabeth on a path to TV stardom out of financial necessity. Below, we break down some of the biggest differences between Bonnie Garmus‚Äô bestselling novel and the series. Check back weekly for updates as new episodes drop. 
Enemies-to-lovers is a tried and tested formula, which both Garmus and Eisenberg understand. In the novel, Elizabeth takes beakers from Calvin‚Äôs personal lab and immediately engages in a war of words with him. The show adds subterfuge to this incident as she sneakily takes a bottle of ribose for her after-hours research. Unfortunately, Elizabeth doesn‚Äôt realize ultimate busybody Fran Frask (Stephanie Koenig) spots and is not afraid to tattle. Book readers will know Calvin assumes Elizabeth is a secretary, as the notion of a female chemist is unheard of to every man who works in this building, which unsurprisingly does not go down well. 
To up the stakes, Elizabeth is practically forced to participate in a cringe-inducing Little Miss Hasting pageant under the guise of being a good team player. This work social replaces a performance of the Mikado from the book as the venue for the great vomit incident. In doing so, it highlights how both are loners within the Hastings employees. Like the novel, Calvin‚Äôs sickness is triggered by perfume, and a humiliated Elizabeth exits the competition early. When he inadvertently pukes all over Elizabeth‚Äôs back, it allows the mortified Calvin to reintroduce himself and apologize for his previous error. 
At first, their relationship remains professional, and the series expands on how Elizabeth‚Äôs past trauma makes it hard for her to feel safe‚Äîparticularly in a room with a shut door. Trust comes from open communication, and an offer to teach Elizabeth how to row becomes part of this process. Whereas in the book, they are already a couple when Calvin takes her out on the water, in the show, it is where they first kiss (instead of the Hastings parking lot). Both versions have Elizabeth initiating the smooch, and Larson and Pulman‚Äôs chemistry is off the charts. 
In this era, it is taboo for an unmarried couple to move in together, and Calvin‚Äôs public proposal in the cafeteria is skipped for something more intimate. Removing the Greek chorus heightens the swoon-worthy festive sequence when Calvin prepares a private feast with Elizabeth and suggests cohabiting. True to the book, the house is paid for (thanks to Calvin‚Äôs successful career), so her incredible cooking will suffice. Elizabeth takes food incredibly seriously: It is an act of love and a method of working through setbacks in her life‚Äîwhich will happen sooner rather than later. 
The second episode, ‚ÄúHer and Him,‚Äù is a cold slap in the face. Yep, Calvin just got hit by a bus, and this isn‚Äôt a Regina George in Mean Girls situation. Book fans will no doubt have been on edge as soon as Calvin grabbed the dog‚Äôs new leash before heading for a run, and what follows is similar‚Äîbut not the same‚Äîto his demise in the novel. 
Calvin is an exercise outlier, as jogging or running didn‚Äôt become popular until the ‚Äô70s. In the novel, Calvin used to run with their pet dog, Six-Thirty, without a leash, and Elizabeth purchased one due to new leash laws. Eisenberg does away with this legal aspect, and here the leash is used so the canine can be Calvin‚Äôs new running buddy. 
Unfortunately, a game of tug of war occurs while Calvin stands on the road, and he falls back with the leash at the exact wrong moment. If anyone was looking for foreshadowing, the alarm bells should start ringing when Calvin starts talking about the unpredictability of life. In the book, Calvin is run over by a police car after he has slipped on oil and hit his head. He falls after the engine has backfired, causing Six-Thrity to bolt while leashed. Whereas this involves an almost-comedic Rube Goldberg machine level of events, there is horrifying simplicity to the bus coming out of nowhere. 
Of all the changes from the source material, the most notable is to Calvin‚Äôs neighbor, Harriet Sloane (Aja Naomi King), who in the book is a middle-aged Catholic white woman with an abusive husband. Rather than simply flip a white character for a Black one, the TV series has rewritten everything about Harriet beyond her name and neighbor status. Harriet has two young children and is similar in age to Elizabeth. Her husband currently serves as a military surgeon in the Korean War, and Calvin is on hand to babysit when needed. Dating this friendship to pre-Elizabeth further fleshes out Calvin and Harriet‚Äôs bond.
Harriet‚Äôs family, relationships, and age are far from the only alterations. She is an ambitious woman who actively tries to save her community using her legal aid expertise. Plans to expand the freeway threaten this neighborhood, and this storyline is based on historical racist infrastructure practices in states like California. This drastic page-to-screen shift before Harriet and Elizabeth meet is impactful because it shows this character isn‚Äôt simply there to serve her neighbor‚Äîthough this friendship is integral to the series. 
In fact, Calvin lets Harriet down in the second episode when he forgets to attend an important meeting about the freeway plans. Harriet knows he holds power as a white man, and his fame as an accomplished scientist is worth its weight in gold to their cause. Instead, Calvin is preoccupied with his burgeoning relationship and work with Elizabeth. Adding this element underscores the myriad ways Black communities are targeted during this time and that, as an ally, words only mean so much when a person doesn‚Äôt follow through. 
Whereas this Harriet storyline is a show invention, Calvin‚Äôs attempts to help Elizabeth bypass sexism at work match the text. She faces misogyny from all sides, and Fran Frask‚Äôs know-it-all demeanor closely follows the book. Fran can‚Äôt wait to put Elizabeth in her place, which is an ugly side of the supposedly forward-thinking scientific institution. Fran‚Äôs fury about Elizabeth skipping out on the pageant further hammers home her antagonistic role early on. The men at Hastings, like Dr. Donatti (Derek Cecil), think Calvin is arrogant and has little time for Elizabeth (even though they often turn to her for work advice). This hostile environment matches the novel‚Äôs description. 
Elizabeth‚Äôs lack of a Ph.D. is a constant criticism, and in the first episode, she doesn‚Äôt get into specifics regarding her unfinished academic record. Again, this is similar to the book, as is what really happened to her, and the series changes what point on Elizabeth‚Äôs academic timeline it happens‚Äîthough in both cases it derails her progress. The second episode opens with a trigger warning, revealing why she hasn‚Äôt got her Ph.D. as a tenured professor raped her. Elizabeth used the pencil in her hair to fend off her attacker, stabbing him and getting reprimanded for her actions. In the novel, a UCLA campus cop doesn‚Äôt buy her story, and in the series, she is told she can only complete her candidacy if she submits a ‚Äúformal statement of regret.‚Äù She rightly cannot abide saying sorry to the man who raped her, and as far as academia is concerned, she only has her Masters degree. In both the book and show, Elizabeth regrets ‚Äúnot having more pencils,‚Äù and this scene speaks to the horrifying obstacles in her career. 
This story will be updated.

text:
Sophie Turner and Priyanka Chopra quietly signaled that they are no longer close, following Turner‚Äôs ongoing divorce from Joe Jonas. Page Six noted that Chopra and Turner unfollowed each other on Instagram. It‚Äôs not exactly clear when it happened, but as of Friday morning, neither is following the other:
However, Turner still follows Chopra‚Äôs husband, Nick Jonas; her ex Joe Jonas; their brother Kevin Jonas; and fellow ‚ÄúJ-sister‚Äù Danielle Jonas. They all follow her back as well.
Turner spoke about her relationship with Chopra and Danielle Jonas in her interview with ELLE in March 2020. Being married to a Jonas Brother, ‚Äúit‚Äôs also nice to have built-in girlfriends, who are actually really cool, who I can hang out with and we can really talk to each other about, like, how crazy the boys‚Äô lives are,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúWe can relate on so many different levels. It‚Äôs like, thank God, because you never know [about your in-laws].‚Äù
‚ÄúWith Pri, especially, it‚Äôs kind of crazy,‚Äù she continued. ‚ÄúYou have to remind yourself that she‚Äôs basically had a 20-year career in Bollywood already. She‚Äôs like the biggest thing in India right now. When we went there for her and Nick‚Äôs wedding, we were treated like royalty. They worship her over there. It‚Äôs kinda crazy. But she‚Äôs just the nicest person, and they live, like, 10 minutes away. And even though Kevin and Danielle live in New Jersey, we see them all the time. It‚Äôs like we‚Äôre all one big family, because the boys are best friends.‚Äù
Chopra, meanwhile, spoke about her relationship with Turner to ELLE UK in July 2019 before Turner‚Äôs wedding to Jonas. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve never had a sister, so it‚Äôs really nice to have Danielle and Sophie, and just inheriting the family by proxy,‚Äù Chopra said. ‚ÄúSophie is super talented, super funny, and we have the most fun when we go out together. She‚Äôs incredible. By the time this comes out, she‚Äôll be the new Mrs Jonas‚ÄìI can‚Äôt wait for her to join the family.‚Äù

title: Love Is Blind Season 6: Everything We Know So Far
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
Ever since the fifth season of Love Is Blind hit Netflix in September, it has served up some serious drama. From juicy love triangles and shocking prior relationships to incredibly awkward vacations and confusing fashion choices, fans couldn't stop talking about the latest chapter of the reality dating show.
But is the series coming back for yet another season? Here‚Äôs what we know so far about Love Is Blind season 6.
Netflix hasn‚Äôt officially announced a sixth season of Love Is Blind, but it seems highly likely that the popular reality show will be coming back. 
In March 2022, Netflix renewed the series for seasons 4 and 5, both of which have now aired. Season 4‚Äôs popularity was evident when the show was streamed for 1.2 billion viewing minutes between April 17 and 23, 2023, hitting number 2 on Nielsen‚Äôs Streaming Top 10 list, per Variety. The season 5 streaming numbers have not yet gone public, but given the series‚Äô wide popularity, a season 6 renewal is probably imminent.
Since there‚Äôs no official renewal news from Netflix as yet, it‚Äôs currently unclear when a sixth season of Love Is Blind might air. 
Looking back at previous seasons of the reality show may offer some clues. While season 3 dropped on Netflix  in October 2022, season 4 arrived in March 2023. Season 5, of course, premiered in September 2023. Could Netflix follow a similar release schedule and give us season 6 in the spring of 2024?
While Netflix has yet to officially renew Love Is Blind for a sixth season, the show has been actively casting for new contestants via its production company, Kinetic Content. A casting call posted in September 2022 encouraged applicants from Charlotte, North Carolina, Washington, D.C., Tampa, Florida, and Detroit, Michigan to apply. Yet another casting call was posted in March 2023, this time asking people to apply if they lived in Minneapolis‚ÄìSaint Paul, Minnesota and Denver, Colorado. Another call-out from Kinetic Content, posted in August 2023, added Phoenix, Arizona and Nashville, Tennessee to the list. 
This could suggest that as many as eight further seasons of Love Is Blind could already be in production, which is potentially good news for fans of the show. Of course, it‚Äôs unclear whether production will actually move forward with filming in all of the cities mentioned. 
One Redditor even theorized that the sixth season of Love Is Blind had already been filmed in Charlotte, North Carolina.
Kinetic Content appears to be actively casting for future seasons of the show, meaning that just about anybody could apply to be a contestant. Industry publication Backstage shared details of the Love Is Blind application process, which starts out with an online application form. If you‚Äôre ready to take the plunge and look for love in the pods, now is the time to apply.
As for who they‚Äôre hoping to cast on the show, Love Is Blind creator Chris Coelen told Entertainment Weekly, ‚ÄúWe want a big enough diversity of people, so we tend to go for bigger metropolitan areas just because you find more people there.‚Äù
During an interview with The Hollywood Reporter, Coelen also revealed that he was toying with the idea of producing a queer version of the series in the future. ‚ÄúSure, I‚Äôd love to,‚Äù he told the publication. ‚ÄúBut you have to think about the logistics of a show. You don‚Äôt want it to be knee-jerk.‚Äù He continued, ‚ÄúIn the straight version of Love Is Blind, you‚Äôve got all the men here and all the women there. Now imagine it was an entirely queer cast. You wouldn‚Äôt produce it the same way. You couldn‚Äôt. Everyone would need to be isolated.‚Äù
For now, at least, we‚Äôll simply have to await Netflix's official announcement regarding the future of Love Is Blind.

title: Director Justine Triet on Anatomy of a Fall, a Courtroom Drama Like No Other
text:
Triet claims her interests are ‚Äúmundane.‚Äù Her latest film, about a woman on trial after her husband‚Äôs mysterious death, is anything but. 
Spoilers ahead. 
At first glance, you could say that Justine Triet‚Äîthe incisive French writer-director of the sensational crime-drama Anatomy of a Fall‚Äîis chiefly interested in stories that follow complex and unknowable women. The main protagonists of her wide-ranging filmography thus far‚Äîfrom Age of Panic‚Äôs journalist Laetitia to the eponymous leads of Victoria and Sibyl, a lawyer and a therapist, respectively‚Äîsuggest as much, as Triet‚Äôs women steer complicated personal and professional lives across comedies and psychodramas alike.
The smash-hit of this year‚Äôs 76th Cannes Film Festival, where it won the Palme d‚ÄôOr, Anatomy of a Fall neatly fits into this observation, too. (Triet  is only the third woman ever to claim the annual gathering‚Äôs grandest prize, after Jane Campion with The Piano in 1993 and Julia Ducournau with Titane in 2021.) With a confident, successful and sexually liberated writer as its central character (Sandra, played by Sandra H√ºller), Triet‚Äôs latest navigates Sandra‚Äôs increasingly complicated existence as she gets tried by the French justice system for the possible killing of her husband (Samuel, played by Samuel Maleski), who dies at the start of the film under mysterious circumstances which could mean an accident, a suicide, or a murder.
So yes, Anatomy of a Fall‚Äîa whodunit, or rather, a ‚Äúdid she do it?‚Äù‚Äîis a welcome addition to Triet‚Äôs growing line of intricate women. But to Triet, who doesn‚Äôt necessarily think of herself as a filmmaker drawn to the most original or sensational topics, there is a more basic common denominator that connects her preoccupations as a storyteller. ‚ÄúI have mundane forms of interest,‚Äù Triet tells ELLE.com over a video interview. ‚ÄúLove or friendship. Friendship particularly is something that I‚Äôm interested in now,‚Äù she continues. ‚ÄúAs I grow older, what matters most to me is [not only] the time spent in the making and thinking of the film, but also the time [spent] to exist in a moment of life with someone. Sometimes, I like to see an efficient little sketch or anecdotal thing on TV. But it isn‚Äôt what I want to create.‚Äù
In a way, these professed interests perfectly sum up Anatomy of a Fall‚Äôs underlying themes. In that regard, you don‚Äôt have to dig too deep to grasp that Triet‚Äôs tightly wound courtroom drama is in fact a brutally honest dissection of love on the one hand‚Äîthe fading love between Sandra and Samuel, as well as the increasingly tricky one between Sandra‚Äôs young son, Daniel (Milo Machado Graner) and his mother, a suspect in the eyes of the law. Similarly, the deposits of friendship, that aforesaid need to stand still with someone, is in the film, too, through Sandra‚Äôs disarming bond with and trust in her kindly friend and attorney, Vincent (Swann Arlaud). Throughout Anatomy of a Fall, all these relationships and allegiances get tested in measured, escalating drips and no relationship feels safe, small or predictably orderly.
Triet always knew the starting point of her story would be the couple, or rather, the story of the couple told in a courtroom, with a host of stakeholders speaking on behalf of Sandra, denying her a narrative of her own. ‚ÄúShe wants to get back her narrative and I used the courtroom drama to tell that story,‚Äù she explains. ‚ÄúBecause everything is magnified and warped a little [in that environment]. Everything that she lived in real life is going through the point of view of the prosecutor. Everyone is there to tell a story, but not the reality, not the truth. So it‚Äôs a nightmare.‚Äù
To make that nightmare more believable, Triet and her co-writer Arthur Harari (Triet‚Äôs spouse in real life) meticulously researched French courtroom dynamics and jargon, trying to free themselves from the cliched Hollywood depictions of trials where people shout out phrases like ‚ÄúObjection your honor!‚Äù a lot. ‚ÄúWe really made a mistake in the beginning and wrote things that are not possible in France,‚Äù she laughs. But then French writer and attorney Vincent Courcelle-Labrousse came to their rescue, helping them hone the legal details. ‚ÄúI spent a lot of time with him in courtroom in France,‚Äù recalls Triet. ‚ÄúIn the end, we took some liberties on little things. But we didn‚Äôt want to do [common things] that we see in other movies.‚Äù
In that, Triet‚Äîa fan of the courtroom drama genre‚Äîdidn‚Äôt draw from its tried and true formula. ‚ÄúWe put everything on the side to create our movie. La V√©rit√©, by Henri-Georges Clouzot, was very interesting to watch after, but [we watched it] after. And I think it‚Äôs different from our movie.‚Äù Triet also wanted to challenge the sterile and tidy depictions of on-screen courtrooms, paying specific cinematic attention to the busy and shifting points of view through which the audience would observe the happenings. ‚ÄúIt was often the kid‚Äôs [point of view], Daniel‚Äôs,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúAnd we were looking for imperfect, accident-y things [instead of] putting the camera somewhere to have a beautiful picture. ‚ÄòUnclean‚Äô is a word I use a lot in French.‚Äù
Both through the courtroom scenes and beyond, it was always a key concern for Triet to preserve Sandra‚Äôs elusiveness, cranking up the reveals about her character gradually in order to maintain a sense of tension and mystery, while allowing Sandra moments of both strength and vulnerability. It was just as vital to keep Daniel‚Äôs shifting point of view at the center of the tale as a young boy starting to have some doubts about his mom‚Äôs innocence. ‚ÄúSandra‚Äôs in a very weird situation. She has to be strong in that courtroom and she has to take care of her child, who wants to know everything,‚Äù Triet remarks. ‚ÄúSo she tries to be very authentic and simple. [For Daniel], it‚Äôs the most difficult position that I think you can [be in], hearing what all these people say about [his parents].‚Äù
Elsewhere, film‚Äôs canine star Messi (this year‚Äôs Palm Dog winner at Cannes, trained by Laura Martin) lent the film an additional and useful point of view to drive the plot forward. ‚ÄúHe was like a mascot in the movie,‚Äù Triet says affectionately. And language became an additional handy tool for Triet to escalate the story‚Äôs anxiety-inducing notes, with Sandra‚Äîa German woman married to a French man and living at his French hometown‚Äîhaving to stand up for herself in a tongue she isn‚Äôt particularly fluent at. ‚ÄúWhen my children were small, and I‚Äôm sure it happens in a lot of families, my partner and I would speak in English so that they wouldn‚Äôt understand what we were saying,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúSo this way to use language as a screen was always interesting to me. It‚Äôs fascinating to think about how a foreigner is placed in an environment where she has to defend herself in a language that isn‚Äôt hers.‚Äù
When the film‚Äôs centerpiece‚Äîits only flashback where we observe Samuel and Sandra in the midst of a stupendously written quarrel sequence‚Äîarrives, one that is used as evidence in court, the spoken language is English, as decided by the couple to be their neutral ground. ‚ÄúIt was the most difficult scene to write,‚Äù Triet remembers. ‚ÄúI think we had sixty versions of that scene.‚Äù It took time to get it perfect, because Triet wasn‚Äôt sure at first how to strike a balance between disclosing enough information about the couple and making the argument interesting. ‚ÄúI was getting bored of [them],‚Äù she recalls. But then the co-writers cracked it when they decided to make the quarrel about a universal concern for all couples: the question of time. ‚ÄúRich people can buy time. Hire a nanny or something. [But these people can‚Äôt.] Many things came, like sexual issues, after we based the argument on time. That she‚Äôs [supposedly] committed a heist on his time and on his creativity. And yes, it‚Äôs the only flashback [scene in the film]. If we didn‚Äôt have that, I think it could have been too theoretical.‚Äù
While the above mentioned sequence is the film‚Äôs‚Äîand one of the year‚Äôs‚Äîmost memorable cinematic experiences, Triet had been afraid of it from the start. ‚ÄúI have to admit something,‚Äù she says, leaning closer. ‚ÄúI [feared] that people would not be with her at that moment. I‚Äôm with her, of course. So I gave her more [dialogue lines] and more weapons than him.‚Äù But at the end, the perfection of the scene was equally thanks to H√ºller‚Äôs exacting performance. ‚ÄúShe understood how to play it, how to be really tough. She‚Äôs a great actress, she knew exactly how to say, "You are not a victim." I had six takes of just that part and I chose the first one,‚Äù Triet says, remembering that H√ºller‚Äôs escalating performance. ‚ÄúAfter that, [Sandra‚Äôs] skin was so wet. She was another person physically. So I kept the first one and I think [she] was perfect.‚Äù
While Triet is no real fan of ambiguity in real life, it‚Äôs what she would like to propel her work with in cinema, as she did with Anatomy of a Fall. ‚ÄúI think the gray zone can be a dangerous space in real life, especially in specific cases and discourses about sexual abuse or else‚Äîso I‚Äôm cautious about outwardly supporting it. In my work, however, I am always interested in working towards complexities and overlapping subjectivities. Precisely because I‚Äôm not a judge. Because it isn‚Äôt my job to clean up a moral situation. I don‚Äôt think I [can] make an edifying film. And so finding spaces of nuance is what my cinema is about.‚Äù
Anatomy of a Fall is now playing in theaters in New York and Los Angeles.

title: These Influential Latinx Fashion Designers Are Paving the Way
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
‚ÄúWe‚Äôre taking over. They don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs coming.‚Äù 
Yesterday afternoon, the Hearst Tower in Midtown Manhattan welcomed some of the most powerful Latinx fashion designers working today: Narciso Rodriguez, Gabriela Hearst, Maria Cornejo, Willy Chavarria, and Fernando Garcia, the co-creative director of Oscar de la Renta and MONSE. They were joined by ELLE‚Äôs editor-in-chief Nina Garcia, along with curators Tanya Mel√©ndez-Escalante and Melissa Marra-Alvarez and artist Ruben Toledo, to discuss the history and bright future of Latinx fashion for our Beauty of Latinx Design summit.
The theme of the talks spanned conversations around politics, sustainability, and craftsmanship, but a central thread was diversity. Not just of ethnicity or nationality, but diversity in thought, elegance, and perception. ‚ÄúOver the years I have observed how Latin creators have stopped being the exception,‚Äù Garcia said in her opening remarks. ‚ÄúOur Latin community is defined by diversity.‚Äù
Mel√©ndez-Escalante and Marra-Alvarez recently worked together on an exhibition at The Museum at FIT called ‚Äú!Moda Hoy!‚Äù that explored past and present Latinx designers. ‚ÄúThere had not been a fashion exhibition that looked at Latin America comprehensively in 25 years,‚Äù Mel√©ndez-Escalante told the audience. The exhibit, which ended in August, featured the works of many of the designers featured in the summit‚Äîalong with several additional ones‚Äîand aimed to not only showcase contemporary works, but also to highlight the continuing legacy of Latin America. ‚ÄúOur biggest intention was that we wanted to highlight that there is not one monolithic Latin style,‚Äù Marra-Alvarez added.
That diversity of design was very apparent when looking at the works of the designers present: Chavarria‚Äôs latest runway show featured a blend of sharp suiting and deconstructed T-shirts that paid homage to Chicano culture; Cornejo‚Äôs designs are oftentimes timeless staples; Oscar de la Renta is known for regal excellence; Hearst‚Äôs sustainable ethos is evident in her lasting designs; and Narciso Rodriguez‚Äôs feminine shapes regularly set the internet aflame.
Despite their differences, these designers have at least one thing in common: their work ethic. ‚ÄúI know that I was not the most talented intern, but I stayed the latest and I worked the hardest,‚Äù Garcia said, reminiscing about his early days in the industry. 
A playfulness and joy is another thread bringing these trailblazers together. ‚ÄúWhen I think of Latinos in America, we‚Äôve had to suffer oppression,‚Äù Chavarria started. ‚ÄúBut the Latin culture has remained resilient. We come back with color and flowers and laughter. We‚Äôre part of such a vibrant culture.‚Äù This was a sentiment echoed across many of the afternoon‚Äôs talks. ‚ÄúIf you‚Äôre not fighting for your survival, you have a duty to have a joyful experience,‚Äù Hearst said, referring to her recent runway show during Paris Fashion Week.
That passion for joy was precisely what led Rodriguez to create what may be considered one of the most iconic garments today: The wedding gown worn by his dear friend, Carolyn Bessette, for her 1996 wedding to John. F. Kennedy Jr. ‚ÄúI couldn‚Äôt navigate that moment,‚Äù Rodriguez said, referencing the major attention his burgeoning brand received overnight. ‚ÄúIt would‚Äôve been a great PR moment for a different company. But it was a great personal moment for me.‚Äù
Authenticity was yet another uniting force for these designers. ‚ÄúI always tried to do things in an authentic way. Maybe it is rebellious, but I didn‚Äôt know another way,‚Äù said Cornejo. It was that quest for creating an authentic experience that led to Hearst‚Äôs inaugural campaign for Chlo√©. Photographed in Mexico, the images featured Mexican model Andi Venegas. ‚ÄúWhen I saw this massive image of a Mexican girl wearing a poncho I thought, ‚ÄòI did something right,‚Äô‚Äù Hearst said, through tears. Her latest show marked the end of her time at the helm of the European brand, but she‚Äôs confident that her legacy will continue. ‚ÄúFor me, it was very important to show that I come from South America. I think we‚Äôre taking over. They don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs coming. Look at the landscape now. I‚Äôm really proud. It‚Äôs a beautiful culture to belong to. And we have a lot to offer.‚Äù

Sneaker culture has hit an all-time high. What once was a subculture reserved for in-the-know hype kids has turned into a global, mainstream phenomenon. (You can thank TikTok, Instagram, and resale sites like StockX, GOAT, and eBay for that.) And one of the most undeniably popular styles in history that continues to reign supreme is the Adidas Samba. Yes, there are the Nike AF1s, the New Balance 990s and 550s, and Adidas top seller, the Stan Smiths, but few sneakers have been comparable to the footprint these low-profile gummy kicks made on the world (no pun intended).
So, why are the Adidas Sambas so popular? The two C‚Äôs to success: celebrity endorsements and collaborations. A collaborative runway debut in 2020 with British menswear designer Grace Wales Bonner reignited this historical shoe which later graced the feet of Bella Hadid, Jennie Kim, Hailey Bieber, Kendall Jenner, Harry Styles, and Frank Ocean, among many others. Plus, Sambas are notoriously comfortable and typically retail for $100 or less, appealing to the masses.
Like most iconic fashion pieces, the Adidas Samba comes with a history, dating back to 1949. Adidas originally designed the shoe as a men‚Äôs soccer sneaker with gum soles for hard surfaces and icy conditions. One year later, the brand officially dubbed the sneaker the Samba, timed to the 1950 FIFA World Cup in Brazil. Since then, the shoe has evolved into what we now know as the Adidas Samba OG.
As with most trending items that center the Venn diagram of comfort, affordability, and style (with bonus points for being celebrity-approved), the Adidas Samba has reached cult status‚Äîwhich also means it‚Äôs sold out nearly everywhere. You‚Äôll likely find a pair on resale sites like Stockx, Kicks Crew, and GOAT, just at a higher-than-retail price. If you prefer to maintain a $100-or-less budget, fret not‚Äîthere are still plenty of Sambas to go around.

title: ELLE Escapes: Savannah
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
Where to go, stay, eat, and drink in the Hostess City of the South.
There‚Äôs no bad time to visit Savannah, Georgia, but spooky season may be the very best. I spent a long weekend in the so-called Hostess City (for its Southern hospitality), and between the drapey curtains of Spanish moss hanging from the tall oaks in Forsyth Park, the tombs in the famed Bonaventure Cemetery, and supposedly real haunted houses and other sites sprinkled throughout, I can‚Äôt imagine a better place to ring in the holiday. (The city was home to the eerie true-crime book and movie, Midnight in the Garden of Good and Evil, for a reason!) 
But Savannah isn‚Äôt all ghosts and goblins. The historic downtown is gorgeous and lush, owing to its 22 grassy squares and stunning mansions. You can spend hours wandering the area (cocktail to-go in hand, thanks to generous open container laws), stopping at museums, shops, and restaurants along the way. End the day with happy hour at a rooftop bar; I recommend The Lost Square and Myrtle & Rose in the recently restored Plant Riverside District. 
That covers day one; now here‚Äôs a rundown on what else to see, eat, drink, and where to stay in Savannah. 
The Georgia Queen is an icon: a huge restored 1800s red and white paddlewheel boat that tours the Savannah River daily. Climb aboard the 38,000-square-foot vessel that includes three ballrooms and head up to the top deck to enjoy the view. You can tour at brunch, lunch, dinner, or my personal favorite: sunset.
This 16,000-square-foot mansion‚Äîone of the largest houses in the city‚Äîwas one of the first two homes in Georgia to be made a state landmark in 1954. The Sorrel‚ÄìWeed House is a prime example of Greek Revival and Regency architecture and has been welcoming visitors on its history tours since 1940. It also has a reputation for being one of the most haunted houses in Savannah and hosts ghosts tours each night. Do I believe in ghosts? No. But was I both thoroughly freaked out and entertained on the tour? Absolutely.
If you have a thing for Spanish moss, Bonaventure Cemetery is your mecca. This sprawling 100-plus-acre cemetery is famous for its unique sculptures and architecture, but also for its lore and the moss-covered, tree-lined boulevards that dissect it. The site was first purchased as a private cemetery in 1846 and became public when the city of Savannah purchased it in 1907. The most-visited grave is a statue of Little Gracie Watson, a six-year-old who died of pneumonia in 1889. 
Bus stations aren‚Äôt necessarily where you might think of eating your next great meal. But if you‚Äôre lucky enough to snag a table at The Grey, a restaurant set in a 1938 Greyhound Bus Terminal that has been carefully restored, its gorgeous original art deco details intact, I can promise it will be by far the best meal you‚Äôll ever have in a former transit hub. That‚Äôs thanks to Mashama Bailey, a two-time James Beard Award-winning chef (and an alumna of NYC‚Äôs Prune) who brings a personal touch to the port city southern recipes she learned from her grandmother and mother, who taught her how to cook. The menu relies on local seasonal ingredients and changes frequently, sometimes even during the course of the dinner service, so I won‚Äôt bother naming specific dishes, but I do recommend putting yourself in Mashama‚Äôs gifted hands and indulging in the five-course ‚Äúchef‚Äôs suggestion‚Äù prix fixe.   
In 1943, Sema Wilkes opened a boarding house in downtown Savannah, housing guests on the top floor and serving family-style meals downstairs. That same tradition carries on today at Mrs. Wilkes Dining Room, where every day hungry visitors pack in elbow to elbow at large communal tables to enjoy all the Southern classics: fried chicken, cornbread, okra gumbo, sweet potato souffl√©, black-eyed peas, macaroni and cheese, and other delicious offerings. 
There are two Collins Quarter locations in Savannah‚Äîone downtown and one in Forsyth Park‚Äîand you can‚Äôt go wrong in either spot. They are most known for their brunch menu, which features inventive dishes like bananas foster french toast, ‚Äúbubble & squeak‚Äù‚Äîa potato pancake on a bed of creamed corn and topped with portobello mushroom, tomato pur√©e, and a poached egg, and ‚Äúswine time beni,‚Äù a fresh take on eggs benedict served on brioche with pulled pork and bacon. 
If you don‚Äôt have a reservation for dinner at The Olde Pink House, which as the name suggests, is a restaurant housed in a stunning colonial bubblegum pink mansion, I suggest hitting the bar downstairs. It serves the same menu, has a darker mood, befitting of the city and the mansion‚Äôs history, and often features live music. The best seat in the house is the private table in the wine cellar. 
Congress Street Up is a speakeasy located within the American Prohibition Museum‚Äîthe only museum in the U.S. devoted to the Prohibition era. You can visit the bar as part of your museum tour during the day when the speakeasy is open to museum guests only, or on Wednesday through Saturday nights when the bar opens to all after 6:30 P.M. All of the cocktails, wines, and beers served have origins tracing back to Prohibition, and the costumed bartenders are happy to offer up history lessons while you sip. They also offer cocktail making classes if you want to learn to mix your own.
The owners of The Lone Wolf Lounge have called it ‚Äúthe Caribbean meets Wisconsin‚Äù and it turns out, that‚Äôs a good combination. The lounge is a cross between a dive bar and a tiki bar; think: dark wood, leather seats, tropical wallpaper, and general Polynesia-meets-basement vibes. Drink names like ‚ÄúNever Rub Another Man‚Äôs Rhubarb‚Äù and ‚ÄúTreating Objects Like Women‚Äù are a nice touch. Tasting them is ever better. 
Checking into The Alida feels more like entering a cool art gallery than it does a hotel. Every detail of the design in this converted riverfront warehouse has been tastefully done: the exposed brick, the original artworks, the mid-century furniture, the bold textiles, the glass and steel elements throughout. The rooms are light and modern and offer either pool or city views, but the real star here are the amenities: not only is there a very photogenic pool, there are bikes you can borrow to cruise around town, complimentary snack and beverage nooks on every floor, and cookies and cocktails in the lobby. Everything I ate at The Rhett, be it brunch or dinner, was delicious, and the hotel‚Äôs bars offer live music most days and DJ pool parties on the weekends.  
Seeing Savannah‚Äôs historic mansions from the outside is one thing, staying in one is a whole other level. The Kehoe House, located on Columbia Square, was built in 1892 by William Kehoe, an Irish immigrant who built a successful iron foundry (you can thank him for the home‚Äôs cast iron exterior stairway, window treatments, columns, fences, and gates). His heirs sold the house in the 1930s and it had various uses in the years that followed, before being opened as a 13-room bed and breakfast in the 1990s. 
A newer arrival on the edge of the Savannah River, the Thompson Savannah opened in the summer of 2021 and features a large pool deck with private cabanas and Bar Julian, the city‚Äôs tallest rooftop bar. Also be sure to stop by Fleeting for seasonal fare and Stevedore Bakery for an impressive selection of sweet and savory treats.  
You‚Äôll be the sweetest of the bunch with this peach-scented perfume. Georgia is known as the peach state, but Krigler uses Mediterranean peaches, jasmine, honey, mandarin, and white musk for a floral, fruity aroma.
A change in climate in addition to a long flight can lead to dehydrated, dull skin. Help your skin recover overnight with this nourishing balm. Nutrient-dense bacuri and kokum seed butters mixed with antioxidant-rich apricot oil locks in moisture so you wake up with healthy, happy skin.  
This highly pigmented, easy-to-use eyeshadow is long-lasting and has the most beautiful shimmer that looks great across all skin tones. What‚Äôs more, it‚Äôs blendable but also transfer- and waterproof. The stick makes it a great travel companion, too.

title: The Fall of the House of Usher Finale Explains Verna‚Äôs Dark Connection to the Family
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
The references to The Cask of Amontillado, Annabel Lee, and The Raven are clear. 
Spoilers below. 
Netflix‚Äôs The Fall of the House of Usher from Mike Flanagan touts itself as a series built on the works of Edgar Allan Poe, and the finale reveals that it‚Äôs as much an adaptation of his famous poem The Raven‚Äîand pieces from Poe‚Äôs short but illustrious life‚Äîas it is of the titular short story. 
Throughout the limited series‚Äô eight episodes, in which Roderick Usher‚Äôs (Bruce Greenwood) entire bloodline mysteriously dies one by one, a peculiar figure named Verna (Carla Gugino) hovers at each death. She‚Äôs a security guard, a potential patient, an employee at a pet adoption clinic, and more‚Äîshapeshifting as needed to drive each of Roderick‚Äôs kids into madness and their eventual death. As Roderick, his twin sister Madeline (Mary McDonnell), and their lawyer-slash-fixer Arthur Pym (Mark Hamill) investigate who she might be, they find her undoctored image throughout history.
So how can this be? Verna, it turns out, is The Raven personified (her name is even an anagram of ‚Äúraven‚Äù). In Poe‚Äôs famous poem, the black bird is largely understood to represent death and loneliness, and Verna‚Äôs appearance at the end of all of the Usher kids' lives is the kiss of death. But her presence is no coincidence. ‚ÄúThe Raven‚Äù (season 1, episode 8) reveals that Roderick and Madeline made a deal with Verna/The Raven many years ago that traded their bloodline‚Äôs lives for success and riches during their lifetime. The Ushers signed a contract that promised Roderick and Madeline an enviable fortune with the price ‚Äúdeferred to the next generation‚Äù in the form of the heirs‚Äô actual lives, choosing a hypothetical short-but-gilded existence for their family instead of seeing their name survive and thrive for posterity. 
With Verna on their side, the Ushers rose to run Fortunato Pharmaceuticals where they developed the drug Ligodone that has infiltrated the world to such a degree, it‚Äôs reminiscent of today‚Äôs opioid crisis. All of Roderick‚Äôs children, including the illegitimate ones, have enjoyed a life of luxury and no responsibility‚Äîa gilded life, you could argue‚Äîand the company has seen no legal repercussions, just as Verna promised. 
All eight of the Netflix series‚Äô episodes are framed by Roderick‚Äôs conversation with Auguste ‚ÄúAuggie‚Äù Dupin (Carl Lumbly)‚Äîthe detective who has taken a personal vendetta against the family largely due to Roderick‚Äôs backstabbing when they were younger men‚Äîas he nears the end of his life. As Roderick‚Äôs health declines and his family is picked off, he finally gives Auggie what he‚Äôd been working for his whole life: a confession. 
He comes clean about the truth behind his children‚Äôs deaths, the secret deal with Verna, and that he and Madeline secretly killed the former Fortunato CEO by chaining him up and sealing him behind a brick wall √† la Poe‚Äôs short story The Cask of Amontillado (which explains the jester that haunted Roderick, as they placed a jester Halloween mask on him before trapping him in the wall). He even concedes that he didn‚Äôt deserve his wife Annabel Lee, whom he hallucinates seeing at his children‚Äôs funeral. But most of all, he confesses that he knew exactly how harmful the drugs he was peddling were‚Äîthe exact reason Auggie had been tailing him all these years. 
But in accordance with the deal, as Roderick‚Äôs life comes to an end with his dementia diagnosis, so too must all of his family‚Äôs. Roderick‚Äôs deal with the devil doesn‚Äôt only affect his thankless kids. His granddaughter Lenore, whom he often refers to as ‚Äúthe best of us,‚Äù isn‚Äôt spared by The Raven. Verna tells Lenore that her mother will survive the acid burns she suffered after attending Prospero‚Äôs illicit warehouse party and go on to do great things in her name before The Raven kills Lenore earlier in the day. The Raven even targets Arthur Pym after he attempts to capture her at the Usher home with an offer for absolution once the Ushers are gone, but he chooses to test his fate and is arrested by series end. 
Near the end of ‚ÄúThe Raven,‚Äù Roderick isn‚Äôt the only Usher left standing; his sister Madeline is still alive, hidden in the basement after an altercation between the two prior to Auggie‚Äôs arrival. Madeline delivers a treatise on capitalism to justify everything they did at Fortunato, but when she gets up to leave she finds she‚Äôs been poisoned by her brother. Roderick attacks her and gauges her eyes out, replacing them with blue stones and uttering the famous phrase, ‚Äúnevermore.‚Äù 
Similar to The Fall of the House of Usher short story, Madeline‚Äôs half-alive body later emerges from the basement and attacks her brother. She strangles him just as the House of Usher begins to literally fall around them. Auggie escapes just as the house collapses and when he visits their graves later, he remarks that he is the richest man of all because he has a loving family. Tying up loose ends, Juno (Roderick‚Äôs latest Ligodone-addicted wife) gets control of both Fortunato and her life by weaning off of the drug and dissolving the company once and for all, and turning its remains into a center for addiction recovery. 
Verna/The Raven arrives at the cemetery just after Auggie leaves and, in a voiceover, recites Poe‚Äôs ‚ÄúSpirits of the Dead‚Äù poem as she places one token on each of their tombstones. Briefly perching atop the graves, The Raven then takes flight, on to her next target.

title: A Complete Timeline of Justin and Hailey Bieber‚Äôs Relationship
text:
The A-list musician and supermodel-turned-skincare mogul are one of Hollywood‚Äôs leading power couples.
Justin Bieber and Hailey Baldwin dated on and off long before they became husband and wife. Hailey first met Justin in the late aughts, and they eventually struck up a casual romance. Though they decided to keep it out of the public eye, this didn't stop fans from obsessing over their relationship. After a breakup and  surprise reconciliation-turned-whirlwind engagement two years later, Justin officially made Hailey his Mrs. during a September 2018 New York City courthouse ceremony. They got married in front of friends and family in a more formal wedding a year later.
From their highly-publicized South Carolina nuptials to their parenting plans, here‚Äôs the couple's full history and how their relationship has evolved.
Hailey has her father, Stephen, to thank for introducing her to her future husband. There‚Äôs even footage of their first meeting, which took place backstage at The Today Show. Hailey and Justin‚Äìthen in their teens‚Äìshared a brief handshake and the rest, as they say, is history.
Chaperoned by her father yet again, Hailey attended the New York City premiere of Justin's documentary Never Say Never. Later that month, Justin confirmed his relationship with Selena Gomez when the couple made their red carpet debut at Vanity Fair‚Äôs Oscar After Party.
Hailey officially declared herself a member of the Jelena fan club. The model took to Twitter, sharing her support for the couple. ‚ÄúI don't care what anyone says but Justin Bieber and Selena Gomez together is the definition of a teenage dream! #word,‚Äù Hailey wrote.
After calling it quits with Selena, Justin was photographed attending church services at Hillsong alongside Hailey and fellow supermodel Kendall Jenner. It wasn‚Äôt long before fans began speculating that Hailey and Justin were an item. 
Hailey denied any romantic connection between her and Justin. She set the record straight during an interview with E! News. ‚ÄúI've known [Justin] since I was like 13‚Äîand we've just been good friends over the years,‚Äù Hailey said. ‚ÄúWe have just stayed close, and there's nothing more to it than that."
Justin backed up Hailey‚Äôs statement in an Instagram post. The singer shared a snap of himself and Hailey, writing ‚ÄúI'm super single and this is my good friend u would know otherwise.‚Äù
Hailey joined Justin and his family on vacation in Anguilla, fueling rumors that their friendship was actually something more.
Justin made his romance with Hailey Instagram official. Shortly after New Year‚Äôs Day, he shared a photo of them kissing.
Hailey and Justin revealed that their relationship was casual. "We are not an exclusive couple,‚Äù Hailey told E!. Meanwhile, in an interview with GQ, Justin called Hailey ‚Äúsomeone I really love,‚Äù but he added that he didn‚Äôt ‚Äúwant to be held down by anything.‚Äù
Hailey and Justin ended their brief fling. According to People, Justin also unfollowed Hailey on Instagram amid his new relationship with Sofia Richie. 
Following their split, Hailey and Justin completely lost touch for almost two years. In 2020, Hailey shared her thoughts on their time apart: ‚ÄúOur lives seemed to be going in very different directions,‚Äù she told ELLE. ‚ÄúI actually think‚Äînow that I look back at it being married‚Äîthat it was a good thing for the two of us, very healthy.‚Äù
During Justin and Hailey's rift, the singer rekindled his romance with Selena   in November 2017. However, by March 2018, Jelena was over for good.
Hailey revealed that she was speaking to Justin again. ‚ÄúWe went through a long period of time when we weren‚Äôt friends,‚Äù she told The Times UK. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve moved past that.‚Äù
Justin and Hailey appeared as if they were back together. After sharing some PDA at a religious conference, they were spotted together at LIV nightclub in Miami. Just days later, they were photographed holding hands and kissing in New York City.
After rumors of the couple‚Äôs engagement began to swirl, Justin confirmed the news on Instagram. He posted two sweet portraits with his new fianc√©e and penned a lengthy caption devoted to her. ‚ÄúHailey I am soooo in love with everything about you,‚Äù he wrote. ‚ÄúSo committed to spending my life getting to know every single part of you.‚Äù
Hailey joined the love fest, tweeting, ‚ÄúNot sure what I did in life to deserve such happiness but I am so utterly grateful to God for giving me such an incredible person to share my life with!‚Äù 
Just two months after their engagement, TMZ photographed the couple walking into New York City‚Äôs Marriage Bureau. The next day, People claimed that Hailey and Justin obtained their marriage license, officially making them husband and wife. 
Meanwhile, Hailey dismissed the gossip on Twitter: ‚ÄúI understand where the speculation is coming from, but I‚Äôm not married yet!‚Äù
The couple finally confirmed their marriage status. Justin shared an Instagram photo of him and Hailey with the caption ‚ÄúMy wife is awesome.‚Äù The following day, Hailey changed her last name to Bieber on all of her social media accounts.
TMZ broke the news that a second wedding was imminent after the date was moved several times. The outlet acquired a photo of a save the date card, which revealed that the ceremony would take place on September 30 in South Carolina.
Mr. and Mrs. Bieber officially tied the knot‚Ä¶again! People disclosed the details of their ceremony, which took place at Somerset Chapel in Bluffton, South Carolina. Vows (and Tiffany & Co. wedding bands) were exchanged ‚Äúas the sun set.‚Äù The star-studded guest list included Kendall Jenner, Camila Morrone, and Jaden Smith, among others.
A day later, Justin basked in wedded bliss as he shared photos from the couple‚Äôs reception.
The Biebers continued to share photos from their big day. Hailey put her Off-White by Virgil Abloh wedding dress on full display, including her elaborate train, which read ‚Äú'till death do us part." Justin wore a Celine tuxedo.
Weeks later, the newlyweds found themselves embroiled in Jelena fan drama, after Justin‚Äôs ex dropped her new single ‚ÄúLose You To Love Me.‚Äù The track captured Selena‚Äôs feelings moving on from her 10-year on-off romance with Bieber and closing that chapter. 
Shortly after the song came out, Hailey upset some Jelena fans when she posted an Instagram Story, where she shared that she was listening to Summer Walker‚Äôs ‚ÄúI‚Äôll Kill You.‚Äù Hailey denied that this was a dig at Selena. Commenting beneath JustJared‚Äôs Instagram post she said, ‚Äúplease stop with this nonsense. There is no 'response.‚Äô This is complete BS.‚Äù
Selena, meanwhile, told her fans on Instagram Live to not attack Hailey. ‚ÄúI am grateful for the response that the song is getting. I'm so grateful,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúHowever, I do not stand for women tearing women down. And I will never, ever be by that. So please be kind to everyone. It doesn't matter what the situation is. If you're my fans, don't be rude to anybody, please. Don't go off and say things that you just feel in the moment. And just please, from me, know that that's not my heart. My heart is only to release things that I feel that are me and that I'm proud of. And that's all that I'll say, yeah.‚Äù
Hailey tried to shut down feud rumors herself when she liked Selena‚Äôs Instagram post promoting ‚ÄúLose You To Love Me.‚Äù A source close to the Biebers also assured E! that things were copacetic. ‚ÄúIt isn't ideal for Hailey,‚Äù the insider told the outlet, ‚Äúbut she understands the creative process of writing music and that Justin had a past. Justin and Hailey both want Selena to be happy and in a good place and aren't fazed by it."
Justin rang in the decade with his new single ‚ÄúYummy,‚Äù which details his sex life with Hailey.
Hailey landed the March 2020 cover of ELLE. She spoke candidly about the couple‚Äôs decision to delay their South Carolina ceremony for a year. ‚ÄúWhen we first got married, we were just figuring out our life together,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúI felt like putting a wedding in the middle of all of that would be really hectic and stressful.‚Äù
Although the Biebers aren‚Äôt ready for children yet, Hailey is already thinking about parenting. Amid worldwide protests in solidarity with Black Lives Matter, Hailey discussed her outlook on motherhood. Regarding her future children, she told Vogue India, ‚ÄúThey will be raised knowing how to treat people, why we don‚Äôt say certain things, and why we respect and acknowledge and give credit where credit is due.‚Äù
The Biebers attended their first Met Gala as husband and wife. Hailey stunned in a Saint Laurent column gown and matching wayfarer sunglasses. Justin paired his sleek suit with customized Nike sneakers.
Hailey and Justin appeared on the In Good Faith with Chelsea & Judah Smith podcast, where they discussed the challenges they faced in their first year of marriage. At the time, Justin was battling with severe bouts of depression. Hailey admitted that watching her partner struggle wasn't easy.
‚ÄúThere were days where I literally was like, ‚ÄòI don‚Äôt know if he‚Äôs going to be okay.‚Äô Something really deep down inside of me was like, ‚ÄòHe‚Äôs going to get through it.‚Äô I just didn‚Äôt know how long it was going to take. That‚Äôs what I think was the hardest thing. There‚Äôs no guarantees," she said.
Nevertheless, Hailey was determined to stick by her husband: "Imagine abandoning somebody in the middle of the worst time of their life, potentially. I‚Äôm not that type of person," she added. 
Amid the launch of her now-viral skincare line Rhode, Hailey did an interview with WSJ Magazine. The entrepreneur shared her thoughts on having children. ‚ÄúI think ideally in the next couple of years we would try. But there‚Äôs a reason they call it try, right?‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt know how long that process is ever going to take. Definitely no kids this year; that would be a little bit hectic, I think.‚Äù
Hailey also revealed her decision to stop discussing her marriage in interviews. "It doesn‚Äôt feel worth it to me anymore," she explained. "I try to have an open conversation with someone, and then it gets taken out of context." 
Hailey was hospitalized after having stroke-like symptoms, though she fortunately fully recovered. Her health scare left Justin reasonably shaken, with a source close to the couple telling People, ‚Äú[He] is probably more traumatized than even she is. When it happened, there was a lot of panic. Justin texted everyone he knew and asked everyone to pray for her, and he never left her side. He was saying that he can‚Äôt lose her, that whatever it takes, he wanted the best medical treatment available.‚Äù
Justin later discussed the situation during one of his concerts. ‚ÄúYou know, it‚Äôs kind of crazy how life throws you curveballs,‚Äù he said during a Denver performance. "Most of you probably know or seen the news about my wife ‚Ä¶but she‚Äôs okay, she‚Äôs good, she‚Äôs strong. It‚Äôs been really scary. But I know for a fact that God has her in the palms of his hands, and that‚Äôs a good thing.‚Äù 
Hailey accompanied her husband at the Grammys. She opted for a flowy strapless gown, which led some fans to speculate that she was hiding a growing baby bump. After RadarOnline published an Instagram post about the rumors, Hailey swiftly shut them down. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not pregnant leave me alone,‚Äù she commented.
Just months after Hailey's hospitalization, Justin had a health scare of his own. A virus called Ramsay Hunt syndrome left half of the singer's face paralyzed, but he eventually recovered. A source told People that although this year has been ‚Äúoverwhelming‚Äù for the couple, relationship-wise, ‚Äúthey're unbreakable.‚Äù
During an interview with Good Morning America, Hailey shared a promising update on her husband's health. ‚ÄúHe is getting better every single day. He‚Äôs feeling a lot better and, obviously, it was just a very scary and random situation to happen, but he‚Äôs going to be totally okay, and I‚Äôm just grateful that he‚Äôs fine,‚Äù she said.
Ahead of the couple's fourth anniversary, Hailey discussed her relationship with Justin in Harper's Bazaar. ‚Äú[Justin's] still the person that I wanna be rushing back to,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúI might fly somewhere and go do a job, but I can‚Äôt wait to come back and hang out. And I feel like that‚Äôs because of the effort that‚Äôs been put in on both sides. At the end of the day, like, he‚Äôs my best friend, but it still does take a lot of work to make it work.‚Äù
Hailey appeared on the Call Her Daddy podcast. In a conversation with Alexandra Cooper, Hailey insisted that she never ‚Äústole‚Äù Justin from Selena, and that it's "not [her] character to mess with someone's relationship." She also confirmed that Justin had already ‚Äúclosed a chapter‚Äù with Selena before he rekindled things with her in 2018.
Hailey went on to discuss her seemingly speedy engagement to Justin, which took place just two months after they began dating again. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm like, ‚Äòyeah, that seemed really drastic and really crazy,‚Äô‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúBut that was what we felt was a decision between the two of us, and it felt correct for the two of us of us at the time, and clearly, we were right because here we are, four years later.‚Äù 
Hailey and Selena posed for pictures together at the Academy Museum Gala, proving once and for all that there is no drama between them. A source informed People about Justin's reaction to the news. ‚Äú[He's] very happy with the fact that they can all move on and that it can be peaceful between everyone,‚Äù the source said.
Of Hailey and Selena's motivation, a source told Entertainment Tonight, ‚ÄúSelena and Hailey were both super chill together at the Academy Museum Gala. They've both moved on and are happy in their own lives. They wanted to show the world that there's no beef or bad feelings between them anymore.‚Äù
A source gave Entertainment Tonight a brief update on Hailey and Justin's relationship as 2022 closed out. ‚ÄúHailey and Justin are doing incredible as a couple,‚Äù the source said. ‚ÄúThey are each other's rocks. They make sure they're there for each other for whatever each of them needs and show their support for one another.‚Äù 
‚ÄúThey have so much love and passion in their relationship and share the same beliefs and values, so it's easy for them to get along,‚Äù the insider continued. ‚ÄúThey love doing pretty much everything together, especially traveling.‚Äù The couple ended their year by traveling to Aspen and celebrating the start of 2023 with Kendall and Kylie Jenner.
Justin interviewed Hailey for Vogue Australia. He asked her what her favorite part of being married is.  ‚ÄúMmm ... My favorite thing about being married is honestly the companionship I feel we have,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúGenuinely, you are my best friend in the entire world. There‚Äôs nobody I would rather spend more time with or do anything with.‚Äù
Hailey posted a birthday tribute to Justin, ignoring the ongoing TikTok discourse about her history with Selena Gomez. She wrote to her husband, ‚Äú29 never looked so good ‚ò∫Ô∏èHappy Birthday to you best friend! Words couldn‚Äôt possibly sum up all that you embody. So here‚Äôs to more joy, more travel, yummy food, adventures, more peace, fun, and most of all more love. ‚ú®ü•≥‚Äù
Justin didn't comment on the TikTok drama but shared a tribute to Hailey to assert his love for her. ‚ÄúLUV U BABY,‚Äù he wrote.
Hailey and Gomez shared statements on March 24, asking for the fan bullying to stop. Hailey wrote:
On Friday, April 28, Hailey and Justin went to lunch in outfits that turned out to be their uniforms for the weekend. For their lunch date, Hailey wore a yellow polo crop top with wide legged jean, a small leather handbag, and tiny sunglasses. She had her bob hair brush down sleekly around her face. Her husband was in a hoodie and New Balance sneakers.  
The following day, Hailey styled a similar look when the couple headed to a Rhode pop-up event at Los Angeles cafe Community Goods. Once again, she went with a short-sleeved crop top, this time in white, and wide-legged jeans with a black belt. She paired the look with square-toe kitten heels in beige. Justin went for a hoodie again as well, this time in grey. Also at the event were Hailey's friends Justine Skye and Lori Harvey. 
Amid reports of Justin possibly splitting from longterm manager Scooter Braun, a source told Page Six on August 20 that Hailey was playing a bigger role in his business affairs.
‚ÄúHailey has taken control and is heavily involved. She‚Äôs a part of meetings and she‚Äôs talking a lot for him,‚Äù the source said. ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs the voice. They‚Äôre becoming this power couple. She‚Äôs a big part of everything he‚Äôs doing.‚Äù
The couple was regularly photographed out together during summer 2023.
On August 28, Justin went viral for wearing sweatpants while Hailey was in a red minidress at an event both attended to promote her Rhode Beauty and Krispy Kreme doughnut collaboration. 
Justin then posted a couple Instagrams featuring him and Hailey together. In one shot, he appears wearing a sweatshirt with her name on it while showing PDA with her.
The Biebers marked their fifth wedding anniversary with Instagram tributes.
Justin‚Äôs was longer. The singer wrote to Hailey, ‚ÄúTo the most precious, my beloved. 5 years. You have captivated my heart. I know from the depths of my soul down to my bones that this journey with you will only exceed our wildest expectations. So let‚Äôs keep dreaming big baby. Cheers to forever and ever. I love you with every fiber of my being. HAPPY 5TH YEAR ANNIVERSARY!!!‚Äù
Hailey, meanwhile, wrote to Justin, ‚Äú5 ‚ú®ü§ç I love you.‚Äù
The couple attended a Victoria Mon√©t concert together wearing coordinated oversized black leather jackets. Justin shared several pictures in which he is smiling with his wife and friend Mon√©t. He called the evening a ‚Äúdate night‚Äù in the caption.
On October 15, TMZ reported that Justin commissioned a piece of artwork for his wife that looks like it was inspired by a meaningful text. It was produced by Idiot Box Art owners Emily Bright and Tamara Martin, who said the piece cost $5,000. The 3' by 3' image made from wood and resin is supposedly a text Hailey sent Justin while he was away. In it, she lists everything she misses about him including his ‚Äújokes‚Äù and ‚Äúmaking love.‚Äù
Hannah Malach is an assistant producer at Hearst Magazines, where she covers entertainment news, the royals, and more for brands including Cosmopolitan, Elle, and Harper‚Äôs Bazaar. She‚Äôs previously written for Billboard, WWD, and The Hollywood Reporter. If she‚Äôs not catching up on the latest season of RuPaul‚Äôs Drag Race, you can probably find her curled up with a good book or exploring one of New York City‚Äôs many museums.
